Text

ï»¿TREASURE ISLAND

by [Robert Louis Stevenson]60-robert louis stevenson

To S.L.O. , [an American gentleman]172-an american gentleman in accordance with whose classic taste the following narrative has been designed , it is now , in return for numerous delightful hours , and with the kindest wishes , dedicated by [[his]172-an american gentleman affectionate friend]173-his affectionate friend , [the author]174-the author .

TO [THE HESITATING PURCHASER

If sailor]175-the hesitating purchaser if sailor tales to sailor tunes , Storm and adventure , heat and cold , If schooners , [islands]176-islands , and maroons , And [buccaneers , and buried gold]177-buccaneers , and buried gold , And all the old romance , retold Exactly in the ancient way , Can please , as [me]0-i [they]178-they pleased of old , [The wiser youngsters of today]179-the wiser youngsters of today :

So be it , and fall on ! If not , If [studious youth]180-studious youth no longer crave , [His]180-studious youth ancient appetites forgot , [Kingston]61-kingston , or [Ballantyne the brave , Or Cooper of the wood and wave]181-ballantyne the brave , or cooper of the wood and wave : So be it , also ! And may [I]0-i And all [[my]0-i pirates]182-my pirates share the grave Where these and [their]182-my pirates creations lie !

[TREASURE ISLAND]1-treasure island

PART ONE [The Old Buccaneer]183-the old buccaneer

1

The Old Sea - dog at the [Admiral Benbow

SQUIRE TRELAWNEY]62-the admiral benbow , [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey , and [the rest of [these gentlemen]185-these gentlemen]184-the rest of these gentlemen having asked [me]0-i to write down the whole particulars about [Treasure Island]1-treasure island , from the beginning to the end , keeping nothing back but [the bearings of [the island]187-the island]186-the bearings of the island , and that only because there is still treasure not yet lifted , [I]0-i take up [my]0-i pen in the year of grace 17 and go back to the time when [[my]0-i father]188-my father kept [the Admiral Benbow inn]189-the admiral benbow inn and [the brown old seaman with the sabre cut]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut first took up [[his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut lodging under [our]192-our roof]191-his lodging under our roof . [I]0-i remember [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut as if it were yesterday , as [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut came plodding to [the inn]193-the inn door , [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut sea - chest following behind [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut in a hand - barrow [a tall , strong , heavy , nut - brown man]194-a tall , strong , heavy , nut - brown man , [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut tarry pigtail falling over the shoulder of [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut soiled blue coat , [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut hands ragged and scarred , with black , broken nails , and the sabre cut across one cheek , a dirty , livid white . [I]0-i remember [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut looking round the cover and whistling to [himself]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut as [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut did so , and then breaking out in that old sea - song that [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut sang so often afterwards : " [Fifteen men on [the dead man]2836-the dead man]2835-fifteen men on the dead man 's chest Yo - ho - ho , and a bottle of rum ! "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] in the high , old tottering voice that seemed to have been tuned and broken at the capstan bars . Then [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut rapped on the door with a bit of stick like a handspike that [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut carried , and when [[my]0-i father]188-my father appeared , called roughly for a glass of rum . This , when it was brought to [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut , [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut drank slowly , like [a connoisseur]196-a connoisseur , lingering on the taste and still looking about [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut at [the cliffs]197-the cliffs and up at [our]198-our signboard . " This is [a handy cove]2837-a handy cove , "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] says [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut at length ; " and [a pleasant sittyated grog - shop]2838-a pleasant sittyated grog - shop . Much company , [mate]2839-mate ? "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] [[My]0-i father]188-my father told [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut no , very little company , the more was the pity . " Well , then , "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] said [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut , " this is [the berth]2840-the berth for [me]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut . Here [you]200-the man who trundled the barrow , [matey]2841-matey , "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut cried to [the man who trundled the barrow]200-the man who trundled the barrow ; " bring up alongside and help up [my]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut chest . [I]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut 'll stay [here]2842-here a bit , "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut continued . " [I]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut 'm [a plain man]2843-a plain man ; rum and bacon and eggs is what [I]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut want , and that head up there for to watch [ships]2844-ships off . What [you]200-the man who trundled the barrow mought call [me]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut ? [You]200-the man who trundled the barrow mought call [me]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut [captain]2845-captain . Oh , [I]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut see what [you]200-the man who trundled the barrow 're at [there]2846-there "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] ; and [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut threw down three or four gold pieces on the threshold . " [You]200-the man who trundled the barrow can tell [me]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut when [I]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut 've worked through that , "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] says [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut , looking as fierce as [a commander]201-a commander . And indeed bad as [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut clothes were and coarsely as [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut spoke , [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut had none of the appearance of [a man who sailed before the mast]202-a man who sailed before the mast , but seemed like [a mate]203-a mate or [skipper accustomed to be obeyed or to strike]204-skipper accustomed to be obeyed or to strike . [The man who came with the barrow]205-the man who came with the barrow told [us]206-we the mail had set [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut down the morning before at [the Royal George]2-the royal george , that [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut had inquired what [inns]207-inns [there]2846-there were along [the coast]209-the coast , and hearing [ours]206-we well spoken of , [I]0-i suppose , and described as lonely , had chosen [it]210-it from the others for [[his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut place of residence]211-his place of residence . And that was all [we]206-we could learn of [[our]206-we guest]212-our guest . [He]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut was [a very silent man by custom]213-a very silent man by custom . All day [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut hung round [the cove]214-the cove or upon [the cliffs]197-the cliffs with a brass telescope ; all evening [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut sat in a corner of [the parlour]216-the parlour next the fire and drank rum and water very strong . Mostly [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut would not speak when spoken to , only look up sudden and fierce and blow through [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut nose like a fog - horn ; and [we]206-we and [the people who came about [[our]206-we house]218-our house]217-the people who came about our house soon learned to let [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut be . Every day when [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut came back from [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut stroll [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut would ask if [any seafaring men]219-any seafaring men had gone by along [the road]220-the road . At first [we]206-we thought it was the want of company of [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut own kind that made [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut ask this question , but at last [we]206-we began to see [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut was desirous to avoid [them]219-any seafaring men . When [a seaman]221-a seaman did put up at [the Admiral Benbow]62-the admiral benbow as now and then [some]222-some did , making by [the coast road]223-the coast road for [Bristol]12-bristol [he]221-a seaman would look in at [him]221-a seaman through the curtained door before [he]221-a seaman entered [the parlour]216-the parlour ; and [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut was always sure to be as silent as a mouse when any such was present . For [me]0-i , at least , there was no secret about the matter , for [I]0-i was , in a way , [a sharer in [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut alarms]225-a sharer in his alarms . [He]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut had taken [me]0-i aside one day and promised [me]0-i a silver fourpenny on the first of every month if [I]0-i would only keep [my]0-i " weather - eye open for [a seafaring man with one leg]2847-a seafaring man with one leg "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] and let [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut know the moment [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut appeared . Often enough when the first of the month came round and [I]0-i applied to [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut for [my]0-i wage , [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut would only blow through [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut nose at [me]0-i and stare [me]0-i down , but before the week was out [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut was sure to think better of it , bring [me]0-i [my]0-i four - penny piece , and repeat [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut orders to look out for " [the seafaring man with one leg]2848-the seafaring man with one leg . "[190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut] How [that personage]226-that personage haunted [my]0-i dreams , [I]0-i need scarcely tell [you]227-you . On stormy nights , when the wind shook the four corners of [the house]228-the house and the surf roared along [the cove]214-the cove and up [the cliffs]197-the cliffs , [I]0-i would see [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut in a thousand forms , and with a thousand diabolical expressions . Now the leg would be cut off at the knee , now at the hip ; now [he]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut was [a monstrous kind of a creature who had never had but the one leg , and that in the middle of [his]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut body]231-a monstrous kind of a creature who had never had but the one leg , and that in the middle of his body . To see [him]190-the brown old seaman with the sabre cut leap and run and pursue [me]0-i over hedge and [ditch]232-ditch was the worst of nightmares . And altogether [I]0-i paid pretty dear for [my]0-i monthly fourpenny piece , in the shape of these abominable fancies . But though [I]0-i was so terrified by the idea of [the seafaring man with one leg]2848-the seafaring man with one leg , [I]0-i was far less afraid of [the captain]234-the captain [himself]234-the captain than [anybody else who knew [him]234-the captain]235-anybody else who knew him . There were nights when [he]234-the captain took a deal more rum and water than [his]234-the captain head would carry ; and then [he]234-the captain would sometimes sit and sing [his]234-the captain wicked , old , wild sea - songs , minding [nobody]236-nobody ; but sometimes [he]234-the captain would call for glasses round and force [all the trembling company]237-all the trembling company to listen to [his]234-the captain stories or bear a chorus to [his]234-the captain singing . Often [I]0-i have heard [the house]228-the house shaking with " Yo - ho - ho , and a bottle of rum , "[234-the captain] all [the neighbours]239-the neighbours joining in for dear life , with the fear of death upon [them]239-the neighbours , and [each singing louder than the other]240-each singing louder than the other to avoid remark . For in these fits [he]234-the captain was [the most overriding companion ever known]241-the most overriding companion ever known ; [he]234-the captain would slap [his]234-the captain hand on the table for silence all round ; [he]234-the captain would fly up in a passion of anger at a question , or sometimes because none was put , and so [he]234-the captain judged [the company]242-the company was not following [his]234-the captain story . Nor would [he]234-the captain allow [anyone]243-anyone to leave [the inn]193-the inn till [he]234-the captain had drunk [himself]234-the captain sleepy and reeled off to bed . [His]234-the captain stories were what frightened [people]245-people worst of all . Dreadful stories they were about hanging , and walking the plank , and storms at [sea]246-sea , and the Dry Tortugas , and wild deeds and places on [the Spanish Main]247-the spanish main . By [his]234-the captain own account [he]234-the captain must have lived [his]234-the captain life among [some of [the wickedest men that [God]65-god ever allowed upon [the sea]250-the sea]249-the wickedest men that god ever allowed upon the sea , and the language in which [he]234-the captain told these stories shocked [[our]251-us plain country people]252-our plain country people]248-some of the wickedest men that god ever allowed upon the sea , and the language in which he told these stories shocked our plain country people almost as much as the crimes that [he]234-the captain described . [[My]0-i father]188-my father was always saying [the inn]193-the inn would be ruined , for [people]245-people would soon cease coming [there]2846-there to be tyrannized over and put down , and sent shivering to [their]245-people beds ; but [I]0-i really believe [his]234-the captain presence did [us]251-us good . [People]245-people were frightened at the time , but on looking back [they]245-people rather liked it ; it was a fine excitement in [a quiet country life]258-a quiet country life , and there was even [a party of [the younger men]260-the younger men who pretended to admire [him]234-the captain]259-a party of the younger men who pretended to admire him , calling [him]234-the captain a " true sea - dog "[234-the captain] and [a " real old salt "]2849-a " real old salt "[234-the captain] and such like names , and saying there was [the sort of man that made [England]4-england terrible at [sea]246-sea]261-the sort of man that made england terrible at sea . In one way , indeed , [he]234-the captain bade fair to ruin [us]251-us , for [he]234-the captain kept on staying week after week , and at last month after month , so that all the money had been long exhausted , and still [[my]0-i father]188-my father never plucked up the heart to insist on having more . If ever [he]234-the captain mentioned it , [the captain]234-the captain blew through [his]234-the captain nose so loudly that [you]265-you might say [he]234-the captain roared , and stared [[my]0-i poor father]266-my poor father out of [the room]267-the room . [I]0-i have seen [him]234-the captain wringing [his]234-the captain hands after such a rebuff , and [I]0-i am sure the annoyance and the terror [he]234-the captain lived in must have greatly hastened [his]234-the captain early and unhappy death . All the time [he]234-the captain lived with [us]251-us [the captain]234-the captain made no change whatever in [his]234-the captain dress but to buy some stockings from [a hawker]269-a hawker . One of the cocks of [his]234-the captain hat having fallen down , [he]234-the captain let it hang from that day forth , though it was a great annoyance when it blew . [I]0-i remember the appearance of [his]234-the captain coat , which [he]234-the captain patched [himself]234-the captain upstairs in [[his]234-the captain room]270-his room , and which , before the end , was nothing but patches . [He]234-the captain never wrote or received a letter , and [he]234-the captain never spoke with any but [the neighbours]239-the neighbours , and with these , for the most part , only when drunk on rum . The great sea - chest none of [us]251-us had ever seen open . [He]234-the captain was only once crossed , and that was towards the end , when [[my]0-i poor father]266-my poor father was far gone in a decline that took [him]234-the captain off . [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey came late one afternoon to see [the patient]273-the patient , took a bit of dinner from [[my]0-i mother]274-my mother , and went into [the parlour]216-the parlour to smoke a pipe until [his]63-dr. livesey horse should come down from [the hamlet]276-the hamlet , for [we]251-us had no stabling at [the old Benbow]62-the admiral benbow . [I]0-i followed [him]234-the captain in , and [I]0-i remember observing the contrast [the neat , bright doctor]277-the neat , bright doctor , with [his]234-the captain powder as white as snow and [his]234-the captain bright , black eyes and pleasant manners , made with [the coltish country folk]278-the coltish country folk , and above all , with [that filthy , heavy , bleared scarecrow of a pirate of ours]279-that filthy , heavy , bleared scarecrow of a pirate of ours , sitting , far gone in rum , with [his]234-the captain arms on the table . Suddenly [he]234-the captain [the captain]234-the captain , that is began to pipe up [his]234-the captain eternal song : " Fifteen men on [the dead man]2836-the dead man 's chest Yo - ho - ho , and a bottle of rum ! Drink and the devil had done for the rest Yo - ho - ho , and a bottle of rum ! "[234-the captain] At first [I]0-i had supposed " [the dead man]2836-the dead man 's chest "[234-the captain] to be that identical big box of [[his]63-dr. livesey upstairs]281-his upstairs in [the front room]282-the front room , and the thought had been mingled in [my]0-i nightmares with that of [the one - legged seafaring man]283-the one - legged seafaring man . But by this time [we]284-we had all long ceased to pay any particular notice to the song ; it was new , that night , to [nobody]236-nobody but [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey , and on [him]63-dr. livesey [I]0-i observed it did not produce an agreeable effect , for [he]63-dr. livesey looked up for a moment quite angrily before [he]63-dr. livesey went on with [his]63-dr. livesey talk to [old Taylor]66-old taylor , [the gardener]286-the gardener , on a new cure for the rheumatics . In the meantime , [the captain]234-the captain gradually brightened up at [his]234-the captain own music , and at last flapped [his]234-the captain hand upon the table before [him]234-the captain in a way [we]284-we all knew to mean silence . The voices stopped at once , all but [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey 's ; [he]234-the captain went on as before speaking clear and kind and drawing briskly at [his]234-the captain pipe between every word or two . [The captain]234-the captain glared at [him]234-the captain for a while , flapped [his]234-the captain hand again , glared still harder , and at last broke out with a villainous , low oath , " Silence , there , between [decks]2852-decks ! "[234-the captain] " Were [you]234-the captain addressing [me]289-the doctor , [sir]2853-sir ? "[289-the doctor] says [the doctor]289-the doctor ; and when [the ruffian]290-the ruffian had told [him]234-the captain , with another oath , that this was so , " [I]289-the doctor have only one thing to say to [you]2853-sir , [sir]2853-sir , "[289-the doctor] replies [the doctor]289-the doctor , " that if [you]2853-sir keep on drinking rum , [the world]2855-the world will soon be quit of [a very dirty scoundrel]2856-a very dirty scoundrel ! "[289-the doctor] [The old fellow]292-the old fellow 's fury was awful . [He]234-the captain sprang to [his]234-the captain feet , drew and opened [a sailor]293-a sailor 's clasp - knife , and balancing it open on the palm of [his]234-the captain hand , threatened to pin [the doctor]289-the doctor to the wall . [The doctor]289-the doctor never so much as moved . [He]289-the doctor spoke to [him]234-the captain as before , over [his]289-the doctor shoulder and in the same tone of voice , rather high , so that all [the room]267-the room might hear , but perfectly calm and steady : " If [you]234-the captain do not put that knife this instant in [your]234-the captain pocket , [I]289-the doctor promise , upon [my]289-the doctor honour , [you]234-the captain shall hang at the next assizes . "[289-the doctor] Then followed a battle of looks between [them]297-them , but [the captain]234-the captain soon knuckled under , put up [his]234-the captain weapon , and resumed [his]234-the captain seat , grumbling like a beaten dog . " And now , [sir]2853-sir , "[289-the doctor] continued [the doctor]289-the doctor , ' since [I]0-i now know there 's [such a fellow in [[my]0-i district]301-my district]300-such a fellow in my district , [you]234-the captain may count [I]0-i 'll have an eye upon [you]234-the captain day and night . [I]0-i 'm not [a doctor]302-a doctor only ; [I]0-i 'm [a magistrate]303-a magistrate ; and if [I]0-i catch a breath of complaint against [you]234-the captain , if it 's only for a piece of incivility like tonight 's , [I]0-i 'll take effectual means to have [you]234-the captain hunted down and routed out of this . Let that suffice . " Soon after , [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey 's horse came to the door and [he]63-dr. livesey rode away , but [the captain]234-the captain held [his]234-the captain peace that evening , and for many evenings to come .[67-black dog]

2

[Black Dog]67-black dog Appears and [Disappears]68-disappears

IT was not very long after this that there occurred the first of the mysterious events that rid [us]304-our at last of [the captain]234-the captain , though not , as [you]306-you will see , of [his]234-the captain affairs . It was a bitter cold winter , with long , hard frosts and heavy gales ; and it was plain from the first that [[my]0-i poor father]266-my poor father was little likely to see the spring . [He]266-my poor father sank daily , and [[my]0-i mother]274-my mother and [I]0-i had all the inn upon [our]304-our hands , and were kept busy enough without paying much regard to [[our]304-our unpleasant guest]309-our unpleasant guest . It was one January morning , very early a pinching , frosty morning [the cove]214-the cove all grey with hoar - frost , the ripple lapping softly on the stones , the sun still low and only touching [the hilltops]311-the hilltops and shining far to seaward . [The captain]234-the captain had risen earlier than usual and set out down [the beach]313-the beach , [his]234-the captain cutlass swinging under the broad skirts of the old blue coat , [his]234-the captain brass telescope under [his]234-the captain arm , [his]234-the captain hat tilted back upon [his]234-the captain head . [I]0-i remember [his]234-the captain breath hanging like smoke in [his]234-the captain wake as [he]234-the captain strode off , and the last sound [I]0-i heard of [him]234-the captain as [he]234-the captain turned the big rock was a loud snort of indignation , as though [his]234-the captain mind was still running upon [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey . Well , [mother]314-mother was [upstairs]315-upstairs with [father]316-father and [I]0-i was laying the breakfast - table against [the captain]234-the captain 's return when the parlour door opened and [a man]318-a man stepped in on whom [I]0-i had never set [my]0-i eyes before . [He]318-a man was [a pale , tallowy creature , wanting two fingers of the left hand]319-a pale , tallowy creature , wanting two fingers of the left hand , and though [he]318-a man wore a cutlass , [he]318-a man did not look much like [a fighter]320-a fighter . [I]0-i had always [my]0-i eye open for [seafaring men]321-seafaring men , with one leg or two , and [I]0-i remember this one puzzled [me]0-i . [He]318-a man was not sailorly , and yet [he]318-a man had a smack of [the sea]250-the sea about [him]318-a man too . [I]0-i asked [him]318-a man what was for [his]318-a man service , and [he]318-a man said [he]318-a man would take rum ; but as [I]0-i was going out of [the room]267-the room to fetch it , [he]318-a man sat down upon a table and motioned [me]0-i to draw near . [I]0-i paused where [I]0-i was , with [my]0-i napkin in [my]0-i hand . " Come here , [sonny]2859-sonny , "[318-a man] says [he]318-a man . " Come nearer here . "[0-i] [I]0-i took a step nearer . " Is this here table for [[my]318-a man mate]2860-my mate [Bill]69-bill ? "[318-a man] [he]318-a man asked with a kind of leer . [I]0-i told [him]318-a man [I]0-i did not know [[his]318-a man mate]324-his mate [Bill]69-bill , and this was for [a person who stayed in [[our]326-we house whom [we]326-we called [the captain]234-the captain]327-our house whom we called the captain]325-a person who stayed in our house whom we called the captain . " Well , "[318-a man] said [he]318-a man , " [[my]318-a man mate]2860-my mate [Bill]69-bill would be called [the captain]234-the captain , as like as not . [He]234-the captain has a cut on one cheek and a mighty pleasant way with [him]234-the captain , particularly in drink , has [[my]318-a man mate]2860-my mate [Bill]69-bill . [We]326-we 'll put it , for argument like , that [[your]0-i captain]2864-your captain has a cut on one cheek and [we]326-we 'll put it , if [you]0-i like , that that cheek 's the right one . Ah , well ! [I]318-a man told [you]0-i . Now , is [[my]318-a man mate]2860-my mate [Bill]69-bill in [this here house]2866-this here house ? "[318-a man] [I]0-i told [him]329-he [he]329-he was out walking . " Which way , [sonny]2859-sonny ? Which way is [he]329-he gone ? "[0-i] And when [I]0-i had pointed out the rock and told [him]329-he how [the captain]234-the captain was likely to return , and how soon , and answered a few other questions , " Ah , "[329-he] said [he]329-he , " this 'll be as good as drink to [[my]329-he mate]2860-my mate [Bill]69-bill . "[329-he] The expression of [his]329-he face as [he]329-he said these words was not at all pleasant , and [I]0-i had [my]0-i own reasons for thinking that [the stranger]331-the stranger was mistaken , even supposing [he]329-he meant what [he]329-he said . But it was [no affair of [mine]0-i]332-no affair of mine , [I]0-i thought ; and besides , it was difficult to know what to do . [The stranger]331-the stranger kept hanging about just inside [the inn]193-the inn door , peering round the corner like a cat waiting for a mouse . Once [I]0-i stepped out [myself]0-i into [the road]220-the road , but [he]331-the stranger immediately called [me]0-i back , and as [I]0-i did not obey quick enough for [his]331-the stranger fancy , a most horrible change came over [his]329-he tallowy face , and [he]331-the stranger ordered [me]0-i in with an oath that made [me]0-i jump . As soon as [I]0-i was back again [he]331-the stranger returned to [his]331-the stranger former manner , half fawning , half sneering , patted [me]0-i on the shoulder , told [me]0-i [I]0-i was [a good boy]336-a good boy and [he]331-the stranger had taken quite a fancy to [me]0-i . " [I]331-the stranger have [a son of [my]331-the stranger own]2869-a son of my own , "[331-the stranger] said [he]331-the stranger , " as like [you]0-i as two blocks , and [he]2869-a son of my own 's all the pride of [my]331-the stranger ' art . But the great thing for [boys]2870-boys is discipline , [sonny]2859-sonny discipline . [I]0-i was very uneasy and alarmed , as [you]340-you may fancy , and it rather added to [my]0-i fears to observe that [the stranger]331-the stranger was certainly frightened [himself]331-the stranger . [He]331-the stranger cleared the hilt of [his]331-the stranger cutlass and loosened the blade in the sheath ; and all the time [we]339-we were waiting [there]2846-there [he]331-the stranger kept swallowing as if [he]331-the stranger felt what [we]339-we used to call a lump in the throat . At last in strode [the captain]234-the captain , slammed the door behind [him]331-the stranger , without looking to the right or left , and marched straight across [the room]267-the room to where [his]331-the stranger breakfast awaited [him]331-the stranger . " [Bill]69-bill , "[331-the stranger] said [the stranger]331-the stranger in a voice that [I]0-i thought [he]331-the stranger had tried to make bold and big . [The captain]234-the captain spun round on [his]234-the captain heel and fronted [us]339-we ; all the brown had gone out of [his]234-the captain face , and even [his]234-the captain nose was blue ; [he]234-the captain had the look of [a man who sees a ghost , or the evil one]347-a man who sees a ghost , or the evil one , or something worse , if anything can be ; and upon [my]0-i word , [I]0-i felt sorry to see [him]234-the captain all in a moment turn so old and sick . " Come , [Bill]69-bill , [you]69-bill know [me]331-the stranger ; [you]69-bill know [an old shipmate]2876-an old shipmate , [Bill]69-bill , surely , "[331-the stranger] said [the stranger]331-the stranger . [The captain]234-the captain made a sort of gasp . " [Black Dog]67-black dog ! "[234-the captain] said [he]234-the captain . " And who else ? "[350-the other] returned [the other]350-the other , getting more at [his]350-the other ease . " [Black Dog]67-black dog as ever was , come for to see [[his]67-black dog old shipmate]2877-his old shipmate [Billy]69-bill , at [the Admiral Benbow inn]189-the admiral benbow inn . "[67-black dog] When [I]0-i returned with the rum , [they]352-we were already seated on either side of [the captain]234-the captain 's breakfast - table [Black Dog]67-black dog next to the door and sitting sideways so as to have one eye on [[his]67-black dog old shipmate]2877-his old shipmate and one , as [I]0-i thought , on [his]67-black dog retreat . " None of [your]0-i keyholes for [me]234-the captain , [sonny]2859-sonny , "[234-the captain] [he]234-the captain said ; and [I]0-i left [them]352-we together and retired into [the bar]355-the bar . " No , no , no , no ; and an end of it ! "[234-the captain] [he]234-the captain cried once . And again , " If it comes to swinging , swing all , say [I.]234-the captain "[234-the captain] Then all of a sudden there was a tremendous explosion of oaths and other noises the chair and table went over in a lump , a clash of steel followed , and then a cry of pain , and the next instant [I]0-i saw [Black Dog]67-black dog in full flight , and [the captain]234-the captain hotly pursuing , both with drawn cutlasses , and [the former streaming blood from the left shoulder]358-the former streaming blood from the left shoulder . [You]363-you may see the notch on the lower side of the frame to this day . That blow was the last of the battle . [The captain]234-the captain , for [his]234-the captain part , stood staring at the signboard like [a bewildered man]367-a bewildered man . Then [he]234-the captain passed [his]234-the captain hand over [his]234-the captain eyes several times and at last turned back into [the house]228-the house . " [Jim]70-jim , "[234-the captain] says [he]234-the captain , " rum "[234-the captain] ; and as [he]234-the captain spoke , [he]234-the captain reeled a little , and caught [himself]234-the captain with one hand against the wall . " Are [you]234-the captain hurt ? "[369-i.] cried [I.]369-i. " Rum , "[234-the captain] [he]234-the captain repeated . " [I]234-the captain must get away from [here]2842-here . Rum ! Rum ! "[234-the captain] [I]0-i ran to fetch it , but [I]0-i was quite unsteadied by all that had fallen out , and [I]0-i broke one glass and fouled the tap , and while [I]0-i was still getting in [my]0-i own way , [I]0-i heard a loud fall in [the parlour]216-the parlour , and running in , beheld [the captain]234-the captain lying full length upon the floor . [I]0-i got the rum , to be sure , and tried to put it down [his]234-the captain throat , but [his]234-the captain teeth were tightly shut and [his]234-the captain jaws as strong as iron . 3

[The Black Spot]393-the black spot

ABOUT noon [I]0-i stopped at [the captain]234-the captain 's door with some cooling drinks and medicines . [He]289-the doctor was lying very much as [we]395-we had left [him]289-the doctor , only a little higher , and [he]289-the doctor seemed both weak and excited . " [Jim]70-jim , "[289-the doctor] [he]289-the doctor said , " [you]70-jim 're the only one here that 's worth anything , and [you]70-jim know [I]289-the doctor 've been always good to [you]70-jim . Never a month but [I]289-the doctor 've given [you]70-jim a silver fourpenny for [yourself]70-jim . And now [you]70-jim see , [mate]2839-mate , [I]289-the doctor 'm pretty low , and deserted by all ; and [Jim]70-jim , [you]70-jim 'll bring [me]289-the doctor one noggin of rum , now , wo n't [you]70-jim , [matey]2841-matey ? "[289-the doctor] " [The doctor]289-the doctor "[0-i] [I]0-i began . But [he]289-the doctor broke in cursing [the doctor]289-the doctor , in a feeble voice but heartily . " [Doctors]2902-doctors is [all swabs]2903-all swabs , "[289-the doctor] [he]289-the doctor said ; " and [that doctor]2904-that doctor there , why , what do [he]2904-that doctor know about [seafaring men]321-seafaring men ? [I]289-the doctor been in places hot as pitch , and mates dropping round with [Yellow Jack]73-jack , and [the blessed land]2906-the blessed land a - heaving like [the sea]250-the sea with earthquakes what to [the doctor]289-the doctor know of [lands like that]2909-lands like that ? and [I]289-the doctor lived on rum , [I]289-the doctor tell [you]70-jim . It 's been meat and drink , and [man]2910-man and [wife]2911-wife , to [me]289-the doctor ; and if [I]289-the doctor 'm not to have [my]289-the doctor rum now [I]289-the doctor 'm [a poor old hulk on [a lee shore]2913-a lee shore]2912-a poor old hulk on a lee shore , [my]289-the doctor blood'll be on [you]70-jim , [Jim]70-jim , and [that doctor swab]2914-that doctor swab "[289-the doctor] ; and [he]397-i ran on again for a while with curses . " Look , [Jim]70-jim , how [my]397-i fingers fidges , "[397-i] [he]397-i continued in the pleading tone . " [I]397-i ca n't keep 'em still , not [I.]397-i [I]397-i have n't had a drop this blessed day . [That doctor]2904-that doctor 's [a fool]2916-a fool , [I]397-i tell [you]70-jim . If [I]397-i do n't have a drain o ' rum , [Jim]70-jim , [I]397-i 'll have the horrors ; [I]397-i seen some on 'em already . [I]397-i seen [old Flint]74-flint in the corner there , behind [you]70-jim ; as plain as print , [I]397-i seen [him]2904-that doctor ; and if [I]397-i get the horrors , [I]397-i 'm [a man that has lived rough]2917-a man that has lived rough , and [I]397-i 'll raise [Cain]75-cain . [[Your]70-jim doctor]2918-your doctor hisself said one glass would n't hurt [me]397-i . [I]397-i 'll give [you]70-jim a golden guinea for a noggin , [Jim]70-jim . "[397-i] [He]398-i was growing more and more excited , and this alarmed [me]0-i for [[my]0-i father]188-my father , who was very low that day and needed quiet ; besides , [I]0-i was reassured by [the doctor]289-the doctor 's words , now quoted to [me]0-i , and rather offended by the offer of a bribe . " [I]0-i want none of [your]398-i money , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " but what [you]398-i owe [[my]0-i father]188-my father . [I]0-i 'll get [you]398-i one glass , and no more . "[0-i] When [I]0-i brought it to [him]398-i , [he]398-i seized it greedily and drank it out . " Aye , aye , "[398-i] said [he]398-i , " that 's some better , sure enough . And now , [matey]2841-matey , did [that doctor]2904-that doctor say how long [I]398-i was to lie here in [this old berth]2922-this old berth ? "[398-i] " A week at least , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [Thunder]76-thunder ! "[398-i] [he]398-i cried . " A week ! [I]398-i ca n't do that ; [they]2923-they 'd have the black spot on [me]398-i by then . [The lubbers]2924-the lubbers is going about to get the wind of [me]398-i this blessed moment ; lubbers as could n't keep what [they]2924-the lubbers got , and want to nail what is another 's . Is that seamanly behaviour , now , [I]398-i want to know ? But [I]398-i 'm [a saving soul]2925-a saving soul . [I]398-i never wasted good money of [mine]398-i , nor lost it neither ; and [I]398-i 'll trick 'em again . [I]398-i 'm not afraid on 'em . [I]398-i 'll shake out another reef , [matey]2841-matey , and daddle 'em again . "[398-i] As [he]398-i was thus speaking , [he]398-i had risen from bed with great difficulty , holding to [my]0-i shoulder with a grip that almost made [me]0-i cry out , and moving [his]398-i legs like so much dead weight . [His]398-i words , spirited as they were in meaning , contrasted sadly with the weakness of the voice in which they were uttered . [He]398-i paused when [he]398-i had got into a sitting position on the edge . " [That doctor]2904-that doctor 's done [me]398-i , "[398-i] [he]398-i murmured . " [My]398-i ears is singing . Lay [me]398-i back . "[398-i] Before [I]0-i could do much to help [him]398-i [he]398-i had fallen back again to [his]398-i former place , where [he]398-i lay for a while silent . " [Jim]70-jim , "[398-i] [he]398-i said at length , " [you]70-jim saw [that seafaring man]2928-that seafaring man today ? "[398-i] " [Black Dog]67-black dog ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " Ah ! [Black Dog]67-black dog , "[398-i] says [he]398-i . " [HE]67-black dog 'S [a bad un]2929-a bad un ; but there 's worse that put [him]67-black dog on . Now , if [I]398-i ca n't get away nohow , and [they]2930-they tip [me]398-i the black spot , mind [you]70-jim , it 's [my]398-i old sea - chest [they]2930-they 're after ; [you]70-jim get on a horse [you]70-jim can , ca n't [you]70-jim ? Well , then , [you]70-jim get on a horse , and go to well , yes , [I]398-i will ! to [that eternal doctor swab]2931-that eternal doctor swab , and tell [him]2931-that eternal doctor swab to pipe all hands magistrates and sich and [he]2931-that eternal doctor swab 'll lay 'em aboard at the Admiral Benbow all [[old Flint]74-flint 's crew]2932-old flint 's crew , [man]2910-man and [boy]2934-boy , all on 'em that 's left . [I]398-i was [first mate]2935-first mate , [I]398-i was , [[old Flint]74-flint 's first mate]2936-old flint 's first mate , and [I]398-i 'm the on'y one as knows [the place]2937-the place . [He]74-flint gave it [me]398-i at [Savannah]5-savannah , when [he]74-flint lay a - dying , like as if [I]398-i was to now , [you]0-i see . But [you]0-i wo n't peach unless [they]2938-they get the black spot on [me]398-i , or unless [you]0-i see that Black Dog again or [a seafaring man with one leg , [Jim]70-jim [him]70-jim above all]2939-a seafaring man with one leg , jim him above all . "[398-i] " But what is the black spot , [captain]2845-captain ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " That 's a summons , [mate]2839-mate . [I]0-i 'll tell [you]401-you if [they]2938-they get that . But [you]401-you keep [your]401-you weather - eye open , [Jim]70-jim , and [I]0-i 'll share with [you]401-you equals , upon [my]0-i honour . "[0-i] [He]401-you wandered a little longer , [his]401-you voice growing weaker ; but soon after [I]0-i had given [him]401-you [his]401-you medicine , which [he]401-you took like [a child]402-a child , with the remark , " If ever [a seaman]221-a seaman wanted drugs , it 's [me]0-i , "[0-i] [he]401-you fell at last into a heavy , swoon - like sleep , in which [I]0-i left [him]401-you . What [I]0-i should have done had all gone well [I]0-i do not know . Probably [I]0-i should have told the whole story to [the doctor]289-the doctor , for [I]0-i was in mortal fear lest [the captain]234-the captain should repent of [his]234-the captain confessions and make an end of [me]0-i . But as things fell out , [[my]0-i poor father]266-my poor father died quite suddenly that evening , which put all other matters on one side . [Our]406-our natural distress , the visits of [the neighbours]239-the neighbours , the arranging of the funeral , and all the work of [the inn]193-the inn to be carried on in the meanwhile kept [me]0-i so busy that [I]0-i had scarcely time to think of [the captain]234-the captain , far less to be afraid of [him]234-the captain . [He]234-the captain got [downstairs]373-downstairs next morning , to be sure , and had [his]234-the captain meals as usual , though [he]234-the captain ate little and had more , [I]0-i am afraid , than [his]234-the captain usual supply of rum , for [he]234-the captain helped [himself]234-the captain out of the bar , scowling and blowing through [his]234-the captain nose , and [no one]411-no one dared to cross [him]234-the captain . On the night before the funeral [he]234-the captain was as drunk as ever ; and it was shocking , in [that house of mourning]412-that house of mourning , to hear [him]234-the captain singing away at [his]234-the captain ugly old sea - song ; but weak as [he]234-the captain was , [we]413-we were all in the fear of death for [him]234-the captain , and [the doctor]289-the doctor was suddenly taken up with a case many miles away and was never near [the house]228-the house after [[my]0-i father]188-my father 's death . [I]0-i have said [the captain]234-the captain was weak , and indeed [he]234-the captain seemed rather to grow weaker than regain [his]234-the captain strength . [He]234-the captain clambered up and down [stairs]418-stairs , and went from [the parlour]216-the parlour to [the bar]355-the bar and back again , and sometimes put [his]234-the captain nose out of doors to smell [the sea]250-the sea , holding on to the walls as [he]234-the captain went for support and breathing hard and fast like [a man on [a steep mountain]423-a steep mountain]422-a man on a steep mountain . [He]234-the captain never particularly addressed [me]0-i , and it is [my]0-i belief [he]234-the captain had as good as forgotten [his]234-the captain confidences ; but [his]234-the captain temper was more flighty , and allowing for [his]234-the captain bodily weakness , more violent than ever . [He]234-the captain had an alarming way now when [he]234-the captain was drunk of drawing [his]234-the captain cutlass and laying it bare before [him]234-the captain on the table . But with all that , [he]234-the captain minded [people]245-people less and seemed shut up in [his]234-the captain own thoughts and rather wandering . Once , for instance , to [our]425-our extreme wonder , [he]234-the captain piped up to a different air , a kind of country love - song that [he]234-the captain must have learned in [his]234-the captain youth before [he]234-the captain had begun to follow [the sea]250-the sea . So things passed until , the day after the funeral , and about three o'clock of a bitter , foggy , frosty afternoon , [I]0-i was standing at the door for a moment , full of sad thoughts about [[my]0-i father]188-my father , when [I]0-i saw [someone drawing slowly near along the road]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road . [He]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road was plainly blind , for [he]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road tapped before [him]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road with a stick and wore a great green shade over [his]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road eyes and nose ; and [he]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road was hunched , as if with age or weakness , and wore a huge old tattered sea - cloak with a hood that made [him]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road appear positively deformed . [I]0-i never saw in [my]0-i life [a more dreadful - looking figure]429-a more dreadful - looking figure . [He]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road stopped a little from [the inn]193-the inn , and raising [his]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road voice in an odd sing - song , addressed the air in front of [him]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road , " Will [any kind friend]2943-any kind friend inform [a poor blind man , who has lost the precious sight of [his]2944-a poor blind man , who has lost the precious sight of his eyes in the gracious defence of his native country eyes in the gracious defence of [[his]2944-a poor blind man , who has lost the precious sight of his eyes in the gracious defence of his native country native country]2945-his native country]2944-a poor blind man , who has lost the precious sight of his eyes in the gracious defence of his native country , [England]4-england and God bless [King George]77-george ! where or in what part of [this country]2946-this country [he]2944-a poor blind man , who has lost the precious sight of his eyes in the gracious defence of his native country may now be ? "[428-someone drawing slowly near along the road] " [You]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road are at [the Admiral Benbow]2947-the admiral benbow , [Black Hill Cove]6-black hill cove , [[my]0-i good man]2948-my good man , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [I]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road hear a voice , "[428-someone drawing slowly near along the road] said [he]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road , " a young voice . Will [you]0-i give [me]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road [your]0-i hand , [[my]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road kind young friend]2949-my kind young friend , and lead [me]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road in ? "[428-someone drawing slowly near along the road] [I]0-i held out [my]0-i hand , and [the horrible , soft - spoken , eyeless creature]431-the horrible , soft - spoken , eyeless creature gripped it in a moment like a vise . [I]0-i was so much startled that [I]0-i struggled to withdraw , but [the blind man]432-the blind man pulled [me]0-i close up to [him]432-the blind man with a single action of [his]432-the blind man arm . " Now , [boy]2934-boy , "[428-someone drawing slowly near along the road] [he]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road said , " take [me]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road in to [the captain]234-the captain . "[428-someone drawing slowly near along the road] " [Sir]2853-sir , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " upon [my]0-i word [I]0-i dare not . "[0-i] " Oh , "[428-someone drawing slowly near along the road] [he]428-someone drawing slowly near along the road sneered , " that 's it !
