"[289-the doctor] " [Hawkins]70-jim , [I]661-the squire put prodigious faith in [you]70-jim , "[661-the squire] added [the squire]661-the squire . [I]0-i began to feel pretty desperate at this , for [I]0-i felt altogether helpless ; and yet , by an odd train of circumstances , it was indeed through [me]0-i that safety came . In the meantime , talk as [we]1200-we pleased , there were only seven out of [the twenty - six on whom [we]1200-we knew [we]1200-we could rely]1201-the twenty - six on whom we knew we could rely ; and out of these seven one was [a boy]831-a boy , so that [the grown men on [our]1200-we side]1203-the grown men on our side were six to [their]1203-the grown men on our side nineteen .

PART THREE [My]0-i Shore Adventure

13

How [My]0-i Shore Adventure Began

THE appearance of [the island]187-the island when [I]0-i came on [deck]3158-deck next morning was altogether changed . Although the breeze had now utterly ceased , [we]1200-we had made a great deal of way during the night and were now lying becalmed about half a mile to [the south - east of [the low eastern coast]1207-the low eastern coast]1206-the south - east of the low eastern coast . Grey - coloured woods covered a large part of the surface . This even tint was indeed broken up by streaks of yellow sand - break in [the lower lands]1208-the lower lands , and by many tall trees of [the pine family]1209-the pine family , out - topping the others some singly , some in clumps ; but the general colouring was uniform and sad . [The hills]1210-the hills ran up clear above the vegetation in spires of naked rock . All were strangely shaped , and the Spy - glass , which was by three or four hundred feet the tallest on [the island]187-the island , was likewise the strangest in configuration , running up sheer from almost every side and then suddenly cut off at the top like a pedestal to put a statue on . [The HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola was rolling scuppers under in the ocean swell . The booms were tearing at the blocks , the rudder was banging to and fro , and [the whole ship]1212-the whole ship creaking , groaning , and jumping like a manufactory . [I]0-i had to cling tight to the backstay , and [the world]2855-the world turned giddily before [my]0-i eyes , for though [I]0-i was [a good enough sailor]1214-a good enough sailor when there was way on , this standing still and being rolled about like a bottle was a thing [I]0-i never learned to stand without a qualm or so , above all in the morning , on an empty stomach . Perhaps it was this perhaps it was the look of [the island]187-the island , with [its]187-the island grey , melancholy woods , and wild stone spires , and the surf that [we]1200-we could both see and hear foaming and thundering on [the steep beach]1216-the steep beach at least , although the sun shone bright and hot , and the shore birds were fishing and crying all around [us]1200-we , and [you]1217-you would have thought [anyone]243-anyone would have been glad to get to land after being so long at [sea]246-sea , [my]0-i heart sank , as the saying is , into [my]0-i boots ; and from the first look onward , [I]0-i hated the very thought of [Treasure Island]1-treasure island . [We]1200-we had a dreary morning 's work before [us]1200-we , for there was no sign of any wind , and [the boats]1220-the boats had to be got out and manned , and [the ship]755-the ship warped three or four miles round [the corner of [the island]187-the island]1222-the corner of the island and up [the narrow passage]1224-the narrow passage to [the haven behind [Skeleton Island]32-skeleton island]1225-the haven behind skeleton island . [I]0-i volunteered for [one of [the boats]1220-the boats]1226-one of the boats , where [I]0-i had , of course , no business . The heat was sweltering , and [the men]587-the men grumbled fiercely over [their]587-the men work . [Anderson]111-anderson was in command of [[my]0-i boat]1229-my boat , and instead of keeping [the crew]966-the crew in order , [he]111-anderson grumbled as loud as the worst . " Well , "[111-anderson] [he]111-anderson said with an oath , " it 's not forever . "[111-anderson] [I]0-i thought this was a very bad sign , for up to that day [the men]587-the men had gone briskly and willingly about [their]587-the men business ; but the very sight of [the island]187-the island had relaxed the cords of discipline . All the way in , [Long John]95-silver stood by [the steersman]1233-the steersman and conned [the ship]755-the ship . [He]95-silver knew [the passage]939-the passage like the palm of [his]95-silver hand , and though [the man in the chains]1236-the man in the chains got everywhere more water than was down in the chart , [John]95-silver never hesitated once . " There 's a strong scour with the ebb , "[95-silver] [he]95-silver said , " and [this here passage]3393-this here passage has been dug out , in a manner of speaking , with a spade . "[95-silver] [We]1237-we brought up just where the anchor was in the chart , about a third of a mile from [each shore]1238-each shore , [the mainland]1239-the mainland on one side and [Skeleton Island]32-skeleton island on the other . [The bottom]1240-the bottom was clean sand . The plunge of [our]1237-we anchor sent up clouds of birds wheeling and crying over [the woods]1241-the woods , but in less than a minute [they]1242-they were down again and all was once more silent . [The place]2937-the place was entirely land - locked , buried in woods , the trees coming right down to high - water mark , [the shores]1244-the shores mostly flat , and the hilltops standing round at a distance in a sort of amphitheatre , one here , one there . [Two little rivers]1245-two little rivers , or rather [two swamps]1246-two swamps , emptied out into [this pond]1247-this pond , as [you]1248-you might call it ; and the foliage round that part of [the shore]858-the shore had a kind of poisonous brightness . From [the ship]755-the ship [we]1237-we could see nothing of [the house]228-the house or stockade , for [they]1252-they were quite buried among trees ; and if it had not been for the chart on the companion , [we]1237-we might have been the first that had ever anchored [there]2846-there since [the island]187-the island arose out of [the seas]1255-the seas . There was not a breath of air moving , nor a sound but that of the surf booming half a mile away along [the beaches]1256-the beaches and against the rocks outside . A peculiar stagnant smell hung over [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage a smell of sodden leaves and rotting tree trunks . [I]0-i observed [the doctor]289-the doctor sniffing and sniffing , like someone tasting a bad egg . " [I]289-the doctor do n't know about treasure , "[289-the doctor] [he]289-the doctor said , " but [I]289-the doctor 'll stake [my]289-the doctor wig there 's fever here . "[289-the doctor] If the conduct of [the men]587-the men had been alarming in [the boat]1260-the boat , it became truly threatening when [they]587-the men had come aboard . [They]587-the men lay about [the deck]1031-the deck growling together in talk . The slightest order was received with a black look and grudgingly and carelessly obeyed . [Even the honest hands]1262-even the honest hands must have caught the infection , for there was [not one man aboard to mend another]1263-not one man aboard to mend another . Mutiny , it was plain , hung over [us]1237-we like a thunder - cloud . And it was not only [[we]1237-we of [the cabin party who perceived the danger]1265-the cabin party who perceived the danger]1264-we of the cabin party who perceived the danger . [Long John]95-silver was hard at work going from group to [group]1266-group , spending [himself]95-silver in good advice , and as for example [no man]1267-no man could have shown a better . [He]95-silver fairly outstripped [himself]95-silver in willingness and civility ; [he]95-silver was all smiles to [everyone]1109-everyone . If an order were given , [John]95-silver would be on [his]95-silver crutch in an instant , with the cheeriest " Aye , aye , [sir]2853-sir ! "[95-silver] in [the world]2855-the world ; and when there was nothing else to do , [he]95-silver kept up one song after another , as if to conceal the discontent of the rest . Of all the gloomy features of that gloomy afternoon , this obvious anxiety on the part of [Long John]95-silver appeared the worst . [We]1237-we held a council in [the cabin]950-the cabin . " [Sir]2853-sir , "[234-the captain] said [the captain]234-the captain , " if [I]234-the captain risk another order , the whole ship'll come about [our]1237-we ears by the run . [You]2853-sir see , [sir]2853-sir , here it is . [I]234-the captain get a rough answer , do [I]234-the captain not ? Well , if [I]234-the captain speak back , [pikes]3397-pikes will be going in two shakes ; if [I]234-the captain do n't , [Silver]95-silver will see there 's something under that , and the game 's up . Now , [we]1237-we 've [only one man to rely on]3398-only one man to rely on . "[234-the captain] " And who is that ? "[661-the squire] asked [the squire]661-the squire . " [Silver]95-silver , [sir]2853-sir , "[234-the captain] returned [the captain]234-the captain ; " [he]95-silver 's as anxious as [you]2853-sir and [I]234-the captain to smother things up . This is a tiff ; [he]95-silver 'd soon talk 'em out of it if [he]95-silver had the chance , and what [I]234-the captain propose to do is to give [him]95-silver the chance . Let 's allow [the men]587-the men an afternoon ashore . If [they]587-the men all go , why [we]1237-we 'll fight [the ship]755-the ship . If [they]587-the men none of [them]587-the men go , well then , [we]1237-we hold [the cabin]950-the cabin , and [God]65-god defend the right . If [some]222-some go , [you]234-the captain mark [my]234-the captain words , [sir]2853-sir , [Silver'll]126-silver'll bring ['em]222-some aboard again as mild as lambs . "[234-the captain] It was so decided ; loaded pistols were served out to [all the sure men]1274-all the sure men ; [Hunter]93-hunter , [Joyce]92-joyce , and [Redruth]91-redruth were taken into [our]1275-we confidence and received the news with less surprise and a better spirit than [we]1275-we had looked for , and then [the captain]234-the captain went on [deck]3158-deck and addressed [the crew]966-the crew . " [[My]234-the captain lads]3356-my lads , "[234-the captain] said [he]234-the captain , " [we]1275-we 've had a hot day and are all tired and out of sorts . A turn ashore'll hurt nobody [the boats]1220-the boats are still in [the water]3407-the water ; [you]3356-my lads can take the gigs , and [as many as please]3408-as many as please may go ashore for the afternoon . [I]234-the captain 'll fire a gun half an hour before sundown . "[234-the captain] [I]0-i believe [the silly fellows]1279-the silly fellows must have thought [they]1279-the silly fellows would break [their]1279-the silly fellows shins over treasure as soon as [they]1279-the silly fellows were landed , for [they]1279-the silly fellows all came out of [their]1279-the silly fellows sulks in a moment and gave a cheer that started the echo in [a faraway hill]1280-a faraway hill and sent the birds once more flying and squalling round [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage . [The captain]234-the captain was too bright to be in the way . [He]234-the captain whipped out of sight in a moment , leaving [Silver]95-silver to arrange [the party]653-the party , and [I]0-i fancy it was as well [he]234-the captain did so . Had [he]234-the captain been on [deck]3158-deck , [he]234-the captain could no longer so much as have pretended not to understand the situation . It was as plain as day . [Silver]95-silver was [the captain]234-the captain , and [a mighty rebellious crew [he]95-silver had of it]1286-a mighty rebellious crew he had of it . [The honest hands]3381-the honest hands and [I]0-i was soon to see it proved that there were [such on board]1288-such on board must have been [very stupid fellows]1289-very stupid fellows . Or rather , [I]0-i suppose the truth was this , that [all hands]3111-all hands were disaffected by the example of [the ringleaders only some more , some less]1291-the ringleaders only some more , some less ; and a few , being [good fellows in the main]1292-good fellows in the main , could neither be led nor driven any further . It is one thing to be idle and skulk and quite another to take [a ship]713-a ship and murder a number of [innocent men]1294-innocent men . At last , however , [the party]653-the party was made up . [Six fellows]1296-six fellows were to stay on board , and the remaining thirteen , including [Silver]95-silver , began to embark . Then it was that there came into [my]0-i head the first of the mad notions that contributed so much to save [our]1297-our lives . If [six men]1298-six men were left by [Silver]95-silver , it was plain [[our]1297-our party]1299-our party could not take and fight [the ship]755-the ship ; and since only six were left , it was equally plain that [the cabin party]1301-the cabin party had no present need of [my]0-i assistance . It occurred to [me]0-i at once to go ashore . In a jiffy [I]0-i had slipped over the side and curled up in the fore - sheets of [the nearest boat]1302-the nearest boat , and almost at the same moment [she]1303-she shoved off . [No one]411-no one took notice of [me]0-i , only the bow oar saying , " Is that [you]0-i , [Jim]70-jim ? Keep [your]0-i head down . "[411-no one] But [Silver]95-silver , from [the other boat]1305-the other boat , looked sharply over and called out to know if that were [me]0-i ; and from that moment [I]0-i began to regret what [I]0-i had done . [The crews]1306-the crews raced for [the beach]313-the beach , but [the boat [I]0-i was in]1308-the boat i was in , having some start and being at once the lighter and the better manned , shot far ahead of [[her]1303-she consort]1309-her consort , and the bow had struck among the shore - side trees and [I]0-i had caught a branch and swung [myself]0-i out and plunged into the nearest thicket while [Silver]95-silver and the rest were still a hundred yards behind . " [Jim]70-jim , [Jim]70-jim ! "[1310-him] [I]0-i heard [him]1310-him shouting . But [you]1311-you may suppose [I]0-i paid no heed ; jumping , ducking , and breaking through , [I]0-i ran straight before [my]0-i nose till [I]0-i could run no longer .

14

The First Blow

[I]0-i WAS so pleased at having given the slip to [Long John]95-silver that [I]0-i began to enjoy [myself]0-i and look around [me]0-i with some interest on [the strange land that [I]0-i was in]1312-the strange land that i was in . [I]0-i had crossed [a marshy tract full of willows]1313-a marshy tract full of willows , bulrushes , and odd , outlandish , swampy trees ; and [I]0-i had now come out upon the skirts of [an open piece of undulating , sandy country]1314-an open piece of undulating , sandy country , about a mile long , dotted with a few pines and a great number of contorted trees , not unlike the oak in growth , but pale in the foliage , like willows . On the far side of the open stood [one of [the hills]1210-the hills]1315-one of the hills , with [two quaint , craggy peaks]1317-two quaint , craggy peaks shining vividly in the sun . [I]0-i now felt for the first time the joy of exploration . [The isle]751-the isle was uninhabited ; [[my]0-i shipmates]1319-my shipmates [I]0-i had left behind , and nothing lived in front of [me]0-i but dumb brutes and fowls . [I]0-i turned hither and thither among the trees . Here and there were flowering plants , unknown to [me]0-i ; here and there [I]0-i saw snakes , and one raised [his]1320-his head from a ledge of rock and hissed at [me]0-i with a noise not unlike the spinning of a top . [Little]127-little did [I]0-i suppose that [he]1320-his was [a deadly enemy and that the noise was the famous rattle]1321-a deadly enemy and that the noise was the famous rattle . Then [I]0-i came to a long thicket of these oaklike trees live , or evergreen , oaks , [I]0-i heard afterwards they should be called which grew low along the sand like brambles , the boughs curiously twisted , the foliage compact , like thatch . The thicket stretched down from the top of [one of [the sandy knolls]1323-the sandy knolls]1322-one of the sandy knolls , spreading and growing taller as it went , until it reached the margin of [the broad , reedy fen]1324-the broad , reedy fen , through which [the nearest of the little rivers soaked its way into [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage]1325-the nearest of the little rivers soaked its way into the anchorage . [The marsh]1327-the marsh was steaming in the strong sun , and the outline of the Spy - glass trembled through the haze . All at once there began to go a sort of bustle among [the bulrushes]1328-the bulrushes ; a wild duck flew up with a quack , another followed , and soon over [the whole surface of [the marsh]1327-the marsh]1329-the whole surface of the marsh a great cloud of birds hung screaming and circling in the air . [I]0-i judged at once that [some of [[my]0-i shipmates]1319-my shipmates]1331-some of my shipmates must be drawing near along [the borders of [the fen]1334-the fen]1333-the borders of the fen . Nor was [I]0-i deceived , for soon [I]0-i heard the very distant and low tones of a human voice , which , as [I]0-i continued to give ear , grew steadily louder and nearer . This put [me]0-i in a great fear , and [I]0-i crawled under cover of the nearest live - oak and squatted there , hearkening , as silent as a mouse . [Another voice]1335-another voice answered , and then [the first voice]1336-the first voice , which [I]0-i now recognized to be [Silver]95-silver 's , once more took up the story and ran on for a long while in a stream , only now and again interrupted by the other . By the sound [they]1337-them must have been talking earnestly , and almost fiercely ; but no distinct word came to [my]0-i hearing . At last [the speakers]1338-the speakers seemed to have paused and perhaps to have sat down , for not only did [they]1338-the speakers cease to draw any nearer , but the birds themselves began to grow more quiet and to settle again to their places in [the swamp]1339-the swamp . And now [I]0-i began to feel that [I]0-i was neglecting [my]0-i business , that since [I]0-i had been so foolhardy as to come ashore with [these desperadoes]1340-these desperadoes , the least [I]0-i could do was to overhear [them]1337-them at [[their]1337-them councils]1341-their councils , and that [my]0-i plain and obvious duty was to draw as close as [I]0-i could manage , under the favourable ambush of the crouching trees . [I]0-i could tell the direction of [the speakers]1338-the speakers pretty exactly , not only by the sound of [their]1338-the speakers voices but by the behaviour of the few birds that still hung in alarm above the heads of [the intruders]1343-the intruders . Crawling on all fours , [I]0-i made steadily but slowly towards [them]1337-them , till at last , raising [my]0-i head to an aperture among the leaves , [I]0-i could see clear down into [a little green dell beside [the marsh]1327-the marsh]1344-a little green dell beside the marsh , and closely set about with trees , where [Long John Silver]95-silver and [another of [the crew]966-the crew]1346-another of the crew stood face to face in conversation . The sun beat full upon [them]1337-them . [Silver]95-silver had thrown [his]95-silver hat beside [him]95-silver on the ground , and [his]95-silver great , smooth , blond face , all shining with heat , was lifted to [the other man]1348-the other man 's in a kind of appeal . " [Mate]2839-mate , "[95-silver] [he]95-silver was saying , " it 's because [I]95-silver thinks gold dust of [you]2839-mate gold dust , and [you]2839-mate may lay to that ! If [I]95-silver had n't took to [you]2839-mate like pitch , do [you]2839-mate think [I]95-silver 'd have been here a - warning of [you]2839-mate ? All 's up [you]2839-mate ca n't make nor mend ; it 's to save [your]2839-mate neck that [I]95-silver 'm a - speaking , and if one of [the wild uns]3410-the wild uns knew it , where 'd [I]95-silver be , [Tom]91-redruth now , tell [me]95-silver , where 'd [I]95-silver be ? "[95-silver] " [Silver]95-silver , "[1348-the other man] said [the other man]1348-the other man and [I]0-i observed [he]95-silver was not only red in the face , but spoke as hoarse as a crow , and [his]95-silver voice shook too , like a taut rope " [Silver]95-silver , "[95-silver] says [he]95-silver , " [you]2839-mate 're old , and [you]2839-mate 're honest , or has the name for it ; and [you]2839-mate 've money too , which [lots of [poor sailors]3412-poor sailors]3411-lots of poor sailors has n't ; and [you]2839-mate 're brave , or [I]95-silver 'm mistook . And will [you]2839-mate tell [me]95-silver [you]2839-mate 'll let [yourself]2839-mate be led away with that kind of a mess of swabs ? Not [you]2839-mate ! As sure as [God]65-god sees [me]95-silver , [I]95-silver 'd sooner lose [my]95-silver hand . If [I]95-silver turn agin [my]95-silver dooty "[95-silver] And then all of a sudden [he]95-silver was interrupted by a noise . [I]0-i had found one of [the honest hands]3381-the honest hands well , here , at that same moment , came news of another . Far away out in [the marsh]1327-the marsh there arose , all of a sudden , a sound like the cry of anger , then another on the back of it ; and then one horrid , long - drawn scream . The rocks of [the Spy - glass]3045-the spy - glass re - echoed it a score of times ; the whole troop of marsh - birds rose again , darkening heaven , with a simultaneous whirr ; and long after that death yell was still ringing in [my]0-i brain , silence had re - established [its]1353-its empire , and only the rustle of the redescending birds and the boom of the distant surges disturbed the languor of the afternoon . [Tom]91-redruth had leaped at the sound , like a horse at the spur , but [Silver]95-silver had not winked an eye . [He]95-silver stood where [he]95-silver was , resting lightly on [his]95-silver crutch , watching [[his]95-silver companion]1130-his companion like a snake about to spring . " [John]95-silver ! "[523-the sailor] said [the sailor]523-the sailor , stretching out [his]523-the sailor hand . " Hands off ! "[95-silver] cried [Silver]95-silver , leaping back a yard , as it seemed to [me]0-i , with the speed and security of [a trained gymnast]1356-a trained gymnast . " Hands off , if [you]95-silver like , [John Silver]95-silver , "[350-the other] said [the other]350-the other . " It 's a black conscience that can make [you]95-silver feared of [me]350-the other . But in heaven 's name , tell [me]350-the other , what was that ? "[350-the other] " That ? "[95-silver] returned [Silver]95-silver , smiling away , but warier than ever , [his]95-silver eye a mere pin - point in [his]95-silver big face , but gleaming like a crumb of glass . " That ? Oh , [I]95-silver reckon that 'll be [Alan]128-alan . "[95-silver] And at this point [Tom]91-redruth flashed out like [a hero]1358-a hero . " [Alan]128-alan ! "[91-redruth] [he]91-redruth cried . " Then rest [his]128-alan soul for [a true seaman]3413-a true seaman ! And as for [you]95-silver , [John Silver]95-silver , long [you]95-silver 've been [a mate of mine]3414-a mate of mine , but [you]95-silver 're mate of [mine]350-the other no more . If [I]91-redruth die like a dog , [I]91-redruth 'll die in [my]91-redruth dooty . [You]95-silver 've killed [Alan]128-alan , have [you]95-silver ? Kill [me]91-redruth too , if [you]95-silver can . But [I]91-redruth defies [you]95-silver . "[91-redruth] And with that , [this brave fellow]1359-this brave fellow turned [his]1359-this brave fellow back directly on [the cook]916-the cook and set off walking for [the beach]313-the beach . But [he]1359-this brave fellow was not destined to go far . With a cry [John]95-silver seized the branch of a tree , whipped the crutch out of [his]95-silver armpit , and sent that uncouth missile hurtling through the air . It struck poor [Tom]91-redruth , point foremost , and with stunning violence , right between the shoulders in the middle of [his]91-redruth back . [His]91-redruth hands flew up , [he]91-redruth gave a sort of gasp , and fell . Whether [he]91-redruth were injured much or little , [none]529-none could ever tell . Like enough , to judge from the sound , [his]91-redruth back was broken on the spot . But [he]91-redruth had no time given [him]91-redruth to recover . [Silver]95-silver , agile as [a monkey even without leg or crutch]1363-a monkey even without leg or crutch , was on the top of [him]95-silver next moment and had twice buried [his]95-silver knife up to the hilt in that defenceless body . From [my]0-i place of ambush , [I]0-i could hear [him]95-silver pant aloud as [he]95-silver struck the blows . [I]0-i do not know what it rightly is to faint , but [I]0-i do know that for the next little while [the whole world]1364-the whole world swam away from before [me]0-i in a whirling mist ; [Silver]95-silver and the birds , and the tall Spy - glass hilltop , going round and round and topsy - turvy before [my]0-i eyes , and all manner of bells ringing and distant voices shouting in [my]0-i ear . When [I]0-i came again to [myself]0-i [the monster]1365-the monster had pulled [himself]1365-the monster together , [his]1365-the monster crutch under [his]1365-the monster arm , [his]1365-the monster hat upon [his]1365-the monster head . Just before [him]1365-the monster [Tom]91-redruth lay motionless upon the sward ; but [the murderer]1366-the murderer minded [him]1365-the monster not a whit , cleansing [his]1365-the monster blood - stained knife the while upon a wisp of grass . Everything else was unchanged , the sun still shining mercilessly on [the steaming marsh]1367-the steaming marsh and [the tall pinnacle of [the mountain]1369-the mountain]1368-the tall pinnacle of the mountain , and [I]0-i could scarce persuade [myself]0-i that murder had been actually done and a human life cruelly cut short a moment since before [my]0-i eyes . But now [John]95-silver put [his]95-silver hand into [his]95-silver pocket , brought out a whistle , and blew upon it several modulated blasts that rang far across the heated air . [I]0-i could not tell , of course , the meaning of the signal , but it instantly awoke [my]0-i fears . [More men]1370-more men would be coming . [I]0-i might be discovered . [They]1370-more men had already slain [two of [the honest people]1372-the honest people]1371-two of the honest people ; after [Tom]91-redruth and [Alan]128-alan , might not [I]0-i come next ? Instantly [I]0-i began to extricate [myself]0-i and crawl back again , with what speed and silence [I]0-i could manage , to [the more open portion of [the wood]1374-the wood]1373-the more open portion of the wood . As [I]0-i did so , [I]0-i could hear hails coming and going between [the old buccaneer]183-the old buccaneer and [[his]183-the old buccaneer comrades]614-his comrades , and this sound of danger lent [me]0-i wings . As soon as [I]0-i was clear of the thicket , [I]0-i ran as [I]0-i never ran before , scarce minding the direction of [my]0-i flight , so long as it led [me]0-i from [the murderers]1377-the murderers ; and as [I]0-i ran , fear grew and grew upon [me]0-i until it turned into a kind of frenzy . Indeed , could [anyone]243-anyone be more entirely lost than [I]0-i ? When the gun fired , how should [I]0-i dare to go down to the boats among [those fiends]1379-those fiends , still smoking from [their]1379-those fiends crime ? Would not [the first of [them]1379-those fiends who saw [me]0-i wring [my]0-i neck like a snipe 's]1380-the first of them who saw me wring my neck like a snipe 's ? Would not [my]0-i absence itself be an evidence to [them]1379-those fiends of [my]0-i alarm , and therefore of [my]0-i fatal knowledge ? It was all over , [I]0-i thought . Good - bye to [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola ; good - bye to [the squire]661-the squire , [the doctor]289-the doctor , and [the captain]234-the captain ! There was nothing left for [me]0-i but death by starvation or death by the hands of [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers . All this while , as [I]0-i say , [I]0-i was still running , and without taking any notice , [I]0-i had drawn near to the foot of [the little hill with [the two peaks]1386-the two peaks]1385-the little hill with the two peaks and had got into [a part of [the island]187-the island]1387-a part of the island where the live - oaks grew more widely apart and seemed more like forest trees in their bearing and dimensions . Mingled with these were a few scattered pines , some fifty , some nearer seventy , feet high . The air too smelt more freshly than down beside [the marsh]1327-the marsh . And here a fresh alarm brought [me]0-i to a standstill with a thumping heart .

15

[The Man of the Island]1390-the man of the island

FROM [the side of [the hill]365-the hill]1391-the side of the hill , which was [here steep and stony]1393-here steep and stony , a spout of gravel was dislodged and fell rattling and bounding through the trees . [My]0-i eyes turned instinctively in that direction , and [I]0-i saw [a figure leap with great rapidity behind the trunk of a pine]1394-a figure leap with great rapidity behind the trunk of a pine . What it was , whether bear or [man]2910-man or monkey , [I]0-i could in no wise tell . It seemed dark and shaggy ; more [I]0-i knew not . But the terror of [this new apparition]1396-this new apparition brought [me]0-i to a stand . [I]0-i was now , it seemed , cut off upon both sides ; behind [me]0-i the murderers , before [me]0-i this lurking nondescript . And immediately [I]0-i began to prefer the dangers that [I]0-i knew to those [I]0-i knew not . [Silver]95-silver [himself]95-silver appeared less terrible in contrast with this creature of [the woods]1241-the woods , and [I]0-i turned on [my]0-i heel , and looking sharply behind [me]0-i over [my]0-i shoulder , began to retrace [my]0-i steps in the direction of [the boats]1220-the boats . Instantly the figure reappeared , and making a wide circuit , began to head [me]0-i off . [I]0-i was tired , at any rate ; but had [I]0-i been as fresh as when [I]0-i rose , [I]0-i could see it was in vain for [me]0-i to contend in speed with [such an adversary]1399-such an adversary . From trunk to trunk the creature flitted like a deer , running manlike on two legs , but unlike [any man that [I]0-i had ever seen]1400-any man that i had ever seen , stooping almost double as it ran . Yet [a man it]1401-a man it was , [I]0-i could no longer be in doubt about that . [I]0-i began to recall what [I]0-i had heard of [cannibals]1402-cannibals . [I]0-i was within an ace of calling for help . But the mere fact that [he]1401-a man it was [a man]318-a man , however wild , had somewhat reassured [me]0-i , and [my]0-i fear of [Silver]95-silver began to revive in proportion . [I]0-i stood still , therefore , and cast about for some method of escape ; and as [I]0-i was so thinking , the recollection of [my]0-i pistol flashed into [my]0-i mind . As soon as [I]0-i remembered [I]0-i was not defenceless , courage glowed again in [my]0-i heart and [I]0-i set [my]0-i face resolutely for [this man of [the island]187-the island]1404-this man of the island and walked briskly towards [him]1404-this man of the island . [He]1404-this man of the island was concealed by this time behind another tree trunk ; but [he]1404-this man of the island must have been watching [me]0-i closely , for as soon as [I]0-i began to move in [his]1404-this man of the island direction [he]1404-this man of the island reappeared and took a step to meet [me]0-i . Then [he]1404-this man of the island hesitated , drew back , came forward again , and at last , to [my]0-i wonder and confusion , threw [himself]1404-this man of the island on [his]1404-this man of the island knees and held out [his]1404-this man of the island clasped hands in supplication . At that [I]0-i once more stopped . " Who are [you]1404-this man of the island ? "[0-i] [I]0-i asked . " [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn , "[1404-this man of the island] [he]1404-this man of the island answered , and [his]1404-this man of the island voice sounded hoarse and awkward , like a rusty lock . "[1404-this man of the island] [I]0-i could now see that [he]1404-this man of the island was [a white man like [myself]0-i]1406-a white man like myself and that [his]1404-this man of the island features were even pleasing . [His]1404-this man of the island skin , wherever it was exposed , was burnt by the sun ; even [his]1404-this man of the island lips were black , and [his]1404-this man of the island fair eyes looked quite startling in so dark a face . Of all [the beggar - men that [I]0-i had seen or fancied]1407-the beggar - men that i had seen or fancied , [he]1404-this man of the island was [the chief for raggedness]1408-the chief for raggedness . [He]1404-this man of the island was clothed with tatters of old ship 's canvas and old sea - cloth , and this extraordinary patchwork was all held together by a system of the most various and incongruous fastenings , brass buttons , bits of stick , and loops of tarry gaskin . PART FOUR The Stockade

16

Narrative Continued by [the Doctor]289-the doctor : How the Ship Was Abandoned

IT was about half past one three bells in [the sea]250-the sea phrase that [the two boats]1455-the two boats went [ashore]1411-ashore from [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola . [The captain]234-the captain , [the squire]661-the squire , and [I]0-i were talking matters over in [the cabin]950-the cabin . Had there been a breath of wind , [we]1460-we should have fallen on [the six mutineers who were left aboard]1461-the six mutineers who were left aboard with [us]1460-we , slipped [our]1460-we cable , and away to [sea]246-sea . But the wind was wanting ; and to complete [our]1460-we helplessness , down came [Hunter]93-hunter with the news that [Jim Hawkins]70-jim had slipped into [a boat]1463-a boat and was gone [ashore]1411-ashore with [the rest]599-the rest . It never occurred to [us]1460-we to doubt [Jim Hawkins]70-jim , but [we]1460-we were alarmed for [his]70-jim safety . With [the men in the temper [they]1466-the men in the temper they were in were in]1466-the men in the temper they were in , it seemed an even chance if [we]1460-we should see [the lad]1134-the lad again . [We]1460-we ran on [deck]3158-deck . The pitch was bubbling in the seams ; the nasty stench of [the place]2937-the place turned [me]0-i sick ; if ever [a man smelt fever and dysentery]1470-a man smelt fever and dysentery , it was in [that abominable anchorage]1471-that abominable anchorage . [The six scoundrels]1472-the six scoundrels were sitting grumbling under a sail in [the forecastle]1473-the forecastle ; [ashore]1411-ashore [we]1460-we could see the gigs made fast and [a man]318-a man sitting in each , hard by where [the river]1476-the river runs in . [One of [them]1472-the six scoundrels]3082-one of them was whistling " [Lillibullero]131-lillibullero . "[3082-one of them] Waiting was a strain , and it was decided that [Hunter]93-hunter and [I]0-i should go [ashore]1411-ashore with [the jolly - boat]1479-the jolly - boat in quest of information . [The gigs]1480-the gigs had leaned to [their]1480-the gigs right , but [Hunter]93-hunter and [I]0-i pulled straight in , in the direction of [the stockade]1481-the stockade upon the chart . [The two who were left guarding [[their]1482-the two who were left guarding their boats boats]1483-their boats]1482-the two who were left guarding their boats seemed in a bustle at [our]1460-we appearance ; " [Lillibullero]131-lillibullero "[1482-the two who were left guarding their boats] stopped off , and [I]0-i could see [the pair]1484-the pair discussing what [they]1484-the pair ought to do . Had [they]1484-the pair gone and told [Silver]95-silver , all might have turned out differently ; but [they]1484-the pair had [their]1484-the pair orders , [I]0-i suppose , and decided to sit quietly where [they]1484-the pair were and hark back again to " [Lillibullero]131-lillibullero . "[1484-the pair] There was a slight bend in [the coast]209-the coast , and [I]0-i steered so as to put [it]1486-it between [us]1460-we ; even before [we]1460-we landed [we]1460-we had thus lost sight of the gigs . [I]0-i jumped out and came as near running as [I]0-i durst , with a big silk handkerchief under [my]0-i hat for coolness ' sake and a brace of pistols ready primed for safety . [I]0-i had not gone a hundred yards when [I]0-i reached [the stockade]1481-the stockade . This was how it was : [a spring of clear water]1488-a spring of clear water rose almost at the top of [a knoll]1489-a knoll . Well , on [the knoll]1490-the knoll , and enclosing [the spring]1491-the spring , [they]1484-the pair had clapped a stout loghouse fit to hold two score of [people on a pinch and loopholed for musketry on either side]1492-people on a pinch and loopholed for musketry on either side . All round this [they]1484-the pair had cleared [a wide space]1493-a wide space , and then the thing was completed by a paling six feet high , without door or opening , too strong to pull down without time and labour and too open to shelter [the besiegers]1494-the besiegers . [The people in [the log - house]1496-the log - house]1495-the people in the log - house had [them]1495-the people in the log - house in every way ; [they]1495-the people in the log - house stood quiet in shelter and shot [the others]3442-the others like partridges . All [they]1495-the people in the log - house wanted was a good watch and food ; for , short of a complete surprise , [they]1495-the people in the log - house might have held the place against [a regiment]1498-a regiment . What particularly took [my]0-i fancy was the spring . For though [we]1499-we had a good enough place of it in [the cabin of [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola]1500-the cabin of the hispaniola , with plenty of arms and ammunition , and things to eat , and excellent wines , there had been one thing overlooked [we]1499-we had [no water]1501-no water . [I]0-i was thinking this over when there came ringing over [the island]187-the island the cry of [a man at the point of death]1503-a man at the point of death . [I]0-i was not new to violent death [I]0-i have served [[his]1503-a man at the point of death Royal Highness [the Duke of [Cumberland]37-cumberland]132-the duke of cumberland]1504-his royal highness the duke of cumberland , and got a wound [myself]0-i at [Fontenoy]38-fontenoy but [I]0-i know [my]0-i pulse went dot and carry one . " [Jim Hawkins]70-jim is gone , "[0-i] was [my]0-i first thought . It is something to have been [an old soldier]1505-an old soldier , but more still to have been [a doctor]302-a doctor . There is no time to dilly - dally in [our]1499-we work . And so now [I]0-i made up [my]0-i mind instantly , and with no time lost returned to [the shore]858-the shore and jumped on board [the jolly - boat]1479-the jolly - boat . By good fortune [Hunter]93-hunter pulled a good oar . [We]1499-we made the water fly , and [the boat]1260-the boat was soon alongside and [I]0-i aboard [the schooner]852-the schooner . [I]0-i found [them]1511-them all shaken , as was natural . [The squire]661-the squire was sitting down , as white as a sheet , thinking of the harm [he]661-the squire had led [us]1499-we to , [the good soul]1513-the good soul ! And one of [the six forecastle hands]1514-the six forecastle hands was little better . " There 's [a man]318-a man , "[108-captain smollett] says [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett , nodding towards [him]108-captain smollett , " new to this work . [He]318-a man came nigh - hand fainting , [doctor]2886-doctor , when [he]318-a man heard the cry . Another touch of the rudder and [that man]1009-that man would join [us]1499-we . "[108-captain smollett] [I]0-i told [my]0-i plan to [the captain]234-the captain , and between [us]1499-we [we]1499-we settled on the details of its accomplishment . [We]1499-we put [old Redruth]91-redruth in [the gallery between [the cabin]950-the cabin and [the forecastle]1473-the forecastle]1516-the gallery between the cabin and the forecastle , with three or four loaded muskets and a mattress for protection . [Hunter]93-hunter brought [the boat]1260-the boat round under the stern - port , and [Joyce]92-joyce and [I]0-i set to work loading [her]1260-the boat with powder tins , muskets , bags of biscuits , kegs of pork , a cask of cognac , and [my]0-i invaluable medicine chest . In the meantime , [the squire]661-the squire and [the captain]234-the captain stayed on [deck]3158-deck , and [the latter]1523-the latter hailed [the coxswain]1065-the coxswain , who was [the principal man aboard]1525-the principal man aboard . " [Mr. Hands]109-hands , "[1065-the coxswain] [he]1065-the coxswain said , " here are two of [us]1528-we with a brace of pistols each . If [any one of [you]1528-we six]3459-any one of you six make a signal of any description , [that man]1009-that man 's dead . "[1065-the coxswain] [They]1526-they were a good deal taken aback , and after a little consultation [one and all]1527-one and all tumbled down the fore companion , thinking no doubt to take [us]1528-we on the rear . But when [they]1526-they saw [Redruth]91-redruth waiting for [them]1526-they in [the sparred galley]1529-the sparred galley , [they]1526-they went about [ship]3051-ship at once , and a head popped out again on [deck]3158-deck . " Down , dog ! "[234-the captain] cries [the captain]234-the captain . And the head popped back again ; and [we]1528-we heard no more , for the time , of [these six very faint - hearted seamen]1533-these six very faint - hearted seamen . By this time , tumbling things in as [they]1526-they came , [we]1528-we had [the jolly - boat]1479-the jolly - boat loaded as much as [we]1528-we dared . [Joyce]92-joyce and [I]0-i got out through the stern - port , and [we]1528-we made for [shore]1535-shore again as fast as oars could take [us]1528-we . This second trip fairly aroused [the watchers]1536-the watchers along [shore]1535-shore . " [Lillibullero]131-lillibullero "[1536-the watchers] was dropped again ; and just before [we]1528-we lost sight of [them]1526-they behind the little point , [one of [them]1526-they]3082-one of them whipped ashore and disappeared . [I]0-i had half a mind to change [my]0-i plan and destroy [[their]1526-they boats]1483-their boats , but [I]0-i feared that [Silver]95-silver and [the others]3442-the others might be close at hand , and all might very well be lost by trying for too much . [We]1528-we had soon touched land in [the same place as before]1541-the same place as before and set to provision [the block house]1542-the block house . [All three]1543-all three made the first journey , heavily laden , and tossed [our]1528-we stores over the palisade . Then , leaving [Joyce]92-joyce to guard [them]1526-they [one man]1544-one man , to be sure , but with half a dozen muskets [Hunter]93-hunter and [I]0-i returned to [the jolly - boat]1479-the jolly - boat and loaded [ourselves]1528-we once more . So [we]1528-we proceeded without pausing to take breath , till the whole cargo was bestowed , when [the two servants]1546-the two servants took up [their]1546-the two servants position in [the block house]1542-the block house , and [I]0-i , with all [my]0-i power , sculled back to [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola . That [we]1528-we should have risked a second boat load seems more daring than it really was . [They]1526-they had the advantage of numbers , of course , but [we]1528-we had the advantage of arms . [Not one of [the men ashore]1549-the men ashore]1548-not one of the men ashore had a musket , and before [they]1526-they could get within range for pistol shooting , [we]1528-we flattered [ourselves]1528-we [we]1528-we should be able to give a good account of a half - dozen at least . [The squire]661-the squire was waiting for [me]0-i at the stern window , all [his]661-the squire faintness gone from [him]661-the squire . [He]661-the squire caught [the painter]1551-the painter and made it fast , and [we]1528-we fell to loading [the boat]1260-the boat for [our]1528-we very lives . Pork , powder , and biscuit was the cargo , with only a musket and a cutlass apiece for [the squire]661-the squire and [me]0-i and [Redruth]91-redruth and [the captain]234-the captain . The rest of the arms and powder [we]1528-we dropped overboard in two fathoms and a half of water , so that [we]1528-we could see the bright steel shining far below [us]1528-we in the sun , on the clean , sandy bottom . By this time the tide was beginning to ebb , and [the ship]755-the ship was swinging round to [her]755-the ship anchor . Voices were heard faintly halloaing in the direction of [the two gigs]1556-the two gigs ; and though this reassured [us]1528-we for [Joyce]92-joyce and [Hunter]93-hunter , who were well to the eastward , it warned [[our]1528-we party]1299-our party to be off . [Redruth]91-redruth retreated from [[his]91-redruth place in [the gallery]1559-the gallery]1558-his place in the gallery and dropped into [the boat]1260-the boat , which [we]1528-we then brought round to [[the ship]755-the ship 's counter]1562-the ship 's counter , to be handier for [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett . " Now , [men]475-men , "[108-captain smollett] said [he]108-captain smollett , " do [you]475-men hear [me]108-captain smollett ? "[108-captain smollett] There was no answer from the forecastle . " It 's to [you]475-men , [Abraham Gray]133-gray it 's to [you]475-men [I]125-mr. smollett am speaking . "[125-mr. smollett] Still no reply . " [Gray]133-gray , "[125-mr. smollett] resumed [Mr. Smollett]125-mr. smollett , a little louder , " [I]125-mr. smollett am leaving [this ship]962-this ship , and [I]125-mr. smollett order [you]133-gray to follow [[your]133-gray captain]2864-your captain . [I]125-mr. smollett know [you]133-gray are [a good man at bottom]3464-a good man at bottom , and [I]125-mr. smollett dare say not one of the lot of [you]133-gray 's as bad as [he]2864-your captain makes out . [I]125-mr. smollett have [my]125-mr. smollett watch here in [my]125-mr. smollett hand ; [I]125-mr. smollett give [you]133-gray thirty seconds to join [me]125-mr. smollett in . "[125-mr. smollett] There was a pause . " Come , [[my]234-the captain fine fellow]3465-my fine fellow , "[234-the captain] continued [the captain]234-the captain ; " do n't hang so long in stays . [I]234-the captain 'm risking [my]234-the captain life and the lives of [these good gentlemen]3466-these good gentlemen every second . "[234-the captain] There was a sudden scuffle , a sound of blows , and out burst [Abraham Gray]133-gray with a knife cut on the side of the cheek , and came running to [the captain]234-the captain like a dog to the whistle . " [I]133-gray 'm with [you]234-the captain , [sir]2853-sir , "[133-gray] said [he]133-gray .
