[We]1566-we were clear out of [the ship]755-the ship , but not yet ashore in [our]1566-we stockade .

17

[Narrative]134-narrative Continued by [the Doctor]289-the doctor : [The Jolly - boat]1479-the jolly - boat 's Last Trip

THIS fifth trip was quite different from any of the others . In the first place , [the little gallipot of [a boat that]1571-a boat that [we]1566-we were in]1570-the little gallipot of a boat that we were in was gravely overloaded . [Five grown men]1572-five grown men , and three of [them]1572-five grown men [Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney , [Redruth]91-redruth , and [the captain over six feet high]1573-the captain over six feet high , was already more than [she]1571-a boat that was meant to carry . Add to that the powder , pork , and bread - bags . The gunwale was lipping astern . Several times [we]1566-we shipped a little water , and [my]0-i breeches and the tails of [my]0-i coat were all soaking wet before [we]1566-we had gone a hundred yards . [The captain]234-the captain made [us]1566-we trim [the boat]1260-the boat , and [we]1566-we got [her]1260-the boat to lie a little more evenly . All the same , [we]1566-we were afraid to breathe . In the second place , the ebb was now making a strong rippling current running westward through [the basin]1576-the basin , and then south'ard and seaward down [the straits by which [we]1566-we had entered in the morning]1577-the straits by which we had entered in the morning . Even the ripples were a danger to [[our]1566-we overloaded craft]1578-our overloaded craft , but the worst of it was that [we]1566-we were swept out of [our]1566-we true course and away from [our]1566-we proper landing - place behind [the point]1579-the point . If [we]1566-we let the current have its way [we]1566-we should come ashore beside the gigs , where [the pirates]3339-the pirates might appear at any moment . " [I]0-i can not keep [her]3468-her head for the stockade , [sir]2853-sir , "[0-i] said [I]0-i to [the captain]234-the captain . [I]0-i was steering , while [he]234-the captain and [Redruth]91-redruth , [two fresh men]1582-two fresh men , were at the oars . " The tide keeps washing [her]3468-her down . Could [you]0-i pull a little stronger ? "[234-the captain] " Not without swamping [the boat]1260-the boat , "[234-the captain] said [he]234-the captain . " [You]0-i must bear up , [sir]2853-sir , if [you]0-i please bear up until [you]0-i see [you]0-i 're gaining . "[234-the captain] [I]0-i tried and found by experiment that the tide kept sweeping [us]1583-we westward until [I]0-i had laid [her]1584-her head due east , or just about right angles to the way [we]1583-we ought to go . " [We]1583-we 'll never get ashore at this rate , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " If it 's the only course that [we]1583-we can lie , [sir]2853-sir , [we]1583-we must even lie it , "[234-the captain] returned [the captain]234-the captain . " [We]1583-we must keep upstream . [You]0-i see , [sir]2853-sir , "[234-the captain] [he]234-the captain went on , " if once [we]1583-we dropped to leeward of [the landing - place]3474-the landing - place , it 's hard to say where [we]1583-we should get ashore , besides the chance of being boarded by [the gigs]1480-the gigs ; whereas , the way [we]1583-we go the current must slacken , and then [we]1583-we can dodge back along [the shore]858-the shore . "[234-the captain] " The current 's less a'ready , [sir]2853-sir , "[1586-the man gray , who was sitting in the fore - sheets] said [the man Gray , who was sitting in the fore - sheets]1586-the man gray , who was sitting in the fore - sheets ; " [you]2853-sir can ease [her]1480-the gigs off a bit . "[1586-the man gray , who was sitting in the fore - sheets] " Thank [you]234-the captain , [[my]0-i man]1015-my man , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , quite as if nothing had happened , for [we]1587-we had all quietly made up [our]1587-we minds to treat [him]234-the captain like [one of [ourselves]1587-we]1588-one of ourselves . Suddenly [the captain]234-the captain spoke up again , and [I]0-i thought [his]234-the captain voice was a little changed . " The gun ! "[234-the captain] said [he]234-the captain . " [I]0-i have thought of that , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , for [I]0-i made sure [he]234-the captain was thinking of a bombardment of [the fort]1590-the fort . " [They]1593-they could never get the gun ashore , and if [they]1593-they did , [they]1593-they could never haul it through [the woods]1241-the woods . "[234-the captain] " Look astern , [doctor]2886-doctor , "[234-the captain] replied [the captain]234-the captain . [We]1587-we had entirely forgotten the long nine ; and there , to [our]1587-we horror , were the five rogues busy about [her]1592-her , getting off [her]1592-her jacket , as [they]1593-they called the stout tarpaulin cover under which [she]1592-her sailed . Not only that , but it flashed into [my]0-i mind at the same moment that the round - shot and the powder for the gun had been left behind , and a stroke with an axe would put it all into the possession of [the evil ones abroad]1594-the evil ones abroad . " [Israel]112-israel was [[Flint]113-flint 's gunner]3481-flint 's gunner , "[133-gray] said [Gray]133-gray hoarsely . At any risk , [we]1587-we put [the boat]1260-the boat 's head direct for [the landing - place]3474-the landing - place . By this time [we]1587-we had got so far out of the run of the current that [we]1587-we kept steerage way even at [our]1587-we necessarily gentle rate of rowing , and [I]0-i could keep [her]1592-her steady for the goal . But the worst of it was that with the course [I]0-i now held [we]1587-we turned [our]1587-we broadside instead of [our]1587-we stern to [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola and offered a target like a barn door . [I]0-i could hear as well as see [that brandy - faced rascal Israel Hands]112-israel plumping down a round - shot on [the deck]1031-the deck . " [Who 's the best shot]3482-who 's the best shot ? "[234-the captain] asked [the captain]234-the captain . " [Mr. Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney , out and away , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [Mr. Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney , will [you]86-mr. trelawney please pick [me]234-the captain off one of [these men]3483-these men , [sir]2853-sir ? Hands , if possible , "[234-the captain] said [the captain]234-the captain . [Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney was as cool as steel . [He]86-mr. trelawney looked to the priming of [his]86-mr. trelawney gun . " Now , "[234-the captain] cried [the captain]234-the captain , " easy with that gun , [sir]2853-sir , or [you]2853-sir 'll swamp [the boat]1260-the boat . [All hands]3111-all hands stand by to trim [her]1260-the boat when [he]86-mr. trelawney aims . "[234-the captain] [The squire]661-the squire raised [his]661-the squire gun , the rowing ceased , and [we]1602-we leaned over to the other side to keep the balance , and all was so nicely contrived that [we]1602-we did not ship a drop . [They]1603-they had the gun , by this time , slewed round upon the swivel , and [Hands , who was at the muzzle with the rammer]1604-hands , who was at the muzzle with the rammer , was in consequence the most exposed . However , [we]1602-we had no luck , for just as [Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney fired , down [he]86-mr. trelawney stooped , the ball whistled over [him]86-mr. trelawney , and it was one of [the other four who fell]1605-the other four who fell . The cry [he]86-mr. trelawney gave was echoed not only by [[his]86-mr. trelawney companions]1606-his companions on board but by a great number of voices from [the shore]858-the shore , and looking in that direction [I]0-i saw [the other pirates]1608-the other pirates trooping out from among the trees and tumbling into [their]1608-the other pirates places in [the boats]1220-the boats . " Here come the gigs , [sir]2853-sir , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " Give way , then , "[234-the captain] cried [the captain]234-the captain . " [We]1602-we must n't mind if [we]1602-we swamp [her]3489-her now . If [we]1602-we ca n't get ashore , all 's up . "[234-the captain] " Only one of [the gigs]1480-the gigs is being manned , [sir]2853-sir , "[0-i] [I]0-i added ; " [the crew of the other most likely going round by [shore]1535-shore]3492-the crew of the other most likely going round by shore to cut [us]1602-we off . "[0-i] " [They]1608-the other pirates 'll have a hot run , [sir]2853-sir , "[234-the captain] returned [the captain]234-the captain . " [Jack]73-jack ashore , [you]2853-sir know . It 's not [them]1608-the other pirates [I]234-the captain mind ; it 's the round - shot . Carpet bowls ! [[My]234-the captain lady 's maid]3495-my lady 's maid could n't miss . Tell [us]1612-we , [squire]3001-squire , when [you]2853-sir see the match , and [we]1612-we 'll hold water . "[234-the captain] In the meanwhile [we]1612-we had been making headway at a good pace for [a boat so overloaded]1613-a boat so overloaded , and [we]1612-we had shipped but little water in the process . [We]1612-we were now close in ; thirty or forty strokes and [we]1612-we should beach [her]1614-her , for the ebb had already disclosed a narrow belt of sand below the clustering trees . The gig was no longer to be feared ; the little point had already concealed it from [our]1612-we eyes . The ebb - tide , which had so cruelly delayed [us]1612-we , was now making reparation and delaying [[our]1612-we assailants]1615-our assailants . The one source of danger was the gun . " If [I]234-the captain durst , "[234-the captain] said [the captain]234-the captain , " [I]234-the captain 'd stop and pick off [another man]1076-another man . "[234-the captain] But it was plain that [they]1617-they meant nothing should delay [their]1617-they shot . [They]1617-they had never so much as looked at [[their]1617-they fallen comrade]1618-their fallen comrade , though [he]1618-their fallen comrade was not dead , and [I]0-i could see [him]1618-their fallen comrade trying to crawl away . " Ready ! "[661-the squire] cried [the squire]661-the squire . " Hold ! "[234-the captain] cried [the captain]234-the captain , quick as an echo . And [he]234-the captain and [Redruth]91-redruth backed with a great heave that sent [her]1621-her stern bodily under water . The report fell in at the same instant of time . This was the first that [Jim]70-jim heard , the sound of [the squire]661-the squire 's shot not having reached [him]70-jim . Where the ball passed , not one of [us]1623-we precisely knew , but [I]0-i fancy it must have been over [our]1623-we heads and that the wind of it may have contributed to [our]1623-we disaster . At any rate , [the boat]1260-the boat sank by the stern , quite gently , in three feet of water , leaving [the captain]234-the captain and [myself]0-i , facing [each other]471-each other , on [our]1623-we feet . [The other three]1627-the other three took complete headers , and came up again drenched and bubbling . So far there was no great harm . No lives were lost , and [we]1623-we could wade ashore in safety . But there were all [our]1623-we stores at the bottom , and to make things worse , only two guns out of five remained in a state for service . Mine [I]0-i had snatched from [my]0-i knees and held over [my]0-i head , by a sort of instinct . As for [the captain]234-the captain , [he]234-the captain had carried [his]234-the captain over [his]234-the captain shoulder by [a bandoleer]1629-a bandoleer , and like [a wise man]1630-a wise man , lock uppermost . [The other three]1627-the other three had gone down with [the boat]1260-the boat . To add to [our]1623-we concern , [we]1623-we heard voices already drawing near [us]1623-we in [the woods along shore]1633-the woods along shore , and [we]1623-we had not only the danger of being cut off from the stockade in [our]1623-we half - crippled state but the fear before [us]1623-we whether , if [Hunter]93-hunter and [Joyce]92-joyce were attacked by [half a dozen]1634-half a dozen , [they]1627-the other three would have the sense and conduct to stand firm . [Hunter]93-hunter was steady , that [we]1623-we knew ; [Joyce]92-joyce was [a doubtful case]1635-a doubtful case [a pleasant , polite man]1636-a pleasant , polite man for [a valet]1637-a valet and to brush one 's clothes , but not entirely fitted for [a man of war]1638-a man of war . With all this in [our]1623-we minds , [we]1623-we waded ashore as fast as [we]1623-we could , leaving behind [us]1623-we [the poor jolly - boat]1639-the poor jolly - boat and a good half of all [our]1623-we powder and provisions .

18

Narrative Continued by [the Doctor]289-the doctor : End of the First Day 's Fighting

[WE]1623-we made [our]1623-we best speed across the strip of wood that now divided [us]1623-we from [the stockade]1481-the stockade , and at every step [we]1623-we took the voices of [the buccaneers]595-the buccaneers rang nearer . Soon [we]1623-we could hear [their]595-the buccaneers footfalls as [they]595-the buccaneers ran and the cracking of the branches as [they]595-the buccaneers breasted across a bit of thicket . [I]0-i began to see [we]1623-we should have a brush for it in earnest and looked to [[my]0-i priming]1643-my priming . " [Captain]2845-captain , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney is [the dead shot]3499-the dead shot . Give [him]86-mr. trelawney [your]2845-captain gun ; [his]86-mr. trelawney own is useless . "[0-i] [They]595-the buccaneers exchanged guns , and [Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney , silent and cool as [he]86-mr. trelawney had been since the beginning of the bustle , hung a moment on [his]86-mr. trelawney heel to see that all was fit for service . At the same time , observing [Gray]133-gray to be unarmed , [I]0-i handed [him]133-gray [my]0-i cutlass . It did all [our]1623-we hearts good to see [him]133-gray spit in [his]133-gray hand , knit [his]133-gray brows , and make the blade sing through the air . It was plain from every line of [his]133-gray body that [our]1623-we new hand was worth [his]133-gray salt . Forty paces farther [we]1623-we came to the edge of the wood and saw [the stockade in front of [us]1623-we]1644-the stockade in front of us . [We]1623-we struck the enclosure about the middle of the south side , and almost at the same time , seven mutineers [Job Anderson]111-anderson , [the boatswain]1029-the boatswain , at [their]1646-they head appeared in full cry at the southwestern corner . [They]1646-they paused as if taken aback , and before [they]1646-they recovered , not only [the squire]661-the squire and [I]0-i , but [Hunter]93-hunter and [Joyce]92-joyce from [the block house]1542-the block house , had time to fire . The four shots came in rather a scattering volley , but [they]1646-they did the business : [one of the enemy]1649-one of the enemy actually fell , and [the rest]599-the rest , without hesitation , turned and plunged into the trees . After reloading , [we]1623-we walked down the outside of [the palisade]1651-the palisade to see to [the fallen enemy]1652-the fallen enemy . [He]1652-the fallen enemy was stone dead shot through the heart . [We]1623-we began to rejoice over [our]1623-we good success when just at that moment a pistol cracked in the bush , a ball whistled close past [my]0-i ear , and poor [Tom Redruth]91-redruth stumbled and fell [his]91-redruth length on the ground . Both [the squire]661-the squire and [I]0-i returned the shot , but as [we]1623-we had nothing to aim at , it is probable [we]1623-we only wasted powder . Then [we]1623-we reloaded and turned [our]1623-we attention to [poor Tom]91-redruth . [The captain]234-the captain and [Gray]133-gray were already examining [him]91-redruth , and [I]0-i saw with half an eye that all was over . [I]0-i believe the readiness of [our]1623-we return volley had scattered [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers once more , for [we]1623-we were suffered without further molestation to get [the poor old gamekeeper]1656-the poor old gamekeeper hoisted over the stockade and carried , groaning and bleeding , into [the log - house]1496-the log - house . [Poor old fellow]1658-poor old fellow , [he]1658-poor old fellow had not uttered one word of surprise , complaint , fear , or even acquiescence from the very beginning of [our]1623-we troubles till now , when [we]1623-we had laid [him]1658-poor old fellow down in [the log - house]1496-the log - house to die . [He]1658-poor old fellow had lain like [a Trojan]1660-a trojan behind [his]1658-poor old fellow mattress in [the gallery]1559-the gallery ; [he]1658-poor old fellow had followed every order silently , doggedly , and well ; [he]1658-poor old fellow was [the oldest of [[our]1623-we party]1299-our party]1662-the oldest of our party by a score of years ; and now , [sullen , old , serviceable servant]1664-sullen , old , serviceable servant , it was [he]1658-poor old fellow that was to die . [The squire]661-the squire dropped down beside [him]1658-poor old fellow on [his]661-the squire knees and kissed [his]1658-poor old fellow hand , crying like [a child]402-a child . " Be [I]661-the squire going , [doctor]2886-doctor ? "[661-the squire] [he]661-the squire asked . " [Tom]91-redruth , [[my]0-i man]1015-my man , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [you]91-redruth 're going [home]659-home . "[0-i] " [I]661-the squire wish [I]661-the squire had had a lick at [them]3503-them with the gun first , "[661-the squire] [he]661-the squire replied . " [Tom]91-redruth , "[661-the squire] said [the squire]661-the squire , ' say [you]1658-poor old fellow forgive [me]0-i , wo n't [you]1658-poor old fellow ? " "[1658-poor old fellow] Would that be respectful like , from [me]0-i to [you]661-the squire , [squire]3001-squire ? " was the answer . "[0-i] Howsoever , so be it , amen ! " After a little while of silence , [he]661-the squire said [he]661-the squire thought [somebody]3504-somebody might read a prayer . "[661-the squire] It 's the custom , [sir]2853-sir , " [he]661-the squire added apologetically . And not long after , without another word , [he]661-the squire passed away . In the meantime [the captain]234-the captain , whom [I]2853-sir had observed to be wonderfully swollen about the chest and pockets , had turned out a great many various stores the British colours , a Bible , a coil of stoutish rope , pen , ink , the log - book , and pounds of tobacco . [He]234-the captain had found a longish fir - tree lying felled and trimmed in [the enclosure]3506-the enclosure , and with the help of [Hunter]93-hunter [he]234-the captain had set it up at the corner of [the log - house]1496-the log - house where the trunks crossed and made an angle . Then , climbing on the roof , [he]234-the captain had with [his]234-the captain own hand bent and run up the colours . This seemed mightily to relieve [him]234-the captain . [He]234-the captain re - entered [the log - house]1496-the log - house and set about counting up [the stores]3509-the stores as if nothing else existed . But [he]234-the captain had an eye on [[Tom]91-redruth 's passage]3510-tom 's passage for all that , and as soon as all was over , came forward with another flag and reverently spread it on the body . "[2853-sir] Do n't [you]2853-sir take on , [sir]2853-sir , " [he]234-the captain said , shaking [the squire]661-the squire 's hand . "[2853-sir] All 's well with [him]1671-him ; no fear for a hand that 's been shot down in [his]1671-him duty to [captain]2845-captain and [owner]1673-owner . It may n't be good divinity , but it 's a fact . " Then [he]234-the captain pulled [me]63-dr. livesey aside . "[63-dr. livesey] [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey , " [he]234-the captain said , "[63-dr. livesey] in how many weeks do [you]63-dr. livesey and [squire]3001-squire expect [the consort]1675-the consort ? " [I]1675-the consort told [him]234-the captain it was a question not of weeks but of months , that if [we]3512-we were not back by the end of [August Blandly]135-august blandly was to send to find [us]3512-we , but neither sooner nor later . "[1675-the consort] [You]63-dr. livesey can calculate for [yourself]63-dr. livesey , " [I]63-dr. livesey said . "[63-dr. livesey] Why , yes , " returned [the captain]234-the captain , scratching [his]234-the captain head ; "[63-dr. livesey] and making a large allowance , [sir]2853-sir , for all the gifts of [Providence]129-providence , [I]0-i should say [we]1677-we were pretty close hauled . " "[0-i] How do [you]0-i mean ? " [I]0-i asked . "[0-i] It 's a pity , [sir]2853-sir , [we]1677-we lost that second load . That 's what [I]0-i mean , " replied [the captain]234-the captain . "[0-i] As for powder and shot , [we]1677-we 'll do . But the rations are short , very short so short , [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey , that [we]1677-we 're perhaps as well without that extra mouth . " And [he]234-the captain pointed to the dead body under the flag . Just then , with a roar and a whistle , a round - shot passed high above the roof of [the log - house]1496-the log - house and plumped far beyond [us]1677-we in the wood . "[0-i] Oho ! " said [the captain]234-the captain . "[0-i] Blaze away ! [You]1679-you 've little enough powder already , [[my]0-i lads]3356-my lads . " At the second trial , the aim was better , and the ball descended inside [the stockade]1481-the stockade , scattering a cloud of sand but doing no further damage . "[2845-captain] [Captain]2845-captain , " said [the squire]661-the squire , "[2845-captain] [the house]228-the house is quite invisible from [the ship]755-the ship . It must be the flag [they]1684-they are aiming at . Would it not be wiser to take it in ? " "[0-i] Strike [my]0-i colours ! " cried [the captain]234-the captain . "[0-i] No , [sir]2853-sir , not [I]0-i " ; and as soon as [he]234-the captain had said the words , [I]0-i think [we]1677-we all agreed with [him]234-the captain . For it was not only a piece of stout , seamanly , good feeling ; it was good policy besides and showed [[our]1677-we enemies]3520-our enemies that [we]1677-we despised [their]3520-our enemies cannonade . All through the evening [they]3520-our enemies kept thundering away . Ball after ball flew over or fell short or kicked up the sand in [the enclosure]3506-the enclosure , but [they]3520-our enemies had to fire so high that the shot fell dead and buried itself in the soft sand . [We]1677-we had no ricochet to fear , and though one popped in through the roof of [the log - house]1496-the log - house and out again through the floor , [we]1677-we soon got used to that sort of horse - play and minded it no more than cricket . "[0-i] There is one good thing about all this , " observed [the captain]234-the captain ; "[0-i] the wood in front of [us]1686-us is likely clear . [The ebb]1687-the ebb has made a good while ; [[our]1686-us stores]1688-our stores should be uncovered . [Volunteers]1689-volunteers to go and bring in pork . " [Gray]133-gray and [Hunter]93-hunter were the first to come forward . Well armed , [they]3520-our enemies stole out of [the stockade]1481-the stockade , but it proved a useless mission . [The mutineers]1384-the mutineers were bolder than [we]1677-we fancied or [they]1384-the mutineers put more trust in [[Israel]112-israel 's gunnery]3526-israel 's gunnery . [For four or five of [them]3520-our enemies]3527-for four or five of them were busy carrying off [[our]1677-we stores]1688-our stores and wading out with [them]1688-our stores to one of the gigs that lay close by , pulling an oar or so to hold [her]3529-her steady against the current . [Silver]95-silver was in the stern - sheets in command ; and [every man of [them]3520-our enemies]3530-every man of them was now provided with a musket from some secret magazine of [their]3520-our enemies own . [The captain]234-the captain sat down to [his]234-the captain log , and here is the beginning of the entry : [Alexander Smollett]136-alexander smollett , [master]3532-master ; [David Livesey]137-david livesey , [ship 's doctor]3052-ship 's doctor ; [Abraham Gray]133-gray , [carpenter 's mate]3534-carpenter 's mate ; [John Trelawney]97-john trelawney , [owner]1673-owner ; [John Hunter]93-hunter and [Richard Joyce]92-joyce , [[owner]1673-owner 's servants]3537-owner 's servants , [landsmen]3538-landsmen being all that is left faithful of [[the ship]755-the ship 's company]3070-the ship 's company with stores for ten days at short rations , came ashore this day and flew British colours on [the log - house in [Treasure Island]1-treasure island]3541-the log - house in treasure island . [Thomas Redruth]91-redruth , [[owner]1673-owner 's servant]3543-owner 's servant , [landsman]3544-landsman , shot by [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers ; [James Hawkins]70-jim , [cabin - boy]3049-cabin - boy And at the same time , [I]3504-somebody was wondering over poor [Jim Hawkins]70-jim ' fate . A hail on [the land side]3547-the land side . "[3504-somebody] [Somebody]3504-somebody hailing [us]1691-us , " said [Hunter]93-hunter , who was on guard . "[71-doctor livesey] [Doctor]71-doctor livesey ! [Squire]3001-squire ! [Captain]2845-captain ! [Hullo]138-hullo , [Hunter]93-hunter , is that [you]2845-captain ? " came the cries . And [I]138-hullo ran to the door in time to see [Jim Hawkins]70-jim , safe and sound , come climbing over [the stockade]1481-the stockade .[138-hullo]

19

Narrative Resumed by [Jim Hawkins]70-jim : [The Garrison in [the Stockade]1481-the stockade]1694-the garrison in the stockade

AS soon as [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn saw the colours [he]103-ben gunn came to a halt , stopped [me]0-i by the arm , and sat down . " Now , "[103-ben gunn] said [he]103-ben gunn , " there 's [[your]0-i friends]3549-your friends , sure enough . "[103-ben gunn] " Far more likely it 's [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " That ! "[103-ben gunn] [he]103-ben gunn cried . " Why , in a place like this , where [nobody]236-nobody puts in but [gen'lemen of fortune]3552-gen'lemen of fortune , [Silver]95-silver would fly [the Jolly Roger]3553-the jolly roger , [you]0-i do n't make no doubt of that . No , that 's [[your]0-i friends]3549-your friends . There 's been blows too , and [I]103-ben gunn reckon [[your]0-i friends]3549-your friends has had the best of it ; and here [they]3549-your friends are ashore in [the old stockade]3556-the old stockade , as was made years and years ago by [Flint]113-flint . Ah , [he]113-flint was [the man to have a headpiece]3557-the man to have a headpiece , was [Flint]113-flint ! Barring rum , [his]113-flint match were never seen . [He]113-flint were afraid of none , not [he]113-flint ; [on'y Silver Silver]3558-on'y silver silver was [that genteel]3559-that genteel . "[103-ben gunn] " Well , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " that may be so , and so be it ; all the more reason that [I]103-ben gunn should hurry on and join [[my]103-ben gunn friends]3560-my friends . "[103-ben gunn] " Nay , [mate]2839-mate , "[103-ben gunn] returned [Ben]103-ben gunn , " not [you]2839-mate . [You]2839-mate 're [a good boy]336-a good boy , or [I]1696-i 'm mistook ; but [you]2839-mate 're on'y [a boy]831-a boy , all told . Now , [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn is fly . [Rum]139-rum would n't bring [me]1696-i [there]2846-there , where [you]2839-mate 're going not [rum]3565-rum would n't , till [I]1696-i see [[your]2839-mate born [gen'leman]140-gen'leman]3566-your born gen'leman and gets it on [his]140-gen'leman word of honour . And [you]2839-mate wo n't forget [my]1696-i words ; ' A precious sight that 's what [you]2839-mate 'll say , a precious sight more confidence ' and then nips [him]140-gen'leman . "[1696-i] And [he]1696-i pinched [me]0-i the third time with the same air of cleverness . " And when [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn is wanted , [you]2839-mate know where to find [him]103-ben gunn , [Jim]70-jim . Just wheer [you]2839-mate found [him]103-ben gunn today . And [him]103-ben gunn that comes is to have a white thing in [his]103-ben gunn hand , and [he]103-ben gunn 's to come alone . Oh ! And [you]2839-mate 'll say this : ' [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn , ' says [you]2839-mate , ' has reasons of [his]103-ben gunn own . ' "[1696-i] " Well , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i believe [I]0-i understand . [You]2839-mate have something to propose , and [you]2839-mate wish to see [the squire]661-the squire or [the doctor]289-the doctor , and [you]2839-mate 're to be found where [I]0-i found [you]2839-mate . Is that all ? "[0-i] " And when ? says [you]0-i , "[1697-he] [he]1697-he added . " Why , from about noon observation to about six bells . "[1697-he] " Good , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " and now may [I]1697-he go ? "[1697-he] " [You]0-i wo n't forget ? "[1697-he] [he]1697-he inquired anxiously . " Precious sight , and reasons of [his]103-ben gunn own , says [you]0-i . Reasons of [his]1697-he own ; that 's the mainstay ; as between [man]2910-man and [man]2910-man . Well , then "[1697-he] still holding [me]0-i " [I]0-i reckon [you]2839-mate can go , [Jim]70-jim . And , [Jim]70-jim , if [you]2839-mate was to see [Silver]95-silver , [you]2839-mate would n't go for to sell [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn ? Wild horses would n't draw it from [you]2839-mate ? No , says [you]2839-mate . And if [them]3571-them [pirates]3326-pirates camp [ashore]1411-ashore , [Jim]70-jim , what would [you]2839-mate say but there 'd be widders in the morning ? "[0-i] Here [he]0-i was interrupted by a loud report , and a cannonball came tearing through the trees and pitched in the sand not a hundred yards from where [we]1698-we two were talking . The next moment each of [us]1698-we had taken to [his]0-i heels in a different direction . For a good hour to come frequent reports shook [the island]187-the island , and balls kept crashing through [the woods]1241-the woods . [I]0-i moved from hiding - place to hiding - place , always pursued , or so it seemed to [me]0-i , by these terrifying missiles . But towards the end of the bombardment , though still [I]0-i durst not venture in the direction of [the stockade]1481-the stockade , where the balls fell oftenest , [I]0-i had begun , in a manner , to pluck up [my]0-i heart again , and after a long detour to the east , crept down among the shore - side trees . The sun had just set , the sea breeze was rustling and tumbling in [the woods]1241-the woods and ruffling the grey surface of [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage ; the tide , too , was far out , and great tracts of sand lay uncovered ; the air , after the heat of the day , chilled [me]0-i through [my]0-i jacket . [The HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola still lay where [she]16-the hispaniola had anchored ; but , sure enough , there was [the Jolly Roger the black flag of piracy]1704-the jolly roger the black flag of piracy flying from [her]16-the hispaniola peak . Even as [I]0-i looked , there came another red flash and another report that sent the echoes clattering , and one more round - shot whistled through the air . It was the last of the cannonade . [I]0-i lay for some time watching the bustle which succeeded the attack . [Men]475-men were demolishing something with axes on [the beach]313-the beach near [the stockade]1481-the stockade the poor jolly - boat , [I]0-i afterwards discovered . Away , near [the mouth of [the river]1476-the river]1708-the mouth of the river , a great fire was glowing among the trees , and between that point and [the ship]755-the ship one of [the gigs]1480-the gigs kept coming and going , [the men , whom [I]0-i had seen so gloomy , shouting at the oars like [children]1713-children]1712-the men , whom i had seen so gloomy , shouting at the oars like children . But there was a sound in [their]475-men voices which suggested rum . At length [I]0-i thought [I]0-i might return towards [the stockade]1481-the stockade . [I]0-i was pretty far down on [the low , sandy spit that encloses [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage to the east , and is joined at half - water to [Skeleton Island]32-skeleton island]1715-the low , sandy spit that encloses the anchorage to the east , and is joined at half - water to skeleton island ; and now , as [I]0-i rose to [my]0-i feet , [I]0-i saw , some distance further down [the spit]1717-the spit and rising from among low bushes , an isolated rock , pretty high , and peculiarly white in colour . It occurred to [me]0-i that this might be the white rock of which [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn had spoken and that some day or other [a boat]1463-a boat might be wanted and [I]0-i should know where to look for one . Then [I]0-i skirted among [the woods]1241-the woods until [I]0-i had regained the rear , or [shoreward side]1720-shoreward side , of [the stockade]1481-the stockade , and was soon warmly welcomed by [the faithful party]1722-the faithful party . [I]0-i had soon told [my]0-i story and began to look about [me]0-i . [The log - house]1496-the log - house was made of unsquared trunks of pine roof , walls , and floor . The latter stood in several places as much as a foot or a foot and a half above the surface of [the sand]1724-the sand . There was [a porch]1725-a porch at the door , and under [this porch]1726-this porch the little spring welled up into an artificial basin of a rather odd kind no other than a great ship 's kettle of iron , with the bottom knocked out , and sunk " to [her]3574-her bearings , "[234-the captain] as [the captain]234-the captain said , among the sand . Little had been left besides the framework of [the house]228-the house , but in one corner there was a stone slab laid down by way of hearth and an old rusty iron basket to contain the fire . [The slopes of [the knoll]1490-the knoll]1729-the slopes of the knoll and all the inside of [the stockade]1481-the stockade had been cleared of timber to build [the house]228-the house , and [we]1733-our could see by the stumps what a fine and lofty grove had been destroyed . Most of the soil had been washed away or buried in drift after the removal of the trees ; only where [the streamlet]1734-the streamlet ran down from the kettle a thick bed of moss and some ferns and little creeping bushes were still green among the sand . Very close around [the stockade]1481-the stockade too close for defence , [they]1736-they said the wood still flourished high and dense , all of fir on [the land side]3547-the land side , but towards [the sea]250-the sea with a large admixture of live - oaks . The cold evening breeze , of which [I]0-i have spoken , whistled through every chink of [the rude building]1739-the rude building and sprinkled the floor with a continual rain of fine sand . There was sand in [our]1733-our eyes , sand in [our]1733-our teeth , sand in [our]1733-our suppers , sand dancing in the spring at the bottom of the kettle , for all the world like porridge beginning to boil . [Our]1733-our chimney was a square hole in the roof ; it was but a little part of the smoke that found its way out , and the rest eddied about [the house]228-the house and kept [us]1733-our coughing and piping the eye . Add to this that [Gray]133-gray , [the new man]1741-the new man , had [his]133-gray face tied up in a bandage for a cut [he]133-gray had got in breaking away from [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers and that poor old [Tom Redruth]91-redruth , still unburied , lay along the wall , stiff and stark , under the Union Jack . If [we]1733-our had been allowed to sit idle , [we]1733-our should all have fallen in the blues , but [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett was never the man for that . All hands were called up before [him]108-captain smollett , and [he]108-captain smollett divided [us]1733-our into watches . [The doctor]289-the doctor and [Gray]133-gray and [I]0-i for one ; [the squire]661-the squire , [Hunter]93-hunter , and [Joyce]92-joyce upon the other . Tired though [we]1733-our all were , two were sent out for firewood ; two more were set to dig a grave for [Redruth]91-redruth ; [the doctor]289-the doctor was named [cook]783-cook ; [I]0-i was put [sentry at the door]1747-sentry at the door ; and [the captain]234-the captain [himself]234-the captain went from one to another , keeping up [our]1733-our spirits and lending a hand wherever it was wanted . From time to time [the doctor]289-the doctor came to the door for a little air and to rest [his]289-the doctor eyes , which were almost smoked out of [his]289-the doctor head , and whenever [he]289-the doctor did so , [he]289-the doctor had a word for [me]0-i . " [That man]1009-that man [Smollett]108-captain smollett , "[289-the doctor] [he]289-the doctor said once , " is [a better man]3576-a better man than [I]289-the doctor am . And when [I]289-the doctor say that it means a deal , [Jim]70-jim . "[289-the doctor] Another time [he]289-the doctor came and was silent for a while . Then [he]289-the doctor put [his]289-the doctor head on one side , and looked at [me]0-i . " Is this [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn [a man]318-a man ? "[289-the doctor] [he]289-the doctor asked . " [I]0-i do not know , [sir]2853-sir , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " [I]0-i am not very sure whether [he]289-the doctor 's sane . "[0-i] " If there 's any doubt about the matter , [he]289-the doctor is , "[289-the doctor] returned [the doctor]289-the doctor . " [A man who has been three years biting [his]289-the doctor nails on [a desert island]3580-a desert island , [Jim]70-jim , ca n't expect to appear as sane as [you]70-jim or [me]289-the doctor]3579-a man who has been three years biting his nails on a desert island , jim , ca n't expect to appear as sane as you or me . It does n't lie in human nature . Was it cheese [you]289-the doctor said [he]289-the doctor had a fancy for ? "[289-the doctor] " Yes , [sir]2853-sir , cheese , "[0-i] [I]0-i answered . " Well , [Jim]70-jim , "[289-the doctor] says [he]289-the doctor , " just see the good that comes of being dainty in [your]70-jim food . [You]70-jim 've seen [my]289-the doctor snuff - box , have n't [you]70-jim ? And [you]70-jim never saw [me]289-the doctor take snuff , the reason being that in [my]289-the doctor snuff - box [I]289-the doctor carry a piece of Parmesan cheese a cheese made in [Italy]39-italy , very nutritious . Well , that 's for [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn ! "[289-the doctor] Before supper was eaten [we]1751-we buried [old Tom]91-redruth in [the sand]1724-the sand and stood round [him]91-redruth for a while bare - headed in the breeze . A good deal of firewood had been got in , but not enough for [the captain]234-the captain 's fancy , and [he]289-the doctor shook [his]289-the doctor head over it and told [us]1751-we [we]1751-we " must get back to this tomorrow rather livelier . "[289-the doctor] Then , when [we]1751-we had eaten [our]1751-we pork and [each]495-each had a good stiff glass of brandy grog , [the three chiefs]1755-the three chiefs got together in a corner to discuss [our]1751-we prospects . It appears [they]1755-the three chiefs were at [their]1755-the three chiefs wits ' end what to do , [the stores]3509-the stores being so low that [we]1751-we must have been starved into surrender long before help came . But [our]1751-we best hope , it was decided , was to kill off [the buccaneers]595-the buccaneers until [they]595-the buccaneers either hauled down [their]595-the buccaneers flag or ran away with [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola . From nineteen [they]595-the buccaneers were already reduced to fifteen , [two others]1758-two others were wounded , and [one at least the man shot beside the gun]1759-one at least the man shot beside the gun severely wounded , if [he]1759-one at least the man shot beside the gun were not dead . Every time [we]1751-we had a crack at [them]595-the buccaneers , [we]1751-we were to take it , saving [our]1751-we own lives , with the extremest care . And besides that , [we]1751-we had [two able allies rum]1760-two able allies rum and the climate . As for the first , though [we]1751-we were about half a mile away , [we]1751-we could hear [them]595-the buccaneers roaring and singing late into the night ; and as for the second , [the doctor]289-the doctor staked [his]289-the doctor wig that , camped where [they]595-the buccaneers were in [the marsh]1327-the marsh and unprovided with remedies , [the half of [them]595-the buccaneers]1763-the half of them would be on [their]595-the buccaneers backs before a week . " So , "[289-the doctor] [he]289-the doctor added , " if [we]1751-we are not all shot down first [they]595-the buccaneers 'll be glad to be packing in [the schooner]852-the schooner . It 's always [a ship]713-a ship , and [they]595-the buccaneers can get to buccaneering again , [I]289-the doctor suppose . "[289-the doctor] " [First ship that ever [I]108-captain smollett lost]3584-first ship that ever i lost , "[108-captain smollett] said [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett . [I]0-i was dead tired , as [you]1764-you may fancy ; and when [I]0-i got to sleep , which was not till after a great deal of tossing , [I]0-i slept like a log of wood . [The rest]599-the rest had long been up and had already breakfasted and increased the pile of firewood by about half as much again when [I]0-i was wakened by a bustle and the sound of voices . " Flag of truce ! "[2971-someone] [I]0-i heard [someone]2971-someone say ; and then , immediately after , with a cry of surprise , " [Silver]95-silver [himself]95-silver ! "[2971-someone] And at that , up [I]0-i jumped , and rubbing [my]0-i eyes , ran to a loophole in the wall .

20

[[Silver]95-silver 's Embassy]1767-silver 's embassy

SURE enough , there were [two men]1768-two men just outside [the stockade]1481-the stockade , one of [them]1768-two men waving a white cloth , [the other]350-the other , no less [a person than [Silver]95-silver [himself]95-silver]1771-a person than silver himself , standing placidly by . It was still quite early , and the coldest morning that [I]0-i think [I]0-i ever was abroad in a chill that pierced into the marrow . The sky was bright and cloudless overhead , and the tops of the trees shone rosily in the sun . But where [Silver]95-silver stood with [[his]95-silver lieutenant]1772-his lieutenant , all was still in shadow , and [they]1768-two men waded knee - deep in a low white vapour that had crawled during the night out of [the morass]1773-the morass . The chill and the vapour taken together told a poor tale of [the island]187-the island . [It]1775-it was plainly [a damp , feverish , unhealthy spot]1776-a damp , feverish , unhealthy spot . " Keep indoors , [men]475-men , "[234-the captain] said [the captain]234-the captain . " Ten to one this is a trick . "[234-the captain] Then [he]234-the captain hailed [the buccaneer]1778-the buccaneer . " Who goes ? Stand , or [we]1781-you fire . "[234-the captain] " Flag of truce , "[95-silver] cried [Silver]95-silver . [The captain]234-the captain was in [the porch]1780-the porch , keeping [himself]234-the captain carefully out of the way of a treacherous shot , should any be intended . [He]234-the captain turned and spoke to [us]1781-you , " [Doctor]2886-doctor 's watch on the lookout . [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey take the north side , if [you]1781-you please ; [Jim]70-jim , the east ; [Gray]133-gray , west . [The watch below]3587-the watch below , all hands to load muskets . Lively , [men]475-men , and careful . "[234-the captain] And then [he]234-the captain turned again to [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers . " And what do [you]1781-you want with [your]1781-you flag of truce ? "[234-the captain] [he]234-the captain cried . This time it was [the other man]1348-the other man who replied . " [Cap'n Silver]3589-cap'n silver , [sir]2853-sir , to come on board and make terms , "[1348-the other man] [he]1348-the other man shouted . " [Cap'n Silver]95-silver ! Do n't know [him]95-silver . Who 's [he]95-silver ? "[234-the captain] cried [the captain]234-the captain . And [we]1785-we could hear [him]234-the captain adding to [himself]234-the captain , " [Cap'n]113-flint , is it ? [My]234-the captain heart , and here 's promotion ! "[234-the captain] [Long John]95-silver answered for [himself]95-silver . " [Me]95-silver , [sir]2853-sir . [These poor lads]3592-these poor lads have chosen [me]95-silver cap'n , after [your]2853-sir desertion , [sir]2853-sir "[95-silver] laying a particular emphasis upon the word " desertion . "[234-the captain] " [We]1785-we 're willing to submit , if [we]1785-we can come to terms , and no bones about it . All [I]234-the captain ask is [your]2853-sir word , [Cap'n Smollett]122-cap'n smollett , to let [me]234-the captain safe and sound out of this [here stockade]3594-here stockade , and one minute to get out o ' shot before a gun is fired . "[234-the captain] " [[My]108-captain smollett man]1015-my man , "[108-captain smollett] said [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett , " [I]108-captain smollett have not the slightest desire to talk to [you]1015-my man . If [you]1015-my man wish to talk to [me]108-captain smollett , [you]1015-my man can come , that 's all . If there 's any treachery , it 'll be on [your]1015-my man side , and [the Lord]3596-the lord help [you]1015-my man . "[108-captain smollett] " That 's enough , [cap'n]3202-cap'n , "[95-silver] shouted [Long John]95-silver cheerily . " A word from [you]1015-my man 's enough . [I]95-silver know [a gentleman]2998-a gentleman , and [you]1015-my man may lay to that . "[95-silver] [We]1786-we could see [the man who carried the flag of truce]1787-the man who carried the flag of truce attempting to hold [Silver]95-silver back . Nor was that wonderful , seeing how cavalier had been [the captain]234-the captain 's answer . But [Silver]95-silver laughed at [him]234-the captain aloud and slapped [him]234-the captain on the back as if the idea of alarm had been absurd . Then [he]95-silver advanced to [the stockade]1481-the stockade , threw over [his]95-silver crutch , got a leg up , and with great vigour and skill succeeded in surmounting the fence and dropping safely to the other side . [I]0-i will confess that [I]0-i was far too much taken up with what was going on to be of the slightest use as [sentry]1790-sentry ; indeed , [I]0-i had already deserted [my]0-i eastern loophole and crept up behind [the captain]234-the captain , who had now seated [himself]234-the captain on the threshold , with [his]234-the captain elbows on [his]234-the captain knees , [his]234-the captain head in [his]234-the captain hands , and [his]234-the captain eyes fixed on the water as it bubbled out of the old iron kettle in the sand . [He]234-the captain was whistling " Come , [Lasses]3599-lasses and [Lads]2975-lads . "[234-the captain] [Silver]95-silver had terrible hard work getting up [the knoll]1490-the knoll . What with the steepness of the incline , the thick tree stumps , and the soft sand , [he]95-silver and [his]95-silver crutch were as helpless as [a ship]713-a ship in stays . But [he]95-silver stuck to it like [a man in silence]1794-a man in silence , and at last arrived before [the captain]234-the captain , whom [he]95-silver saluted in the handsomest style . [He]95-silver was tricked out in [his]95-silver best ; an immense blue coat , thick with brass buttons , hung as low as to [his]95-silver knees , and a fine laced hat was set on the back of [his]95-silver head . " Here [you]95-silver are , [[my]234-the captain man]1015-my man , "[234-the captain] said [the captain]234-the captain , raising [his]234-the captain head . " [You]95-silver had better sit down . "[234-the captain] " [You]95-silver ai n't a - going to let [me]95-silver inside , [cap'n]3202-cap'n ? "[95-silver] complained [Long John]95-silver . " It 's a main cold morning , to be sure , [sir]2853-sir , to sit outside upon [the sand]1724-the sand . "[95-silver] " Why , [Silver]95-silver , "[234-the captain] said [the captain]234-the captain , " if [you]95-silver had pleased to be [an honest man]3092-an honest man , [you]95-silver might have been sitting in [[your]95-silver galley]3606-your galley . " Right [you]95-silver were , [Cap'n Smollett]108-captain smollett , "[141-silver] replied [Silver]141-silver . " [Dooty]106-dooty is dooty , to be sure . Well now , [you]95-silver look here , that was a good lay of [yours]95-silver last night . [I]141-silver do n't deny it was a good lay . Some of [you]95-silver pretty handy with a handspike - end . And [I]141-silver 'll not deny neither but what [some of [[my]141-silver people]3616-my people]3615-some of my people was shook maybe all was shook ; maybe [I]141-silver was shook [myself]141-silver ; maybe that 's why [I]141-silver 'm here for terms . But [you]95-silver mark [me]141-silver , [cap'n]3202-cap'n , it wo n't do twice , by thunder ! [We]3618-we 'll have to do sentry - go and ease off a point or so on the rum . Maybe [you]95-silver think [we]3618-we were all a sheet in the wind 's eye . But [I]141-silver 'll tell [you]95-silver [I]141-silver was sober ; [I]141-silver was on'y dog tired ; and if [I]141-silver 'd awoke a second sooner , [I]141-silver 'd ' a caught [you]95-silver at the act , [I]141-silver would . [I]0-i began to suppose that [he]103-ben gunn had paid [the buccaneers]595-the buccaneers a visit while [they]595-the buccaneers all lay drunk together round [their]595-the buccaneers fire , and [I]0-i reckoned up with glee that [we]1803-we had only fourteen enemies to deal with . "[95-silver] And [he]95-silver filled a pipe and lighted it ; and [the two men]917-the two men sat silently smoking for quite a while , now looking [each other]471-each other in the face , now stopping [their]917-the two men tobacco , now leaning forward to spit . It was as good as the play to see [them]917-the two men . " Now , "[95-silver] resumed [Silver]95-silver , " here it is . [You]1801-you give [us]917-the two men the chart to get the treasure by , and drop shooting [poor seamen]3627-poor seamen and stoving of [their]3627-poor seamen heads in while asleep . " Is that all ? "[108-captain smollett] [he]108-captain smollett asked . " Every last word , by thunder ! "[95-silver] answered [John]95-silver .
