"[234-the captain] [Silver]101-silver 's face was a picture ; [his]101-silver eyes started in [his]101-silver head with wrath . [He]101-silver shook the fire out of [his]101-silver pipe . " Give [me]101-silver a hand up ! "[101-silver] [he]101-silver cried . " Not [I]234-the captain , "[234-the captain] returned [the captain]234-the captain . " Who 'll give [me]101-silver a hand up ? "[101-silver] [he]101-silver roared . Not [a man among [us]1813-us]1812-a man among us moved . Growling the foulest imprecations , [he]101-silver crawled along the sand till [he]101-silver got hold of [the porch]1780-the porch and could hoist [himself]101-silver again upon [his]101-silver crutch . Then [he]101-silver spat into the spring . " There ! "[101-silver] [he]101-silver cried . " That 's what [I]101-silver think of [ye]3649-ye . Before an hour 's out , [I]101-silver 'll stove in [[your]3649-ye old block house]3650-your old block house like [a rum puncheon]3651-a rum puncheon . Laugh , by thunder , laugh ! Before an hour 's out , [ye'll]3649-ye laugh upon the other side . [Them]3652-them that die'll be [the lucky ones]3653-the lucky ones . "[101-silver] And with a dreadful oath [he]101-silver stumbled off , ploughed down [the sand]1724-the sand , was helped across [the stockade]1481-the stockade , after four or five failures , by [the man with the flag of truce , and disappeared in an instant afterwards among the trees]1817-the man with the flag of truce , and disappeared in an instant afterwards among the trees .

21

[The Attack]1818-the attack

AS soon as [Silver]101-silver disappeared , [the captain]234-the captain , who had been closely watching [him]101-silver , turned towards [the interior of [the house]228-the house]1820-the interior of the house and found not [a man of [us]1823-we at [his]101-silver post]1822-a man of us at his post but [Gray]133-gray . It was the first time [we]1823-we had ever seen [him]133-gray angry . " Quarters ! "[133-gray] [he]133-gray roared . And then , as [we]1823-we all slunk back to [our]1823-we places , " [Gray]133-gray , "[133-gray] [he]133-gray said , " [I]133-gray 'll put [your]133-gray name in the log ; [you]133-gray 've stood by [your]133-gray duty like [a seaman]221-a seaman . [Mr. Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney , [I]133-gray 'm surprised at [you]133-gray , [sir]2853-sir . [Doctor]2886-doctor , [I]133-gray thought [you]133-gray had worn [the king]3657-the king 's coat ! If that was how [you]133-gray served at [Fontenoy]38-fontenoy , [sir]2853-sir , [you]133-gray 'd have been better in [your]133-gray berth . "[133-gray] [The doctor]289-the doctor 's watch were all back at [their]1825-their loopholes , [the rest]599-the rest were busy loading the spare muskets , and [everyone with a red face]1827-everyone with a red face , [you]1828-you may be certain , and a flea in [his]1827-everyone with a red face ear , as the saying is . [The captain]234-the captain looked on for a while in silence . Then [he]234-the captain spoke . " [[My]234-the captain lads]3356-my lads , "[234-the captain] said [he]234-the captain , " [I]234-the captain 've given [Silver]101-silver a broadside . [I]234-the captain pitched it in red - hot on purpose ; and before the hour 's out , as [he]234-the captain said , [we]3660-we shall be boarded . [We]3660-we 're outnumbered , [I]234-the captain need n't tell [you]3356-my lads that , but [we]3660-we fight in shelter ; and a minute ago [I]234-the captain should have said [we]3660-we fought with discipline . [I]234-the captain 've no manner of doubt that [we]3660-we can drub [them]3661-them , if [you]3356-my lads choose . "[234-the captain] Then [he]234-the captain went the rounds and saw , as [he]234-the captain said , that all was clear . On the two short sides of [the house]228-the house , east and west , there were only two loopholes ; on the south side where [the porch]1780-the porch was , two again ; and on the north side , five . There was a round score of muskets for [the seven of [us]1833-us]1832-the seven of us ; the firewood had been built into four piles tables , [you]1834-you might say one about the middle of each side , and on each of these tables some ammunition and four loaded muskets were laid ready to the hand of [the defenders]1835-the defenders . In the middle , the cutlasses lay ranged . " Toss out the fire , "[234-the captain] said [the captain]234-the captain ; " the chill is past , and [we]3660-we must n't have smoke in [our]3660-we eyes . "[234-the captain] The iron fire - basket was carried bodily out by [Mr. Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney , and the embers smothered among sand . " [Hawkins]70-jim has n't had [his]70-jim breakfast . [Hawkins]70-jim , help [yourself]3356-my lads , and back to [[your]3356-my lads post]3662-your post to eat it , "[108-captain smollett] continued [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett . " Lively , now , [[my]108-captain smollett lad]3074-my lad ; [you]3356-my lads 'll want it before [you]3356-my lads 've done . [Hunter]93-hunter , serve out a round of brandy to [all hands]3111-all hands . "[108-captain smollett] And while this was going on , [the captain]234-the captain completed , in [his]234-the captain own mind , the plan of the defence . " [Doctor]2886-doctor , [you]2886-doctor will take the door , "[234-the captain] [he]234-the captain resumed . " See , and do n't expose [yourself]2886-doctor ; keep within , and fire through [the porch]1780-the porch . [Hunter]93-hunter , take the east side , there . [Joyce]92-joyce , [you]3356-my lads stand by the west , [[my]234-the captain man]1015-my man . [Mr. Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney , [you]3356-my lads are the best shot [you]3356-my lads and [Gray]133-gray will take this long north side , with the five loopholes ; it 's there the danger is . If [they]3668-they can get up to it and fire in upon [us]1839-our through [[our]1839-our own ports]3669-our own ports , things would begin to look dirty . [Hawkins]70-jim , neither [you]3356-my lads nor [I]234-the captain are much account at the shooting ; [we]1839-our 'll stand by to load and bear a hand . "[234-the captain] As [the captain]234-the captain had said , the chill was past . As soon as the sun had climbed above [our]1839-our girdle of trees , it fell with all its force upon [the clearing]1840-the clearing and drank up the vapours at a draught . Soon the sand was baking and the resin melting in the logs of [the block house]1542-the block house . Jackets and coats were flung aside , shirts thrown open at the neck and rolled up to the shoulders ; and [we]1839-our stood there , each at [[his]234-the captain post]1842-his post , in a fever of heat and anxiety . An hour passed away . " Hang [them]3668-they ! "[234-the captain] said [the captain]234-the captain . " This is as dull as [the doldrums]3670-the doldrums . [Gray]133-gray , whistle for a wind . "[234-the captain] And just at that moment came the first news of the attack . " If [you]234-the captain please , [sir]2853-sir , "[92-joyce] said [Joyce]92-joyce , " if [I]92-joyce see [anyone]243-anyone , am [I]92-joyce to fire ? "[92-joyce] " [I]234-the captain told [you]234-the captain so ! "[234-the captain] cried [the captain]234-the captain . " Thank [you]234-the captain , [sir]2853-sir , "[92-joyce] returned [Joyce]92-joyce with the same quiet civility . Nothing followed for a time , but the remark had set [us]1839-our all on the alert , straining ears and eyes [the musketeers]1845-the musketeers with [their]1845-the musketeers pieces balanced in [their]1845-the musketeers hands , [the captain out in the middle of [the block house]1542-the block house]1846-the captain out in the middle of the block house with [his]1846-the captain out in the middle of the block house mouth very tight and a frown on [his]1846-the captain out in the middle of the block house face . So some seconds passed , till suddenly [Joyce]92-joyce whipped up [his]1846-the captain out in the middle of the block house musket and fired . The report had scarcely died away ere it was repeated and repeated from without in a scattering volley , shot behind shot , like a string of geese , from every side of [the enclosure]3506-the enclosure . Several bullets struck [the log - house]1496-the log - house , but not one entered ; and as the smoke cleared away and vanished , [the stockade]1481-the stockade and [the woods around]1851-the woods around [it]1481-the stockade looked as quiet and empty as before . Not a bough waved , not the gleam of a musket - barrel betrayed the presence of [[our]1839-our foes]1852-our foes . " Did [you]234-the captain hit [[your]234-the captain man]3674-your man ? "[234-the captain] asked [the captain]234-the captain . " No , [sir]2853-sir , "[92-joyce] replied [Joyce]92-joyce . " [I]92-joyce believe not , [sir]2853-sir . "[92-joyce] " Next best thing to tell the truth , "[108-captain smollett] muttered [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett . " Load [his]3674-your man gun , [Hawkins]70-jim . How many should say there were on [your]70-jim side , [doctor]2886-doctor ? "[108-captain smollett] " [I]63-dr. livesey know precisely , "[63-dr. livesey] said [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey . " Three shots were fired on this side . [I]63-dr. livesey saw the three flashes two close together one farther to the west . "[63-dr. livesey] " Three ! "[234-the captain] repeated [the captain]234-the captain . " And how many on [yours]70-jim , [Mr. Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney ? "[234-the captain] But this was not so easily answered . There had come many from [the north]1855-the north seven by [the squire]661-the squire 's computation , eight or nine according to [Gray]133-gray . From [the east and west]1857-the east and west only a single shot had been fired . It was plain , therefore , that the attack would be developed from [the north]1855-the north and that on the other three sides [we]1859-we were only to be annoyed by a show of hostilities . But [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett made no change in [his]108-captain smollett arrangements . If [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers succeeded in crossing [the stockade]1481-the stockade , [he]108-captain smollett argued , [they]1384-the mutineers would take possession of any unprotected loophole and shoot [us]1859-we down like rats in [[our]1859-we own stronghold]1862-our own stronghold . Nor had [we]1859-we much time left to [us]1859-we for thought . Suddenly , with a loud huzza , a little cloud of [pirates]3326-pirates leaped from [the woods on the north side]1864-the woods on the north side and ran straight on [the stockade]1481-the stockade . At the same moment , the fire was once more opened from [the woods]1241-the woods , and a rifle ball sang through the doorway and knocked [the doctor]289-the doctor 's musket into bits . [The boarders]1868-the boarders swarmed over the fence like monkeys . [Squire]62-the admiral benbow and [Gray]133-gray fired again and yet again ; [three men]557-three men fell , one forwards into [the enclosure]3506-the enclosure , [two back on the outside]1871-two back on the outside . But of these , [one]596-one was evidently more frightened than hurt , for [he]596-one was on [his]596-one feet again in a crack and instantly disappeared among the trees . [Two]1873-two had bit the dust , one had fled , four had made good [their]1874-them footing inside [our]1859-we defences , while from the shelter of [the woods]1241-the woods [seven or eight men , each evidently supplied with several muskets]1876-seven or eight men , each evidently supplied with several muskets , kept up a hot though useless fire on [the log - house]1496-the log - house . The four who had boarded made straight before [them]1874-them for [the building]1878-the building , shouting as [they]1874-them ran , and [the men among the trees]1879-the men among the trees shouted back to encourage [them]1874-them . Several shots were fired , but such was the hurry of [the marksmen]1880-the marksmen that [not one]493-not one appears to have taken effect . In a moment , [the four pirates]1882-the four pirates had swarmed up the mound and were upon [us]1859-we . [The head of [Job Anderson]111-anderson]1883-the head of job anderson , [the boatswain]1029-the boatswain , appeared at the middle loophole . " At ['em]3678-'em , all hands all hands ! "[1883-the head of job anderson] [he]1883-the head of job anderson roared in a voice of thunder . At the same moment , [another pirate]1885-another pirate grasped [Hunter]93-hunter 's musket by the muzzle , wrenched it from [his]1885-another pirate hands , plucked it through the loophole , and with one stunning blow , laid [the poor fellow]1415-the poor fellow senseless on the floor . Meanwhile a third , running unharmed all around [the house]228-the house , appeared suddenly in the doorway and fell with [his]1885-another pirate cutlass on [the doctor]289-the doctor . [Our]1859-we position was utterly reversed . A moment since [we]1859-we were firing , under cover , at [an exposed enemy]1889-an exposed enemy ; now it was [we]1859-we who lay uncovered and could not return a blow . [The log - house]1496-the log - house was full of smoke , to which [we]1859-we owed [our]1859-we comparative safety . Cries and confusion , the flashes and reports of pistol - shots , and one loud groan rang in [my]0-i ears . " Out , [lads]2975-lads , out , and fight 'em in the open ! Cutlasses ! "[234-the captain] cried [the captain]234-the captain . [I]0-i snatched a cutlass from the pile , and [someone , at the same time snatching another]1892-someone , at the same time snatching another , gave [me]0-i a cut across the knuckles which [I]0-i hardly felt . [I]0-i dashed out of the door into the clear sunlight . [Someone]2971-someone was close behind , [I]0-i knew not whom . Right in front , [the doctor]289-the doctor was pursuing [[his]289-the doctor assailant]1895-his assailant down [the hill]365-the hill , and just as [my]0-i eyes fell upon [him]1895-his assailant , beat down [his]1895-his assailant guard and sent [him]1895-his assailant sprawling on [his]1895-his assailant back with a great slash across the face . " Round [the house]228-the house , [lads]2975-lads ! Round [the house]228-the house ! "[234-the captain] cried [the captain]234-the captain ; and even in the hurly - burly , [I]0-i perceived a change in [his]234-the captain voice . [Mechanically]144-mechanically , [I]0-i obeyed , turned eastwards , and with [my]0-i cutlass raised , ran round the corner of [the house]228-the house . Next moment [I]0-i was face to face with [Anderson]111-anderson . [He]111-anderson roared aloud , and [his]111-anderson hanger went up above [his]111-anderson head , flashing in the sunlight . [I]0-i had not time to be afraid , but as the blow still hung impending , leaped in a trice upon one side , and missing [my]0-i foot in the soft sand , rolled headlong down [the slope]618-the slope . When [I]0-i had first sallied from the door , [the other mutineers]1900-the other mutineers had been already swarming up the palisade to make an end of [us]1901-us . [One man]1544-one man , in a red night - cap , with [his]1544-one man cutlass in [his]1544-one man mouth , had even got upon the top and thrown a leg across . Well , so short had been the interval that when [I]0-i found [my]0-i feet again all was in the same posture , [the fellow with the red night - cap still half - way over , another still just showing [his]1544-one man head above the top of [the stockade]1481-the stockade]1903-the fellow with the red night - cap still half - way over , another still just showing his head above the top of the stockade . And yet , in this breath of time , the fight was over and the victory was [ours]1901-us . [Gray]133-gray , following close behind [me]0-i , had cut down [the big boatswain]1905-the big boatswain ere [he]111-anderson had time to recover from [his]111-anderson last blow . [Another]602-another had been shot at a loophole in the very act of firing into [the house]228-the house and now lay in agony , the pistol still smoking in [his]1544-one man hand . A third , as [I]0-i had seen , [the doctor]289-the doctor had disposed of at a blow . Of [the four who had scaled the palisade]1909-the four who had scaled the palisade , [one]596-one only remained unaccounted for , and [he]1544-one man , having left [his]1544-one man cutlass on [the field]1911-the field , was now clambering out again with the fear of death upon [him]1544-one man . " Fire fire from [the house]228-the house ! "[289-the doctor] cried [the doctor]289-the doctor . " And [you]0-i , [lads]2975-lads , back into cover . "[289-the doctor] But [his]289-the doctor words were unheeded , no shot was fired , and [the last boarder]1913-the last boarder made good [his]1913-the last boarder escape and disappeared with the rest into [the wood]1374-the wood . In three seconds nothing remained of [the attacking party]1915-the attacking party but the five who had fallen , [four on the inside]1916-four on the inside and [one on the outside of the palisade]1917-one on the outside of the palisade . [The doctor]289-the doctor and [Gray]133-gray and [I]0-i ran full speed for shelter . [The survivors]1919-the survivors would soon be back where [they]1919-the survivors had left [their]1919-the survivors muskets , and at any moment the fire might recommence . [The house]228-the house was by this time somewhat cleared of smoke , and [we]1921-we saw at a glance the price [we]1921-we had paid for victory . [Hunter]93-hunter lay beside [his]1922-his loophole , stunned ; [Joyce]92-joyce by [his]1922-his , shot through the head , never to move again ; while right in the centre , [the squire]661-the squire was supporting [the captain]234-the captain , one as pale as the other . " [The captain]234-the captain 's wounded , "[86-mr. trelawney] said [Mr. Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney . " Have [they]1384-the mutineers run ? "[125-mr. smollett] asked [Mr. Smollett]125-mr. smollett . " All that could , [you]125-mr. smollett may be bound , "[289-the doctor] returned [the doctor]289-the doctor ; " but there 's five of [them]1384-the mutineers will never run again . "[289-the doctor] " Five ! "[234-the captain] cried [the captain]234-the captain . " Come , that 's better . Five against three leaves [us]3686-we four to nine . That 's better odds than [we]3686-we had at starting . [We]3686-we were seven to nineteen then , or thought [we]3686-we were , and that 's as bad to bear . "[234-the captain] [The mutineers]1384-the mutineers were soon only eight in number , for [the man shot by [Mr. Trelawney]86-mr. trelawney on board [the schooner]852-the schooner]1928-the man shot by mr. trelawney on board the schooner died that same evening of [his]1928-the man shot by mr. trelawney on board the schooner wound . But this was , of course , not known till after by [the faithful party]1722-the faithful party .

PART FIVE [My]0-i Sea Adventure

22

How [My]0-i Sea Adventure Began

THERE was no return of [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers not so much as another shot out of [the woods]1241-the woods . [They]1384-the mutineers had " got [their]1384-the mutineers rations for that day , "[1384-the mutineers] as [the captain]234-the captain put it , and [we]1934-we had [the place]2937-the place to [ourselves]1934-we and a quiet time to overhaul [the wounded]1936-the wounded and get dinner . [Squire]62-the admiral benbow and [I]0-i cooked outside in spite of the danger , and even [outside]1937-outside [we]1934-we could hardly tell what [we]1934-we were at , for horror of the loud groans that reached [us]1934-we from [[the doctor]289-the doctor 's patients]1939-the doctor 's patients . Out of [the eight men who had fallen in the action]1940-the eight men who had fallen in the action , only three still breathed that one of [the pirates who had been shot at the loophole]1941-the pirates who had been shot at the loophole , [Hunter]93-hunter , and [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett ; and of these , [the first two]1942-the first two were as good as dead ; [the mutineer]1943-the mutineer indeed died under [the doctor]289-the doctor 's knife , and [Hunter]93-hunter , do what [we]1934-we could , never recovered consciousness in [this world]1945-this world . [He]1943-the mutineer lingered all day , breathing loudly like [the old buccaneer at [home]659-home in [his]1943-the mutineer apoplectic fit]1946-the old buccaneer at home in his apoplectic fit , but the bones of [his]1943-the mutineer chest had been crushed by the blow and [his]1943-the mutineer skull fractured in falling , and some time in the following night , without sign or sound , [he]1943-the mutineer went to [[his]1943-the mutineer Maker]1948-his maker . As for [the captain]234-the captain , [his]234-the captain wounds were grievous indeed , but not dangerous . [No organ]1950-no organ was fatally injured . [Anderson]111-anderson 's ball for it was [Job]111-anderson that shot [him]111-anderson first had broken [his]111-anderson shoulder - blade and touched the lung , not badly ; the second had only torn and displaced some muscles in the calf . [He]111-anderson was sure to recover , [the doctor]289-the doctor said , but in the meantime , and for weeks to come , [he]111-anderson must not walk nor move [his]111-anderson arm , nor so much as speak when [he]111-anderson could help it . [My]0-i own accidental cut across the knuckles was a flea - bite . [Doctor Livesey]71-doctor livesey patched it up with plaster and pulled [my]0-i ears for [me]0-i into the bargain . After dinner [the squire]661-the squire and [the doctor]289-the doctor sat by [the captain]234-the captain 's side awhile in consultation ; and when [they]1955-they had talked to [their]1955-they hearts ' content , it being then a little past noon , [the doctor]289-the doctor took up [his]289-the doctor hat and pistols , girt on a cutlass , put the chart in [his]289-the doctor pocket , and with a musket over [his]289-the doctor shoulder crossed the palisade on [the north side]1957-the north side and set off briskly through the trees . [Gray]133-gray and [I]0-i were sitting together at the far end of [the block house]1542-the block house , to be out of earshot of [[our]1959-our officers]1960-our officers consulting ; and [Gray]133-gray took [his]133-gray pipe out of [his]133-gray mouth and fairly forgot to put it back again , so thunder - struck [he]133-gray was at this occurrence . " Why , in the name of [Davy Jones]142-davy jones , "[133-gray] said [he]133-gray , " is [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey mad ? "[133-gray] " Why no , "[0-i] says [I.]0-i " [He]133-gray 's about the last of [this crew]3370-this crew for that , [I]0-i take it . "[0-i] " Well , [shipmate]3688-shipmate , "[133-gray] said [Gray]133-gray , " mad [he]133-gray may not be ; but if [HE]133-gray 'S not , [you]0-i mark [my]133-gray words , [I]133-gray am . "[133-gray] " [I]0-i take it , "[0-i] replied [I]0-i , " [the doctor]289-the doctor has [his]289-the doctor idea ; and if [I]0-i am right , [he]289-the doctor 's going now to see [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn . "[0-i] [I]0-i was right , as appeared later ; but in the meantime , [the house]228-the house being stifling hot and the little patch of sand inside [the palisade]1651-the palisade ablaze with midday sun , [I]0-i began to get another thought into [my]0-i head , which was not by any means so right . What [I]0-i began to do was to envy [the doctor]289-the doctor walking in the cool shadow of [the woods]1241-the woods with the birds about [him]289-the doctor and the pleasant smell of the pines , while [I]0-i sat grilling , with [my]0-i clothes stuck to the hot resin , and so much blood about [me]0-i and so many poor dead bodies lying all around that [I]0-i took a disgust of [the place]2937-the place that was almost as strong as fear . All the time [I]0-i was washing out [the block house]1542-the block house , and then washing up the things from dinner , this disgust and envy kept growing stronger and stronger , till at last , being near a bread - bag , and [no one]411-no one then observing [me]0-i , [I]0-i took the first step towards [my]0-i escapade and filled both pockets of [my]0-i coat with biscuit . [I]0-i was [a fool]2916-a fool , if [you]1969-you like , and certainly [I]0-i was going to do a foolish , over - bold act ; but [I]0-i was determined to do it with all the precautions in [my]0-i power . These biscuits , should anything befall [me]0-i , would keep [me]0-i , at least , from starving till far on in the next day . The next thing [I]0-i laid hold of was a brace of pistols , and as [I]0-i already had a powder - horn and bullets , [I]0-i felt [myself]0-i well supplied with arms . As for the scheme [I]0-i had in [my]0-i head , it was not a bad one in itself . [I]0-i was to go down [the sandy spit that divides [the anchorage on the east]1971-the anchorage on the east from [the open sea]1972-the open sea]1970-the sandy spit that divides the anchorage on the east from the open sea , find [the white rock [I]0-i had observed]1973-the white rock i had observed last evening , and ascertain whether it was there or not that [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn had hidden [[his]103-ben gunn boat]1974-his boat , a thing quite worth doing , as [I]0-i still believe . But as [I]0-i was certain [I]0-i should not be allowed to leave [the enclosure]3506-the enclosure , [my]0-i only plan was to take [French]1976-french leave and slip out when [nobody]236-nobody was watching , and that was so bad a way of doing it as made the thing itself wrong . But [I]0-i was only [a boy]831-a boy , and [I]0-i had made [my]0-i mind up . Well , as things at last fell out , [I]0-i found an admirable opportunity . [The squire]661-the squire and [Gray]133-gray were busy helping [the captain]234-the captain with [his]234-the captain bandages , [the coast]209-the coast was clear , [I]0-i made a bolt for it over [the stockade]1481-the stockade and into the thickest of the trees , and before [my]0-i absence was observed [I]0-i was out of cry of [[my]0-i companions]1983-my companions . This was [my]0-i second folly , far worse than the first , as [I]0-i left but [two sound men]1984-two sound men to guard [the house]228-the house ; but like the first , it was a help towards saving [all of [us]1986-all of us]1986-all of us . [I]0-i took [my]0-i way straight for [the east coast of [the island]187-the island]1987-the east coast of the island , for [I]0-i was determined to go down [the sea side of the spit]1989-the sea side of the spit to avoid all chance of observation from [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage . It was already late in the afternoon , although still warm and sunny . As [I]0-i continued to thread [the tall woods]1991-the tall woods , [I]0-i could hear from far before [me]0-i not only the continuous thunder of the surf , but a certain tossing of foliage and grinding of boughs which showed [me]0-i the sea breeze had set in higher than usual . Soon cool draughts of air began to reach [me]0-i , and a few steps farther [I]0-i came forth into the open borders of [the grove]1992-the grove , and saw [the sea]250-the sea lying blue and sunny to the horizon and the surf tumbling and tossing its foam along [the beach]313-the beach . [I]0-i have never seen [the sea]250-the sea quiet round [Treasure Island]1-treasure island . The sun might blaze overhead , the air be without a breath , the surface smooth and blue , but still these great rollers would be running along all [the external coast]1996-the external coast , thundering and thundering by day and night ; and [I]0-i scarce believe there is one spot in [the island]187-the island where [a man]318-a man would be out of earshot of [their]1999-their noise . [I]0-i walked along beside the surf with great enjoyment , till , thinking [I]0-i was now got far enough to the south , [I]0-i took the cover of some thick bushes and crept warily up to [the ridge of [the spit]1717-the spit]2000-the ridge of the spit . Behind [me]0-i was [the sea]250-the sea , in front [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage . The sea breeze , as though it had the sooner blown itself out by its unusual violence , was already at an end ; it had been succeeded by light , variable airs from [the south and south - east]2004-the south and south - east , carrying great banks of fog ; and [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage , under lee of [Skeleton Island]32-skeleton island , lay still and leaden as when first [we]2006-we entered [it]3321-the anchorage . [The HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola , in that unbroken mirror , was exactly portrayed from [the truck]2007-the truck to [the waterline]2008-the waterline , the Jolly Roger hanging from [her]16-the hispaniola peak . Alongside lay one of [the gigs]1480-the gigs , [Silver]101-silver in the stern - sheets [him]2010-him [I]0-i could always recognize while [a couple of [men]475-men]2011-a couple of men were leaning over [the stern bulwarks]2013-the stern bulwarks , one of [them]2011-a couple of men with a red cap the very rogue that [I]0-i had seen some hours before stride - legs upon the palisade . Apparently [they]2011-a couple of men were talking and laughing , though at that distance upwards of a mile [I]0-i could , of course , hear no word of what was said . All at once there began the most horrid , unearthly screaming , which at first startled [me]0-i badly , though [I]0-i had soon remembered the voice of [Captain Flint]74-flint and even thought [I]0-i could make out the bird by [her]16-the hispaniola bright plumage as [she]16-the hispaniola sat perched upon [[her]16-the hispaniola master]2014-her master 's wrist . Soon after , [the jolly - boat]1479-the jolly - boat shoved off and pulled for [shore]1535-shore , and [the man with the red cap]2017-the man with the red cap and [[his]2017-the man with the red cap comrade]2018-his comrade went below by the cabin companion . Just about the same time , the sun had gone down behind the Spy - glass , and as the fog was collecting rapidly , it began to grow dark in earnest . [I]0-i saw [I]0-i must lose no time if [I]0-i were to find [the boat]1260-the boat that evening . The white rock , visible enough above [the brush]2020-the brush , was still some eighth of a mile further down [the spit]1717-the spit , and it took [me]0-i a goodish while to get up with it , crawling , often on all fours , among the scrub . Night had almost come when [I]0-i laid [my]0-i hand on its rough sides . Right below [it]1260-the boat there was an exceedingly small hollow of green turf , hidden by banks and a thick underwood about knee - deep , that grew there very plentifully ; and in the centre of the dell , sure enough , a little tent of goat - skins , like what [the gipsies]2022-the gipsies carry about with [them]2022-the gipsies in [England]4-england . [I]0-i dropped into [the hollow]2023-the hollow , lifted the side of [the tent]2024-the tent , and there was [[Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn 's boat]2025-ben gunn 's boat home - made if ever anything was [home]659-home - made ; a rude , lop - sided framework of tough wood , and stretched upon that a covering of goat - skin , with the hair inside . The thing was extremely small , even for [me]0-i , and [I]0-i can hardly imagine that it could have floated with [a full - sized man]2027-a full - sized man . There was one thwart set as low as possible , a kind of stretcher in the bows , and a double paddle for propulsion . [I]0-i had not then seen a coracle , such as [the ancient Britons]2028-the ancient britons made , but [I]0-i have seen one since , and [I]0-i can give [you]2029-you no fairer idea of [[Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn 's boat]2025-ben gunn 's boat than by saying it was like the first and the worst coracle ever made by [man]2910-man . But the great advantage of the coracle it certainly possessed , for it was exceedingly light and portable . Well , now that [I]0-i had found [the boat]1260-the boat , [you]2029-you would have thought [I]0-i had had enough of truantry for once , but in the meantime [I]0-i had taken another notion and become so obstinately fond of it that [I]0-i would have carried it out , [I]0-i believe , in the teeth of [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett [himself]108-captain smollett . This was to slip out under cover of the night , cut [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola adrift , and let [her]16-the hispaniola go ashore where [she]16-the hispaniola fancied . [I]0-i had quite made up [my]0-i mind that [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers , after [their]1384-the mutineers repulse of the morning , had nothing nearer [their]1384-the mutineers hearts than to up anchor and away to [sea]246-sea ; this , [I]0-i thought , it would be a fine thing to prevent , and now that [I]0-i had seen how [they]1384-the mutineers left [[their]1384-the mutineers watchmen]2035-their watchmen unprovided with [a boat]1463-a boat , [I]0-i thought it might be done with little risk . Down [I]0-i sat to wait for darkness , and made a hearty meal of biscuit . It was a night out of ten thousand for [my]0-i purpose . The fog had now buried all heaven . As the last rays of daylight dwindled and disappeared , absolute blackness settled down on [Treasure Island]1-treasure island . And when , at last , [I]0-i shouldered the coracle and groped [my]0-i way stumblingly out of [the hollow where [I]0-i had supped]2037-the hollow where i had supped , there were but two points visible on [the whole anchorage]2038-the whole anchorage . One was the great fire on [shore]1535-shore , by which [the defeated pirates]2040-the defeated pirates lay carousing in [the swamp]1339-the swamp . The other , a mere blur of light upon the darkness , indicated the position of [the anchored ship]2042-the anchored ship . [She]2042-the anchored ship had swung round to the ebb [her]2042-the anchored ship bow was now towards [me]0-i the only lights on board were in [the cabin]950-the cabin , and what [I]0-i saw was merely a reflection on the fog of the strong rays that flowed from the stern window . The ebb had already run some time , and [I]0-i had to wade through a long belt of swampy sand , where [I]0-i sank several times above the ankle , before [I]0-i came to [the edge of [the retreating water]2045-the retreating water]2044-the edge of the retreating water , and wading a little way in , with some strength and dexterity , set [my]0-i coracle , keel downwards , on the surface .

23

The Ebb - tide Runs

THE coracle as [I]0-i had ample reason to know before [I]0-i was done with [her]2042-the anchored ship was a very safe boat for [a person of [my]0-i height and weight , both buoyant and clever in [a seaway]2047-a seaway]2046-a person of my height and weight , both buoyant and clever in a seaway ; but [she]2042-the anchored ship was the most cross - grained , lop - sided craft to manage . Do as [you]2048-you pleased , [she]2042-the anchored ship always made more leeway than anything else , and turning round and round was the manoeuvre [she]2042-the anchored ship was best at . Even [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn [himself]103-ben gunn has admitted that [she]2042-the anchored ship was " queer to handle till [you]2048-you knew [her]2042-the anchored ship way . "[2042-the anchored ship] Certainly [I]0-i did not know [her]2042-the anchored ship way . [She]2042-the anchored ship turned in every direction but the one [I]0-i was bound to go ; the most part of the time [we]2049-we were broadside on , and [I]0-i am very sure [I]0-i never should have made [the ship]755-the ship at all but for the tide . By good fortune , paddle as [I]0-i pleased , the tide was still sweeping [me]0-i down ; and there lay [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola right in the fairway , hardly to be missed . First [she]2042-the anchored ship loomed before [me]0-i like a blot of something yet blacker than darkness , then [her]2042-the anchored ship spars and hull began to take shape , and the next moment , as it seemed for , the farther [I]0-i went , the brisker grew the current of the ebb , [I]0-i was alongside of [her]2042-the anchored ship hawser and had laid hold . The hawser was as taut as a bowstring , and the current so strong [she]2042-the anchored ship pulled upon [her]2042-the anchored ship anchor . All round the hull , in the blackness , the rippling current bubbled and chattered like a little mountain stream . One cut with [[my]0-i sea - gully]2051-my sea - gully and [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola would go humming down the tide . So far so good , but it next occurred to [my]0-i recollection that a taut hawser , suddenly cut , is a thing as dangerous as a kicking horse . Ten to one , if [I]0-i were so foolhardy as to cut the HISPANIOLA from [her]2042-the anchored ship anchor , [I]0-i and the coracle would be knocked clean out of the water . This brought [me]0-i to a full stop , and if fortune had not again particularly favoured [me]0-i , [I]0-i should have had to abandon [my]0-i design . But the light airs which had begun blowing from [the south - east]2052-the south - east and south had hauled round after nightfall into [the south - west]2053-the south - west . Just while [I]0-i was meditating , a puff came , caught [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola , and forced [her]2042-the anchored ship up into the current ; and to [my]0-i great joy , [I]0-i felt the hawser slacken in [my]0-i grasp , and the hand by which [I]0-i held it dip for a second under water . With that [I]0-i made [my]0-i mind up , took out [[my]0-i gully]2054-my gully , opened it with [my]0-i teeth , and cut one strand after another , till [the vessel]3443-the vessel swung only by two . Then [I]0-i lay quiet , waiting to sever these last when the strain should be once more lightened by a breath of wind . All this time [I]0-i had heard the sound of loud voices from [the cabin]950-the cabin , but to say truth , [my]0-i mind had been so entirely taken up with other thoughts that [I]0-i had scarcely given ear . Now , however , when [I]0-i had nothing else to do , [I]0-i began to pay more heed . One [I]0-i recognized for [the coxswain]1065-the coxswain 's , [Israel Hands]2058-israel hands , that had been [Flint]74-flint 's gunner in former days . [The other]350-the other was , of course , [[my]0-i friend of [the red night - cap]2061-the red night - cap]2060-my friend of the red night - cap . [Both men]2062-both men were plainly the worse of drink , and [they]2062-both men were still drinking , for even while [I]0-i was listening , one of [them]2062-both men , with a drunken cry , opened the stern window and threw out something , which [I]0-i divined to be an empty bottle . But [they]2062-both men were not only tipsy ; it was plain that [they]2062-both men were furiously angry . Oaths flew like hailstones , and every now and then there came forth such an explosion as [I]0-i thought was sure to end in blows . But each time the quarrel passed off and the voices grumbled lower for a while , until the next crisis came and in its turn passed away without result . On [shore]1535-shore , [I]0-i could see the glow of the great camp - fire burning warmly through [the shore - side trees]2064-the shore - side trees . [Someone]2971-someone was singing , [a dull , old , droning sailor]2066-a dull , old , droning sailor 's song , with a droop and a quaver at the end of every verse , and seemingly no end to it at all but the patience of [the singer]2067-the singer . [I]0-i had heard it on the voyage more than once and remembered these words : " But one man of [[her]2971-someone crew]3690-her crew alive , What put to [sea]246-sea with seventy - five . "[0-i] And [I]0-i thought it was a ditty rather too dolefully appropriate for [a company that had met such cruel losses in the morning]2068-a company that had met such cruel losses in the morning . But , indeed , from what [I]0-i saw , all [these buccaneers]2069-these buccaneers were as callous as [the sea]250-the sea [they]2069-these buccaneers sailed on . At last the breeze came ; [the schooner]852-the schooner sidled and drew nearer in the dark ; [I]0-i felt the hawser slacken once more , and with a good , tough effort , cut the last fibres through . The breeze had but little action on [the coracle]2072-the coracle , and [I]0-i was almost instantly swept against the bows of [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola . At the same time , [the schooner]852-the schooner began to turn upon [her]852-the schooner heel , spinning slowly , end for end , across the current . [I]0-i wrought like [a fiend]2074-a fiend , for [I]0-i expected every moment to be swamped ; and since [I]0-i found [I]0-i could not push the coracle directly off , [I]0-i now shoved straight astern . At length [I]0-i was clear of [[my]0-i dangerous neighbour]2075-my dangerous neighbour , and just as [I]0-i gave the last impulsion , [my]0-i hands came across a light cord that was trailing overboard across [the stern bulwarks]2013-the stern bulwarks . Instantly [I]0-i grasped it . Why [I]0-i should have done so [I]0-i can hardly say . It was at first mere instinct , but once [I]0-i had it in [my]0-i hands and found it fast , curiosity began to get the upper hand , and [I]0-i determined [I]0-i should have one look through the cabin window . [I]0-i pulled in hand over hand on the cord , and when [I]0-i judged [myself]0-i near enough , rose at infinite risk to about half [my]0-i height and thus commanded the roof and a slice of the interior of [the cabin]950-the cabin . By this time the schooner and [[her]2078-her little consort]2079-her little consort were gliding pretty swiftly through the water ; indeed , [we]2080-we had already fetched up level with [the camp - fire]2081-the camp - fire . [The ship]755-the ship was talking , as [sailors]856-sailors say , loudly , treading the innumerable ripples with an incessant weltering splash ; and until [I]0-i got [my]0-i eye above the window - sill [I]0-i could not comprehend why [the watchmen]2084-the watchmen had taken no alarm . One glance , however , was sufficient ; and it was only one glance that [I]0-i durst take from that unsteady skiff . It showed [me]0-i [Hands]112-israel and [[his]112-israel companion]1130-his companion locked together in deadly wrestle , each with a hand upon the other 's throat . [I]0-i dropped upon the thwart again , none too soon , for [I]0-i was near overboard . [I]0-i could see nothing for the moment but [these two furious , encrimsoned faces swaying together under the smoky lamp]2086-these two furious , encrimsoned faces swaying together under the smoky lamp , and [I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes to let [them]2086-these two furious , encrimsoned faces swaying together under the smoky lamp grow once more familiar with the darkness . The endless ballad had come to an end at last , and [the whole diminished company about the camp - fire]2087-the whole diminished company about the camp - fire had broken into the chorus [I]0-i had heard so often : " Fifteen men on [the dead man]2836-the dead man 's chest Yo - ho - ho , and a bottle of rum ! Drink and the devil had done for the rest Yo - ho - ho , and a bottle of rum ! "[0-i] [I]0-i was just thinking how busy drink and [the devil]3258-the devil were at that very moment in [the cabin of [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola]1500-the cabin of the hispaniola , when [I]0-i was surprised by a sudden lurch of [the coracle]2072-the coracle . At the same moment , [she]2072-the coracle yawed sharply and seemed to change [her]2072-the coracle course . The speed in the meantime had strangely increased . [I]0-i opened [my]0-i eyes at once . All round [me]0-i were little ripples , combing over with a sharp , bristling sound and slightly phosphorescent . [The HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola [herself]2072-the coracle , a few yards in whose wake [I]0-i was still being whirled along , seemed to stagger in [her]2072-the coracle course , and [I]0-i saw [her]2072-the coracle spars toss a little against the blackness of the night ; nay , as [I]0-i looked longer , [I]0-i made sure [she]2072-the coracle also was wheeling to the southward . [I]0-i glanced over [my]0-i shoulder , and [my]0-i heart jumped against [my]0-i ribs . There , right behind [me]0-i , was the glow of the camp - fire . The current had turned at right angles , sweeping round along with it the tall schooner and [the little dancing coracle]2091-the little dancing coracle ; ever quickening , ever bubbling higher , ever muttering louder , it went spinning through [the narrows]2092-the narrows for [the open sea]1972-the open sea . Suddenly [the schooner in front of [me]0-i]2094-the schooner in front of me gave a violent yaw , turning , perhaps , through twenty degrees ; and almost at the same moment one shout followed another from on board ; [I]0-i could hear feet pounding on the companion ladder and [I]0-i knew that [the two drunkards]2095-the two drunkards had at last been interrupted in [their]2095-the two drunkards quarrel and awakened to a sense of [their]2095-the two drunkards disaster . [I]0-i lay down flat in the bottom of [that wretched skiff]2096-that wretched skiff and devoutly recommended [my]0-i spirit to [its Maker]2097-its maker . At the end of [the straits]2098-the straits , [I]0-i made sure [we]2099-we must fall into some bar of raging breakers , where all [my]0-i troubles would be ended speedily ; and though [I]0-i could , perhaps , bear to die , [I]0-i could not bear to look upon [my]0-i fate as it approached . So [I]0-i must have lain for hours , continually beaten to and fro upon the billows , now and again wetted with flying sprays , and never ceasing to expect death at the next plunge . Gradually weariness grew upon [me]0-i ; a numbness , an occasional stupor , fell upon [my]0-i mind even in the midst of [my]0-i terrors , until sleep at last supervened and in [my]0-i sea - tossed coracle [I]0-i lay and dreamed of [home]659-home and [the old Admiral Benbow]62-the admiral benbow .

24

[The Cruise of [the Coracle]41-the coracle]2101-the cruise of the coracle

IT was broad day when [I]0-i awoke and found [myself]0-i tossing at [the south - west end of [Treasure Island]1-treasure island]2102-the south - west end of treasure island . The sun was up but was still hid from [me]0-i behind the great bulk of [the Spy - glass]3045-the spy - glass , which on this side descended almost to [the sea in formidable cliffs]2104-the sea in formidable cliffs . [Haulbowline Head]42-haulbowline head and [Mizzen - mast Hill]43-mizzen - mast hill were at [my]0-i elbow , [the hill]365-the hill bare and dark , the head bound with cliffs forty or fifty feet high and fringed with great masses of fallen rock . [I]0-i was scarce a quarter of a mile to seaward , and it was [my]0-i first thought to paddle in and [land]2106-land . That notion was soon given over . Among the fallen rocks the breakers spouted and bellowed ; loud reverberations , heavy sprays flying and falling , succeeded one another from second to second ; and [I]0-i saw [myself]0-i , if [I]0-i ventured nearer , dashed to death upon [the rough shore]2107-the rough shore or spending [my]0-i strength in vain to scale the beetling crags . Nor was that all , for crawling together on flat tables of rock or letting [themselves]2108-themselves drop into [the sea]250-the sea with loud reports [I]0-i beheld huge slimy monsters soft snails , as it were , of incredible bigness two or three score of them together , making the rocks to echo with [their]2108-themselves barkings . [I]0-i have understood since that [they]2108-themselves were sea lions , and entirely harmless . But the look of them , added to the difficulty of [the shore]858-the shore and the high running of the surf , was more than enough to disgust [me]0-i of that landing - place . [I]0-i felt willing rather to starve at [sea]246-sea than to confront such perils . In the meantime [I]0-i had a better chance , as [I]0-i supposed , before [me]0-i . [North of [Haulbowline Head]42-haulbowline head]2112-north of haulbowline head , [the land]1037-the land runs in a long way , leaving at low tide a long stretch of yellow sand . To the north of that , again , there comes [another cape Cape of [the Woods]44-the woods]2114-another cape cape of the woods , as [it]2114-another cape cape of the woods was marked upon the chart buried in tall green pines , which descended to [the margin of [the sea]250-the sea]2115-the margin of the sea . [I]0-i remembered what [Silver]101-silver had said about the current that sets northward along [the whole west coast of [Treasure Island]1-treasure island]2117-the whole west coast of treasure island , and seeing from [my]0-i position that [I]0-i was already under its influence , [I]0-i preferred to leave [Haulbowline Head]42-haulbowline head behind [me]0-i and reserve [my]0-i strength for an attempt to land upon [the kindlier - looking Cape of [the Woods]44-the woods]2118-the kindlier - looking cape of the woods . There was a great , smooth swell upon [the sea]250-the sea . The wind blowing steady and gentle from the south , there was no contrariety between that and the current , and the billows rose and fell unbroken . Had it been otherwise , [I]0-i must long ago have perished ; but as it was , it is surprising how easily and securely [[my]0-i little and light boat]2120-my little and light boat could ride . Often , as [I]0-i still lay at the bottom and kept no more than an eye above the gunwale , [I]0-i would see [a big blue summit heaving close above [me]0-i]2121-a big blue summit heaving close above me ; yet the coracle would but bounce a little , dance as if on springs , and subside on the other side into the trough as lightly as a bird . [I]0-i began after a little to grow very bold and sat up to try [my]0-i skill at paddling . But even a small change in the disposition of the weight will produce violent changes in the behaviour of a coracle . And [I]0-i had hardly moved before [the boat]1260-the boat , giving up at once [her]1260-the boat gentle dancing movement , ran straight down [a slope of water]2123-a slope of water so steep that it made [me]0-i giddy , and struck [her]1260-the boat nose , with a spout of spray , deep into the side of the next wave . [I]0-i was drenched and terrified , and fell instantly back into [my]0-i old position , whereupon the coracle seemed to find [her]1260-the boat head again and led [me]0-i as softly as before among the billows . It was plain [she]1260-the boat was not to be interfered with , and at that rate , since [I]0-i could in no way influence [her]1260-the boat course , what hope had [I]0-i left of reaching [land]2106-land ? [I]0-i began to be horribly frightened , but [I]0-i kept [my]0-i head , for all that . First , moving with all care , [I]0-i gradually baled out the coracle with [my]0-i sea - cap ; then , getting [my]0-i eye once more above the gunwale , [I]0-i set [myself]0-i to study how it was [she]1260-the boat managed to slip so quietly through the rollers . [I]0-i found each wave , instead of [the big , smooth glossy mountain it looks from [shore]1535-shore or from [a vessel]2127-a vessel 's deck]2125-the big , smooth glossy mountain it looks from shore or from a vessel 's deck , was for all [the world]2855-the world like [any range of hills on [dry land]2130-dry land]2129-any range of hills on dry land , full of [peaks and smooth places and valleys]2131-peaks and smooth places and valleys . The coracle , left to [herself]1260-the boat , turning from side to side , threaded , so to speak , [her]1260-the boat way through these lower parts and avoided the steep slopes and higher , toppling summits of the wave . " Well , now , "[0-i] thought [I]0-i to [myself]0-i , " it is plain [I]0-i must lie where [I]0-i am and not disturb the balance ; but it is plain also that [I]0-i can put the paddle over the side and from time to time , in smooth places , give [her]1260-the boat a shove or two towards [land]2106-land . "[0-i] No sooner thought upon than done . There [I]0-i lay on [my]0-i elbows in the most trying attitude , and every now and again gave a weak stroke or two to turn [her]1260-the boat head to [shore]1535-shore . It was very tiring and slow work , yet [I]0-i did visibly gain ground ; and as [we]2133-we drew near [the Cape of [the Woods]44-the woods]2134-the cape of the woods , though [I]0-i saw [I]0-i must infallibly miss that point , [I]0-i had still made some hundred yards of easting . [I]0-i was , indeed , close in . [I]0-i could see the cool green tree - tops swaying together in the breeze , and [I]0-i felt sure [I]0-i should make [the next promontory]2135-the next promontory without fail . It was high time , for [I]0-i now began to be tortured with thirst . The glow of the sun from above , its thousandfold reflection from the waves , the sea - water that fell and dried upon [me]0-i , caking [my]0-i very lips with salt , combined to make [my]0-i throat burn and [my]0-i brain ache . The sight of the trees so near at hand had almost made [me]0-i sick with longing , but the current had soon carried [me]0-i past the point , and as [the next reach of sea]2136-the next reach of sea opened out , [I]0-i beheld a sight that changed the nature of [my]0-i thoughts . Right in front of [me]0-i , not half a mile away , [I]0-i beheld [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola under sail . [I]0-i made sure , of course , that [I]0-i should be taken ; but [I]0-i was so distressed for want of water that [I]0-i scarce knew whether to be glad or sorry at the thought , and long before [I]0-i had come to a conclusion , surprise had taken entire possession of [my]0-i mind and [I]0-i could do nothing but stare and wonder . [The HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola was under [her]16-the hispaniola main - sail and two jibs , and the beautiful white canvas shone in the sun like snow or silver . When [I]0-i first sighted [her]16-the hispaniola , all [her]16-the hispaniola sails were drawing ; [she]16-the hispaniola was lying a course about north - west , and [I]0-i presumed [the men on board]2137-the men on board were going round [the island]187-the island on [their]2137-the men on board way back to [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage . Presently [she]16-the hispaniola began to fetch more and more to the westward , so that [I]0-i thought [they]2137-the men on board had sighted [me]0-i and were going about in chase . At last , however , [she]16-the hispaniola fell right into the wind 's eye , was taken dead aback , and stood there awhile helpless , with [her]16-the hispaniola sails shivering . " [Clumsy fellows]3694-clumsy fellows , "[0-i] said [I]0-i ; " [they]3694-clumsy fellows must still be drunk as owls . "[0-i] And [I]0-i thought how [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett would have set [them]2137-the men on board skipping . Meanwhile [the schooner]852-the schooner gradually fell off and filled again upon another tack , sailed swiftly for a minute or so , and brought up once more dead in the wind 's eye . Again and again was this repeated . To and fro , up and down , north , south , east , and west , [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola sailed by swoops and dashes , and at each repetition ended as [she]16-the hispaniola had begun , with idly flapping canvas . It became plain to [me]0-i that [nobody]236-nobody was steering . And if so , where were [the men]587-the men ? Either [they]587-the men were dead drunk or had deserted [her]16-the hispaniola , [I]0-i thought , and perhaps if [I]0-i could get on board [I]0-i might return [the vessel]3443-the vessel to [[her]16-the hispaniola captain]2144-her captain . The current was bearing coracle and schooner southward at an equal rate . As for [the latter]1523-the latter 's sailing , it was so wild and intermittent , and [she]16-the hispaniola hung each time so long in irons , that [she]16-the hispaniola certainly gained nothing , if [she]16-the hispaniola did not even lose . If only [I]0-i dared to sit up and paddle , [I]0-i made sure that [I]0-i could overhaul [her]16-the hispaniola . The scheme had an air of adventure that inspired [me]0-i , and the thought of the water breaker beside the fore companion doubled [my]0-i growing courage . Up [I]0-i got , was welcomed almost instantly by another cloud of spray , but this time stuck to [my]0-i purpose and set [myself]0-i , with all [my]0-i strength and caution , to paddle after [the unsteered HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola . Once [I]0-i shipped a sea so heavy that [I]0-i had to stop and bail , with [my]0-i heart fluttering like a bird , but gradually [I]0-i got into the way of the thing and guided [my]0-i coracle among the waves , with only now and then a blow upon [her]16-the hispaniola bows and a dash of foam in [my]0-i face . [I]0-i was now gaining rapidly on [the schooner]852-the schooner ; [I]0-i could see the brass glisten on the tiller as it banged about , and still [no soul]476-no soul appeared upon [[her]16-the hispaniola decks]2148-her decks . [I]0-i could not choose but suppose [she]16-the hispaniola was deserted . If not , [the men]587-the men were lying drunk below , where [I]0-i might batten [them]587-the men down , perhaps , and do what [I]0-i chose with [the ship]755-the ship . For some time [she]16-the hispaniola had been doing the worse thing possible for [me]0-i standing still . [She]16-the hispaniola headed nearly due south , yawing , of course , all the time . Each time [she]16-the hispaniola fell off , [her]16-the hispaniola sails partly filled , and these brought [her]16-the hispaniola in a moment right to the wind again . [I]0-i have said this was the worst thing possible for [me]0-i , for helpless as [she]16-the hispaniola looked in this situation , with the canvas cracking like cannon and the blocks trundling and banging on [the deck]1031-the deck , [she]16-the hispaniola still continued to run away from [me]0-i , not only with the speed of the current , but by the whole amount of [her]16-the hispaniola leeway , which was naturally great . But now , at last , [I]0-i had [my]0-i chance . The breeze fell for some seconds , very low , and the current gradually turning [her]16-the hispaniola , [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola revolved slowly round [her]16-the hispaniola centre and at last presented [me]0-i [her]16-the hispaniola stern , with the cabin window still gaping open and the lamp over the table still burning on into the day . The main - sail hung drooped like a banner . [She]16-the hispaniola was stock - still but for the current . For the last little while [I]0-i had even lost , but now redoubling [my]0-i efforts , [I]0-i began once more to overhaul the chase . [I]0-i was not a hundred yards from [her]16-the hispaniola when the wind came again in a clap ; [she]16-the hispaniola filled on the port tack and was off again , stooping and skimming like a swallow . [My]0-i first impulse was one of despair , but [my]0-i second was towards joy . Round [she]16-the hispaniola came , till [she]16-the hispaniola was broadside on to [me]0-i round still till [she]16-the hispaniola had covered a half and then two thirds and then three quarters of the distance that separated [us]2152-us . [I]0-i could see the waves boiling white under [her]16-the hispaniola forefoot . [Immensely tall]146-immensely tall [she]16-the hispaniola looked to [me]0-i from [my]0-i low station in the coracle . And then , of a sudden , [I]0-i began to comprehend . [I]0-i had scarce time to think scarce time to act and save [myself]0-i . [I]0-i was on the summit of one swell when [the schooner]852-the schooner came stooping over the next . The bowsprit was over [my]0-i head . [I]0-i sprang to [my]0-i feet and leaped , stamping the coracle under water . With one hand [I]0-i caught the jib - boom , while [my]0-i foot was lodged between the stay and the brace ; and as [I]0-i still clung there panting , a dull blow told [me]0-i that [the schooner]852-the schooner had charged down upon and struck the coracle and that [I]0-i was left without retreat on [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola .

25

[I]0-i Strike [the Jolly Roger]3553-the jolly roger

[I]0-i HAD scarce gained a position on the bowsprit when the flying jib flapped and filled upon the other tack , with a report like a gun . [The schooner]852-the schooner trembled to [her]852-the schooner keel under the reverse , but next moment , the other sails still drawing , the jib flapped back again and hung idle . This had nearly tossed [me]0-i off into [the sea]250-the sea ; and now [I]0-i lost no time , crawled back along the bowsprit , and tumbled head foremost on [the deck]1031-the deck . [I]0-i was on the lee side of the forecastle , and the mainsail , which was still drawing , concealed from [me]0-i a certain portion of the after - deck . Not a soul was to be seen . The planks , which had not been swabbed since the mutiny , bore the print of many feet , and an empty bottle , broken by the neck , tumbled to and fro like a live thing in the scuppers . Suddenly [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola came right into the wind . The jibs behind [me]0-i cracked aloud , the rudder slammed to , [the whole ship]1212-the whole ship gave a sickening heave and shudder , and at the same moment the main - boom swung inboard , the sheet groaning in the blocks , and showed [me]0-i the lee after - deck . There were [the two watchmen]2160-the two watchmen , sure enough : [red - cap]2161-red - cap on [his]2161-red - cap back , as stiff as a handspike , with [his]2161-red - cap arms stretched out like those of a crucifix and [his]2161-red - cap teeth showing through [his]2161-red - cap open lips ; [Israel Hands]112-israel propped against [the bulwarks]2162-the bulwarks , [his]2161-red - cap chin on [his]2161-red - cap chest , [his]2161-red - cap hands lying open before [him]2161-red - cap on [the deck]1031-the deck , [his]2161-red - cap face as white , under its tan , as a tallow candle . For a while [the ship]755-the ship kept bucking and sidling like a vicious horse , the sails filling , now on one tack , now on another , and the boom swinging to and fro till the mast groaned aloud under the strain . Now and again too there would come a cloud of light sprays over the bulwark and a heavy blow of [the ship]755-the ship 's bows against the swell ; so much heavier weather was made of it by [this great rigged ship]2166-this great rigged ship than by [[my]0-i home - made , lop - sided coracle]2167-my home - made , lop - sided coracle , now gone to [the bottom of [the sea]250-the sea]2168-the bottom of the sea . At every jump of [the schooner]852-the schooner , red - cap slipped to and fro , but what was ghastly to behold neither [his]2161-red - cap attitude nor [his]2161-red - cap fixed teeth - disclosing grin was anyway disturbed by this rough usage . At every jump too , [Hands]112-israel appeared still more to sink into [himself]2161-red - cap and settle down upon [the deck]1031-the deck , [his]2161-red - cap feet sliding ever the farther out , and the whole body canting towards the stern , so that [his]2161-red - cap face became , little by little , hid from [me]0-i ; and at last [I]0-i could see nothing beyond [his]2161-red - cap ear and the frayed ringlet of one whisker . At the same time , [I]0-i observed , around both of [them]2172-them , splashes of dark blood upon the planks and began to feel sure that [they]2172-them had killed [each other]471-each other in [their]2172-them drunken wrath . While [I]0-i was thus looking and wondering , in a calm moment , when [the ship]755-the ship was still , [Israel Hands]112-israel turned partly round and with a low moan writhed [himself]112-israel back to the position in which [I]0-i had seen [him]112-israel first . The moan , which told of pain and deadly weakness , and the way in which [his]112-israel jaw hung open went right to [my]0-i heart . But when [I]0-i remembered the talk [I]0-i had overheard from the apple barrel , all pity left [me]0-i . [I]0-i walked aft until [I]0-i reached the main - mast . " Come aboard , [Mr. Hands]109-hands , "[0-i] [I]0-i said ironically . [He]112-israel rolled [his]112-israel eyes round heavily , but [he]112-israel was too far gone to express surprise . All [he]112-israel could do was to utter one word , " Brandy . "[112-israel] It occurred to [me]0-i there was no time to lose , and dodging the boom as it once more lurched across [the deck]1031-the deck , [I]0-i slipped aft and down [the companion stairs]2176-the companion stairs into [the cabin]950-the cabin . It was such a scene of confusion as [you]2178-you can hardly fancy . All the lockfast places had been broken open in quest of [the chart]2179-the chart . The floor was thick with mud where [ruffians]2180-ruffians had sat down to drink or consult after wading in the marshes round [[their]2180-ruffians camp]2181-their camp . The bulkheads , all painted in clear white and beaded round with gilt , bore a pattern of dirty hands . Dozens of empty bottles clinked together in corners to the rolling of [the ship]755-the ship . One of [the doctor]289-the doctor 's medical books lay open on the table , half of the leaves gutted out , [I]0-i suppose , for pipelights . In the midst of all this the lamp still cast a smoky glow , obscure and brown as umber . [I]0-i went into [the cellar]2184-the cellar ; all the barrels were gone , and of the bottles a most surprising number had been drunk out and thrown away . Certainly , since the mutiny began , [not a man of them]2185-not a man of them could ever have been sober . [Foraging]147-foraging about , [I]0-i found a bottle with some brandy left , for [Hands]109-hands ; and for [myself]0-i [I]0-i routed out some biscuit , some pickled fruits , a great bunch of raisins , and a piece of cheese . With these [I]0-i came on [deck]3158-deck , put down [my]0-i own stock behind the rudder head and well out of [the coxswain]1065-the coxswain 's reach , went forward to the water - breaker , and had a good deep drink of water , and then , and not till then , gave [Hands]109-hands the brandy . [He]109-hands must have drunk a gill before [he]109-hands took the bottle from [his]109-hands mouth . " Aye , "[109-hands] said [he]109-hands , " by thunder , but [I]109-hands wanted some o ' that ! "[109-hands] [I]0-i had sat down already in [my]0-i own corner and begun to eat . " Much hurt ? "[109-hands] [I]0-i asked [him]109-hands . [He]109-hands grunted , or rather , [I]0-i might say , [he]109-hands barked . " If [that doctor]2904-that doctor was aboard , "[109-hands] [he]109-hands said , " [I]109-hands 'd be right enough in a couple of turns , but [I]109-hands do n't have no manner of luck , [you]0-i see , and that 's what 's the matter with [me]109-hands . As for [that swab]3696-that swab , [he]3696-that swab 's good and dead , [he]3696-that swab is , "[109-hands] [he]109-hands added , indicating [the man with the red cap]2017-the man with the red cap . " [He]3696-that swab warn't [no seaman]3697-no seaman anyhow . And where mought [you]2017-the man with the red cap have come from ? "[109-hands] " Well , "[0-i] said [I]0-i , " [I]0-i 've come aboard to take possession of [this ship]962-this ship , [Mr. Hands]109-hands ; and [you]109-hands 'll please regard [me]0-i as [[your]109-hands captain]2864-your captain until further notice . "[0-i] [He]109-hands looked at [me]0-i sourly enough but said nothing . Some of the colour had come back into [his]109-hands cheeks , though [he]109-hands still looked very sick and still continued to slip out and settle down as [the ship]755-the ship banged about . " By the by , "[0-i] [I]0-i continued , " [I]0-i ca n't have these colours , [Mr. Hands]109-hands ; and by [your]109-hands leave , [I]0-i 'll strike ['em]3700-'em . Better none than these . "[0-i] And again dodging the boom , [I]0-i ran to the colour lines , handed down [their]2190-their cursed black flag , and chucked it overboard . " God save [the king]3657-the king ! "[0-i] said [I]0-i , waving [my]0-i cap . " And there 's an end to [Captain Silver]148-silver ! "[109-hands] [He]109-hands watched [me]0-i keenly and slyly , [his]109-hands chin all the while on [his]109-hands breast . " [I]109-hands reckon , "[109-hands] [he]109-hands said at last , " [I]109-hands reckon , [Cap'n Hawkins]149-cap'n hawkins , [you]149-cap'n hawkins 'll kind of want to get ashore now . S'pose [we]3702-we talks . "[109-hands] " Why , yes , "[0-i] says [I]0-i , " with all [my]0-i heart , [Mr. Hands]109-hands . Say on . "[0-i] And [I]0-i went back to [my]0-i meal with a good appetite . " [This man]3703-this man , "[109-hands] [he]109-hands began , nodding feebly at the corpse " [O'Brien]150-o'brien were [his]3703-this man name , [a rank Irelander [this man]3703-this man and [me]109-hands]3704-a rank irelander this man and me got the canvas on [her]3703-this man , meaning for to sail [her]3703-this man back . Well , [HE]3703-this man 'S dead now , [he]3703-this man is as dead as bilge ; and who 's to sail [this ship]962-this ship , [I]109-hands do n't see . Without [I]109-hands gives [you]109-hands a hint , [you]109-hands ai n't [that man]1009-that man , as far 's [I]109-hands can tell . Now , look here , [you]109-hands gives [me]109-hands food and drink and a old scarf or ankecher to tie [my]109-hands wound up , [you]109-hands do , and [I]109-hands 'll tell [you]109-hands how to sail [her]3703-this man , and that 's about square all round , [I]109-hands take it . "[109-hands] " [I]0-i 'll tell [you]109-hands one thing , "[0-i] says [I]0-i : " [I]0-i 'm not going back to [[Captain Kidd]151-captain kidd 's anchorage]3708-captain kidd 's anchorage . [I]0-i mean to get into [North Inlet]47-north inlet and beach [her]3703-this man quietly [there]2846-there . "[0-i] " To be sure [you]0-i did , "[2191-i] [he]2191-i cried . " Why , [I]2191-i ai n't [sich]3710-sich [an infernal lubber]3711-an infernal lubber after all . [I]2191-i can see , ca n't [I]2191-i ? [I]2191-i 've tried [my]2191-i fling , [I]2191-i have , and [I]2191-i 've lost , and it 's [you]0-i has the wind of [me]2191-i . [North Inlet]47-north inlet ? Why , [I]2191-i have n't no ch'ice , not [I]2191-i ! [I]2191-i 'd help [you]0-i sail [her]16-the hispaniola up to [Execution Dock]30-execution dock , by thunder ! So [I]2191-i would . "[2191-i] Well , as it seemed to [me]0-i , there was some sense in this . [We]2192-we struck [our]2192-we bargain on the spot . In three minutes [I]0-i had [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola sailing easily before the wind along [the coast of [Treasure Island]1-treasure island]2193-the coast of treasure island , with good hopes of turning the northern point ere noon and beating down again as far as [North Inlet]47-north inlet before high water , when [we]2192-we might beach [her]16-the hispaniola safely and wait till the subsiding tide permitted [us]2192-we to land . Then [I]0-i lashed the tiller and went below to [my]0-i own chest , where [I]0-i got a soft silk handkerchief of [[my]0-i mother]274-my mother 's . With this , and with [my]0-i aid , [Hands]109-hands bound up the great bleeding stab [he]2195-he had received in the thigh , and after [he]2195-he had eaten a little and had a swallow or two more of the brandy , [he]2195-he began to pick up visibly , sat straighter up , spoke louder and clearer , and looked in every way [another man]1076-another man . The breeze served [us]2192-we admirably . [We]2192-we skimmed before it like a bird , [the coast of [the island]187-the island]2197-the coast of the island flashing by and the view changing every minute . Soon [we]2192-we were past [the high lands]2199-the high lands and bowling beside [low , sandy country]2200-low , sandy country , sparsely dotted with dwarf pines , and soon [we]2192-we were beyond that again and had turned the corner of [the rocky hill that ends [the island on the north]2202-the island on the north]2201-the rocky hill that ends the island on the north . [I]0-i was greatly elated with [my]0-i new command , and pleased with the bright , sunshiny weather and these different prospects of [the coast]209-the coast . [I]0-i had now plenty of water and good things to eat , and [my]0-i conscience , which had smitten [me]0-i hard for [my]0-i desertion , was quieted by the great conquest [I]0-i had made . [I]0-i should , [I]0-i think , have had nothing left [me]0-i to desire but for the eyes of [the coxswain]1065-the coxswain as [they]1065-the coxswain followed [me]0-i derisively about [the deck]1031-the deck and the odd smile that appeared continually on [his]1065-the coxswain face . It was a smile that had in it something both of pain and weakness [a haggard old man]2206-a haggard old man 's smile ; but there was , besides that , a grain of derision , a shadow of treachery , in [his]1065-the coxswain expression as [he]1065-the coxswain craftily watched , and watched , and watched [me]0-i at [my]0-i work .
