[Israel Hands]112-israel

THE wind , serving [us]2207-we to a desire , now hauled into the west . [We]2207-we could run so much the easier from [the north - east corner of [the island]187-the island]2208-the north - east corner of the island to [the mouth of [the North Inlet]2211-the north inlet]2210-the mouth of the north inlet . Only , as [we]2207-we had no power to anchor and dared not beach [her]2212-her till the tide had flowed a good deal farther , time hung on [our]2207-we hands . [The coxswain]1065-the coxswain told [me]0-i how to lay [the ship]755-the ship to ; after a good many trials [I]0-i succeeded , and [we]2207-we both sat in silence over another meal . " [Cap'n]149-cap'n hawkins , "[1065-the coxswain] said [he]1065-the coxswain at length with that same uncomfortable smile , " here 's [[my]1065-the coxswain old shipmate]3712-my old shipmate , [O'Brien]150-o'brien ; s'pose [you]0-i was to heave [him]150-o'brien overboard . [I]1065-the coxswain ai n't partic'lar as a rule , and [I]1065-the coxswain do n't take no blame for settling [his]150-o'brien hash , but [I]1065-the coxswain do n't reckon [him]150-o'brien ornamental now , do [you]0-i ? "[1065-the coxswain] " [I]0-i 'm not strong enough , and [I]0-i do n't like the job ; and there [he]150-o'brien lies , for [me]0-i , "[0-i] said [I.]0-i " This here 's [an unlucky ship]3713-an unlucky ship , [this HISPANIOLA]3714-this hispaniola , [Jim]70-jim , "[1065-the coxswain] [he]1065-the coxswain went on , blinking . " There 's [a power of [men]475-men]3715-a power of men been killed in [this HISPANIOLA]3714-this hispaniola a sight o ' [poor seamen]3627-poor seamen dead and gone since [you]0-i and [me]1065-the coxswain took [ship]3051-ship to [Bristol]12-bristol . [I]1065-the coxswain never seen [sich]3720-sich dirty luck , not I. There was [this here O'Brien]3721-this here o'brien now [he]150-o'brien 's dead , ai n't [he]150-o'brien ? Well now , [I]1065-the coxswain 'm [no scholar]3722-no scholar , and [you]0-i 're [a lad as can read and figure]3723-a lad as can read and figure , and to put it straight , do [you]0-i take it as [a dead man]3724-a dead man is dead for good , or do [he]150-o'brien come alive again ? "[1065-the coxswain] " [You]0-i can kill the body , [Mr. Hands]109-hands , but not the spirit ; [you]0-i must know that already , "[0-i] [I]0-i replied . " [O'Brien]150-o'brien there is in [another world]3725-another world , and may be watching [us]3726-us . "[0-i] " Ah ! "[2215-he] says [he]2215-he . " Well , that 's unfort'nate appears as if killing [parties]3727-parties was a waste of time . Howsomever , [sperrits]3728-sperrits do n't reckon for much , by what [I]2215-he 've seen . [I]2215-he 'll chance it with [the sperrits]3729-the sperrits , [Jim]70-jim . And now , [you]0-i 've spoke up free , and [I]2215-he 'll take it kind if [you]0-i 'd step down into [that there cabin]3730-that there cabin and get [me]2215-he a well , a shiver [my]2215-he timbers ! [I]2215-he ca n't hit the name on ' t ; well , [you]0-i get [me]2215-he a bottle of wine , [Jim]70-jim this here brandy 's too strong for [my]2215-he head . "[2215-he] Now , [the coxswain]1065-the coxswain 's hesitation seemed to be unnatural , and as for the notion of [his]2215-he preferring wine to brandy , [I]0-i entirely disbelieved it . The whole story was a pretext . [He]2215-he wanted [me]0-i to leave [the deck]1031-the deck so much was plain ; but with what purpose [I]0-i could in no way imagine . [His]2215-he eyes never met [mine]0-i ; they kept wandering to and fro , up and down , now with a look to the sky , now with a flitting glance upon [the dead O'Brien]2218-the dead o'brien . All the time [he]2215-he kept smiling and putting [his]2215-he tongue out in the most guilty , embarrassed manner , so that [a child]402-a child could have told that [he]2215-he was bent on some deception . [I]0-i was prompt with [my]0-i answer , however , for [I]0-i saw where [my]0-i advantage lay and that with a fellow so densely stupid [I]0-i could easily conceal [my]0-i suspicions to the end . " Some wine ? "[0-i] [I]0-i said . " Far better . Will [you]2215-he have white or red ? "[0-i] " Well , [I]2215-he reckon it 's about the blessed same to [me]2215-he , [shipmate]3688-shipmate , "[2215-he] [he]2215-he replied ; ' so it 's strong , and plenty of it , what 's the odds ? " "[0-i] All right , " [I]0-i answered . "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll bring [you]2215-he port , [Mr. Hands]109-hands . But [I]0-i 'll have to dig for it . " With that [I]0-i scuttled down [the companion]1051-the companion with all the noise [I]0-i could , slipped off [my]0-i shoes , ran quietly along [the sparred gallery]3733-the sparred gallery , mounted the forecastle ladder , and popped [my]0-i head out of [the fore companion]3734-the fore companion . [I]0-i knew [he]2215-he would not expect to see [me]0-i there , yet [I]0-i took every precaution possible , and certainly the worst of [my]0-i suspicions proved too true . [He]2215-he had risen from [his]2215-he position to [his]2215-he hands and knees , and though [his]2215-he leg obviously hurt [him]2215-he pretty sharply when [he]2215-he moved for [I]0-i could hear [him]2215-he stifle a groan yet it was at a good , rattling rate that [he]2215-he trailed [himself]2215-he across [the deck]1031-the deck . In half a minute [he]2215-he had reached [the port scuppers]3736-the port scuppers and picked , out of a coil of rope , a long knife , or rather a short dirk , discoloured to the hilt with blood . [He]2215-he looked upon it for a moment , thrusting forth [his]2215-he under jaw , tried the point upon [his]2215-he hand , and then , hastily concealing it in the bosom of [his]2215-he jacket , trundled back again into [[his]2215-he old place against [the bulwark]3738-the bulwark]3737-his old place against the bulwark . This was all that [I]0-i required to know . [Israel]112-israel could move about , [he]2215-he was now armed , and if [he]2215-he had been at so much trouble to get rid of [me]0-i , it was plain that [I]0-i was meant to be [the victim]3739-the victim . What [he]2215-he would do afterwards whether [he]2215-he would try to crawl right across [the island]187-the island from [North Inlet]47-north inlet to [the camp]3741-the camp among [the swamps]3742-the swamps or whether [he]2215-he would fire [Long Tom]152-long tom , trusting that [[his]2215-he own comrades]3743-his own comrades might come first to help [him]2215-he was , of course , more than [I]0-i could say . Yet [I]0-i felt sure that [I]0-i could trust [him]2215-he in one point , since in that [our]3744-our interests jumped together , and that was in the disposition of [the schooner]852-the schooner . [We]3744-our both desired to have [her]852-the schooner stranded safe enough , in a sheltered place , and so that , when the time came , [she]852-the schooner could be got off again with as little labour and danger as might be ; and until that was done [I]0-i considered that [my]0-i life would certainly be spared . While [I]0-i was thus turning the business over in [my]0-i mind , [I]0-i had not been idle with [my]0-i body . [I]0-i had stolen back to [the cabin]950-the cabin , slipped once more into [my]0-i shoes , and laid [my]0-i hand at random on a bottle of wine , and now , with this for an excuse , [I]0-i made [my]0-i reappearance on [the deck]1031-the deck . [Hands]112-israel lay as [I]0-i had left [him]0-i , all fallen together in a bundle and with [his]0-i eyelids lowered as though [he]0-i were too weak to bear the light . [He]0-i looked up , however , at [my]0-i coming , knocked the neck off the bottle like [a man who had done the same thing]3748-a man who had done the same thing often , and took a good swig , with [his]0-i favourite toast of "[0-i] Here 's luck ! " Then [he]0-i lay quiet for a little , and then , pulling out a stick of tobacco , begged [me]0-i to cut [him]0-i a quid . "[0-i] Cut [me]0-i a junk o ' that , " says [he]0-i , "[0-i] for [I]0-i have n't no knife and hardly strength enough , so be as [I]0-i had . Ah , [Jim]70-jim , [Jim]70-jim , [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i 've missed stays ! Cut [me]0-i a quid , as'll likely be the last , [lad]3213-lad , for [I]0-i 'm for [[my]0-i long home]2221-my long home , and no mistake . " "[0-i] Well , " said [I]0-i , "[0-i] [I]0-i 'll cut [you]3213-lad some tobacco , but if [I]0-i was [you]3213-lad and thought [myself]0-i so badly , [I]0-i would go to [my]0-i prayers like [a Christian man]2222-a christian man . " "[0-i] Why ? " said [he]3213-lad . "[0-i] Now , [you]3213-lad tell [me]0-i why . " "[3213-lad] Why ? " [I]3213-lad cried . "[3213-lad] [You]3213-lad were asking [me]0-i just now about the dead . [You]3213-lad 've broken [your]3213-lad trust ; [you]3213-lad 've lived in sin and lies and blood ; there 's [a man [you]3213-lad killed lying at [your]3213-lad feet]2223-a man you killed lying at your feet this moment , and [you]3213-lad ask [me]0-i why ! For [God]65-god 's mercy , [Mr. Hands]109-hands , that 's why . " [I]109-hands spoke with a little heat , thinking of the bloody dirk [he]0-i had hidden in [his]0-i pocket and designed , in [his]0-i ill thoughts , to end [me]109-hands with . [He]0-i , for [his]0-i part , took a great draught of the wine and spoke with the most unusual solemnity . "[109-hands] For thirty years , " [he]0-i said , "[109-hands] [I]0-i 've sailed [the seas]1255-the seas and seen good and bad , better and worse , fair weather and foul , provisions running out , knives going , and what not . Well , now [I]0-i tell [you]2225-you , [I]0-i never seen good come o ' goodness yet . [Him]2226-him as strikes first is [my]0-i fancy ; [dead men]3303-dead men do n't bite ; [them]2228-them 's [my]0-i views amen , so be it . And now , [you]2225-you look here , " [he]0-i added , suddenly changing [his]0-i tone , "[2225-you] [we]2229-we 've had about enough of this foolery . The tide 's made good enough by now . [You]2225-you just take [my]0-i orders , [Cap'n Hawkins]149-cap'n hawkins , and [we]2229-we 'll sail slap in and be done with it . " All told , [we]2229-we had scarce two miles to run ; but the navigation was delicate , the entrance to [this northern anchorage]3749-this northern anchorage was not only narrow and shoal , but lay east and west , so that [the schooner]852-the schooner must be nicely handled to be got in . [I]2229-we think [I]2229-we was [a good , prompt subaltern]3751-a good , prompt subaltern , and [I]2229-we am very sure that [Hands]109-hands was [an excellent pilot]3752-an excellent pilot , for [we]2229-we went about and about and dodged in , shaving the banks , with a certainty and a neatness that were a pleasure to behold . Scarcely had [we]2229-we passed the heads before [the land]1037-the land closed around [us]2229-we . [The shores of [North Inlet]47-north inlet]3754-the shores of north inlet were as thickly wooded as those of [the southern anchorage]3755-the southern anchorage , but the space was longer and narrower and more like , what in truth [it]3756-it was , [the estuary of [a river]3758-a river]3757-the estuary of a river . Right before [us]2229-we , at the southern end , [we]2229-we saw the wreck of [a ship]713-a ship in the last stages of dilapidation . [It]713-a ship had been [a great vessel of three masts but had lain so long exposed to the injuries of the weather that [it]713-a ship was hung about with great webs of dripping seaweed]3760-a great vessel of three masts but had lain so long exposed to the injuries of the weather that it was hung about with great webs of dripping seaweed , and on the deck of [it]713-a ship shore bushes had taken root and now flourished thick with flowers . It was a sad sight , but it showed [us]2229-we that [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage was calm . "[2229-we] Now , " said [Hands]109-hands , "[2229-we] look there ; there 's a pet bit for to beach [a ship]713-a ship in . Fine flat sand , never a cat 's paw , trees all around of it , and flowers a - blowing like a garding on [that old ship]2231-that old ship . " "[2229-we] And once beached , " [I]2229-we inquired , "[2229-we] how shall [we]2232-we get [her]2231-that old ship off again ? " "[2229-we] Why , so , " [he]109-hands replied : "[2233-you] [you]2233-you take a line ashore there on the other side at low water , take a turn about one of them big pines ; bring it back , take a turn around the capstan , and lie to for the tide . Come high water , [all hands]3111-all hands take a pull upon the line , and off [she]2231-that old ship comes as sweet as natur ' . And now , [boy]2934-boy , [you]2934-boy stand by . [We]2232-we 're near the bit now , and [she]2231-that old ship 's too much way on [her]2231-that old ship . Starboard a little so steady starboard larboard a little steady steady ! " So [he]109-hands issued [his]109-hands commands , which [I]2231-that old ship breathlessly obeyed , till , all of a sudden , [he]109-hands cried , "[2231-that old ship] Now , [my]0-i hearty , luff ! " And [I]2231-that old ship put the helm hard up , and the HISPANIOLA swung round rapidly and ran stem on for [the low , wooded shore]3762-the low , wooded shore . The excitement of these last manoeuvres had somewhat interfered with the watch [I]2231-that old ship had kept hitherto , sharply enough , upon the coxswain . Even then [I]2231-that old ship was still so much interested , waiting for [the ship]755-the ship to touch , that [I]2231-that old ship had quite forgot the peril that hung over [my]2231-that old ship head and stood craning over [the starboard bulwarks]3764-the starboard bulwarks and watching the ripples spreading wide before the bows . [I]2231-that old ship might have fallen without a struggle for [my]2231-that old ship life had not a sudden disquietude seized upon [me]2231-that old ship and made [me]2231-that old ship turn [my]2231-that old ship head . Perhaps [I]2231-that old ship had heard a creak or seen [his]109-hands shadow moving with the tail of [my]2231-that old ship eye ; perhaps it was an instinct like a cat 's ; but , sure enough , when [I]2231-that old ship looked round , there was [Hands]109-hands , already half - way towards [me]2231-that old ship , with the dirk in [his]109-hands right hand . [We]3765-we must both have cried out aloud when [our]3765-we eyes met , but while mine was the shrill cry of terror , [his]109-hands was a roar of fury like [a charging bully]3766-a charging bully 's . At the same instant , [he]109-hands threw [himself]109-hands forward and [I]2231-that old ship leapt sideways towards the bows . As [I]2231-that old ship did so , [I]2231-that old ship let go of the tiller , which sprang sharp to leeward , and [I]2231-that old ship think this saved [my]2231-that old ship life , for it struck [Hands]109-hands across the chest and stopped [him]109-hands , for the moment , dead . Before [he]109-hands could recover , [I]2231-that old ship was safe out of the corner where [he]109-hands had [me]2231-that old ship trapped , with all the deck to dodge about . Just forward of [the main - mast]3767-the main - mast [I]2231-that old ship stopped , drew a pistol from [my]2231-that old ship pocket , took a cool aim , though [he]109-hands had already turned and was once more coming directly after [me]2231-that old ship , and drew the trigger . The hammer fell , but there followed neither flash nor sound ; the priming was useless with sea - water . [I]2231-that old ship cursed [myself]2231-that old ship for [my]2231-that old ship neglect . Why had not [I]2231-that old ship , long before , reprimed and reloaded [my]2231-that old ship only weapons ? Then [I]2231-that old ship should not have been as now , [a mere fleeing sheep before [this butcher]3769-this butcher]3768-a mere fleeing sheep before this butcher . Wounded as [he]109-hands was , it was wonderful how fast [he]109-hands could move , [his]109-hands grizzled hair tumbling over [his]109-hands face , and [his]109-hands face itself as red as a red ensign with [his]109-hands haste and fury . [I]2231-that old ship had no time to try [my]2231-that old ship other pistol , nor indeed much inclination , for [I]2231-that old ship was sure it would be useless . One thing [I]2231-that old ship saw plainly : [I]2231-that old ship must not simply retreat before [him]109-hands , or [he]109-hands would speedily hold [me]2231-that old ship boxed into the bows , as a moment since [he]109-hands had so nearly boxed [me]2231-that old ship in the stern . Once so caught , and nine or ten inches of the blood - stained dirk would be [my]2231-that old ship last experience on this side of eternity . [I]2231-that old ship placed [my]2231-that old ship palms against the main - mast , which was of a goodish bigness , and waited , every nerve upon the stretch . Seeing that [I]2231-that old ship meant to dodge , [he]109-hands also paused ; and a moment or two passed in feints on [his]109-hands part and corresponding movements upon [mine]2231-that old ship . It was such a game as [I]2231-that old ship had often played at [home]659-home about [the rocks of [Black Hill Cove]6-black hill cove]3771-the rocks of black hill cove , but never before , [you]3772-you may be sure , with such a wildly beating heart as now . Still , as [I]2231-that old ship say , it was [a boy]831-a boy 's game , and [I]2231-that old ship thought [I]2231-that old ship could hold [my]2231-that old ship own at it against [an elderly seaman with a wounded thigh]3774-an elderly seaman with a wounded thigh . Indeed [my]2231-that old ship courage had begun to rise so high that [I]2231-that old ship allowed [myself]2231-that old ship a few darting thoughts on what would be the end of the affair , and while [I]2231-that old ship saw certainly that [I]2231-that old ship could spin it out for long , [I]2231-that old ship saw no hope of any ultimate escape . Well , while things stood thus , suddenly the HISPANIOLA struck , staggered , ground for an instant in the sand , and then , swift as a blow , canted over to the port side till [the deck]1031-the deck stood at an angle of forty - five degrees and about a puncheon of water splashed into the scupper holes and lay , in a pool , between [the deck]1031-the deck and bulwark . [We]3777-us were [both of [us]3777-us]533-both of us capsized in a second , and [both of [us]3777-us]533-both of us rolled , almost together , into the scuppers , the dead red - cap , with [his]3774-an elderly seaman with a wounded thigh arms still spread out , tumbling stiffly after [us]3777-us . So near were [we]3777-us , indeed , that [my]2231-that old ship head came against [the coxswain]1065-the coxswain 's foot with a crack that made [my]2231-that old ship teeth rattle . Blow and all , [I]2231-that old ship was the first afoot again , for [Hands]109-hands had got involved with the dead body . The sudden canting of [the ship]755-the ship had made [the deck]1031-the deck no place for running on ; [I]2231-that old ship had to find some new way of escape , and that upon the instant , for [[my]2231-that old ship foe]3783-my foe was almost touching [me]2231-that old ship . Quick as thought , [I]2231-that old ship sprang into the mizzen shrouds , rattled up hand over hand , and did not draw a breath till [I]2231-that old ship was seated on the cross - trees . [I]2231-that old ship had been saved by being prompt ; the dirk had struck not half a foot below [me]2231-that old ship as [I]2231-that old ship pursued [my]2231-that old ship upward flight ; and there stood [Israel Hands]112-israel with [his]112-israel mouth open and [his]112-israel face upturned to [mine]2231-that old ship , a perfect statue of surprise and disappointment . Now that [I]2231-that old ship had a moment to [myself]2231-that old ship , [I]2231-that old ship lost no time in changing the priming of [my]2231-that old ship pistol , and then , having one ready for service , and to make assurance doubly sure , [I]2231-that old ship proceeded to draw the load of the other and recharge it afresh from the beginning . [My]2231-that old ship new employment struck [Hands]112-israel all of a heap ; [he]112-israel began to see the dice going against [him]112-israel , and after an obvious hesitation , [he]112-israel also hauled [himself]112-israel heavily into the shrouds , and with the dirk in [his]112-israel teeth , began slowly and painfully to mount . It cost [him]112-israel no end of time and groans to haul [his]112-israel wounded leg behind [him]112-israel , and [I]2231-that old ship had quietly finished [my]2231-that old ship arrangements before [he]112-israel was much more than a third of the way up . Then , with a pistol in either hand , [I]2231-that old ship addressed [him]109-hands . "[2231-that old ship] One more step , [Mr. Hands]109-hands , " said [I]109-hands , "[109-hands] and [I]0-i 'll blow [your]109-hands brains out ! [Dead men]3303-dead men do n't bite , [you]109-hands know , " [I]70-jim added with a chuckle . [He]109-hands stopped instantly . [I]70-jim could see by the working of [his]109-hands face that [he]109-hands was trying to think , and the process was so slow and laborious that , in [my]70-jim new - found security , [I]70-jim laughed aloud . At last , with a swallow or two , [he]109-hands spoke , [his]109-hands face still wearing the same expression of extreme perplexity . In order to speak [he]109-hands had to take the dagger from [his]109-hands mouth , but in all else [he]109-hands remained unmoved . "[70-jim] [Jim]70-jim , " says [he]0-i , "[70-jim] [I]0-i reckon [we]2237-we 're fouled , [you]70-jim and [me]0-i , and [we]2237-we 'll have to sign articles . [I]0-i 'd have had [you]70-jim but for that there lurch , but [I]0-i do n't have no luck , not [I]0-i ; and [I]0-i reckon [I]0-i 'll have to strike , which comes hard , [you]70-jim see , for [a master mariner to [a ship]713-a ship 's younker like [you]70-jim]2238-a master mariner to a ship 's younker like you , [Jim]70-jim . " [I]70-jim was drinking in [his]0-i words and smiling away , as conceited as a cock upon a wall , when , all in a breath , back went [his]0-i right hand over [his]0-i shoulder . Something sang like an arrow through the air ; [I]70-jim felt a blow and then a sharp pang , and there [I]70-jim was pinned by the shoulder to the mast . In the horrid pain and surprise of the moment [I]70-jim scarce can say it was by [my]70-jim own volition , and [I]70-jim am sure it was without a conscious aim both [my]70-jim pistols went off , and both escaped out of [my]70-jim hands . [They]3784-they did not fall alone ; with a choked cry , [the coxswain]1065-the coxswain loosed [his]1065-the coxswain grasp upon the shrouds and plunged head first into the water .[70-jim]

27

" Pieces of Eight "[70-jim]

OWING to the ca nt of [the vessel]3443-the vessel , the masts hung far out over [the water]3407-the water , and from [my]0-i perch on [the cross - trees]2242-the cross - trees [I]0-i had nothing below [me]0-i but [the surface of [the bay]2244-the bay]2243-the surface of the bay . [Hands]109-hands , who was not so far up , was in consequence nearer to [the ship]755-the ship and fell between [me]0-i and [the bulwarks]2162-the bulwarks . [He]109-hands rose once to the surface in a lather of foam and blood and then sank again for good . As the water settled , [I]0-i could see [him]109-hands lying huddled together on the clean , bright sand in the shadow of the vessel 's sides . A fish or two whipped past [his]109-hands body . Sometimes , by the quivering of the water , [he]109-hands appeared to move a little , as if [he]109-hands were trying to rise . But [he]109-hands was dead enough , for all that , being both shot and drowned , and was food for fish in the very place where [he]109-hands had designed [my]0-i slaughter . [I]0-i was no sooner certain of this than [I]0-i began to feel sick , faint , and terrified . The hot blood was running over [my]0-i back and chest . The dirk , where it had pinned [my]0-i shoulder to the mast , seemed to burn like a hot iron ; yet it was not so much these real sufferings that distressed [me]0-i , for these , it seemed to [me]0-i , [I]0-i could bear without a murmur ; it was the horror [I]0-i had upon [my]0-i mind of falling from the cross - trees into that still green water , beside the body of [the coxswain]1065-the coxswain . [I]0-i clung with both hands till [my]0-i nails ached , and [I]0-i shut [my]0-i eyes as if to cover up the peril . Gradually [my]0-i mind came back again , [my]0-i pulses quieted down to a more natural time , and [I]0-i was once more in possession of [myself]0-i . It was [my]0-i first thought to pluck forth the dirk , but either it stuck too hard or [my]0-i nerve failed [me]0-i , and [I]0-i desisted with a violent shudder . Oddly enough , that very shudder did the business . The knife , in fact , had come the nearest in [the world]2855-the world to missing [me]0-i altogether ; it held [me]0-i by a mere pinch of skin , and this the shudder tore away . The blood ran down the faster , to be sure , but [I]0-i was [[my]0-i own master]2249-my own master again and only tacked to the mast by [my]0-i coat and shirt . These last [I]0-i broke through with a sudden jerk , and then regained [the deck]1031-the deck by the starboard shrouds . For nothing in [the world]2855-the world would [I]0-i have again ventured , shaken as [I]0-i was , upon the overhanging port shrouds from which [Israel]112-israel had so lately fallen . [I]0-i went below and did what [I]0-i could for [my]0-i wound ; it pained [me]0-i a good deal and still bled freely , but it was neither deep nor dangerous , nor did it greatly gall [me]0-i when [I]0-i used [my]0-i arm . Then [I]0-i looked around [me]0-i , and as [the ship]755-the ship was now , in a sense , [my]0-i own , [I]0-i began to think of clearing it from [its last passenger]2253-its last passenger [the dead man]2836-the dead man , [O'Brien]150-o'brien . [He]2836-the dead man had pitched , as [I]0-i have said , against [the bulwarks]2162-the bulwarks , where [he]2836-the dead man lay like some horrible , ungainly sort of puppet , life - size , indeed , but how different from life 's colour or life 's comeliness ! In that position [I]0-i could easily have [my]0-i way with [him]2836-the dead man , and as the habit of tragical adventures had worn off almost all [my]0-i terror for [the dead]2256-the dead , [I]0-i took [him]2836-the dead man by the waist as if [he]2836-the dead man had been a sack of bran and with one good heave , tumbled [him]2836-the dead man overboard . [He]2836-the dead man went in with a sounding plunge ; the red cap came off and remained floating on the surface ; and as soon as the splash subsided , [I]0-i could see [him]2836-the dead man and [Israel]112-israel lying side by side , both wavering with the tremulous movement of the water . [O'Brien]150-o'brien , though still quite [a young man]2257-a young man , was very bald . There [he]2836-the dead man lay , with that bald head across the knees of [the man who had killed [him]2836-the dead man]2258-the man who had killed him and [the quick fishes steering to and fro over both]2259-the quick fishes steering to and fro over both . [I]0-i was now alone upon [the ship]755-the ship ; the tide had just turned . The sun was within so few degrees of setting that already the shadow of the pines upon [the western shore]2261-the western shore began to reach right across [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage and fall in patterns on [the deck]1031-the deck . The evening breeze had sprung up , and though it was well warded off by [the hill]365-the hill with [the two peaks upon the east]2265-the two peaks upon the east , the cordage had begun to sing a little softly to itself and the idle sails to rattle to and fro . [I]0-i began to see a danger to [the ship]755-the ship . The jibs [I]0-i speedily doused and brought tumbling to the deck , but the main - sail was a harder matter . Of course , when the schooner canted over , the boom had swung out - board , and the cap of it and a foot or two of sail hung even under water . [I]0-i thought this made it still more dangerous ; yet the strain was so heavy that [I]0-i half feared to meddle . At last [I]0-i got [my]0-i knife and cut the halyards . The peak dropped instantly , a great belly of loose canvas floated broad upon the water , and since , pull as [I]0-i liked , [I]0-i could not budge the downhall , that was the extent of what [I]0-i could accomplish . For the rest , [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola must trust to luck , like [myself]0-i . By this time [the whole anchorage]2038-the whole anchorage had fallen into shadow the last rays , [I]0-i remember , falling through a glade of the wood and shining bright as jewels on the flowery mantle of the wreck . It began to be chill ; the tide was rapidly fleeting seaward , the schooner settling more and more on [her]755-the ship beam - ends . [I]0-i scrambled forward and looked over . It seemed shallow enough , and holding the cut hawser in both hands for a last security , [I]0-i let [myself]0-i drop softly overboard . The water scarcely reached [my]0-i waist ; the sand was firm and covered with ripple marks , and [I]0-i waded ashore in great spirits , leaving [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola on [her]755-the ship side , with [her]755-the ship main - sail trailing wide upon the surface of [the bay]2244-the bay . About the same time , the sun went fairly down and the breeze whistled low in the dusk among the tossing pines . At least , and at last , [I]0-i was off [the sea]250-the sea , nor had [I]0-i returned thence empty - handed . There lay [the schooner]852-the schooner , clear at last from buccaneers and ready for [[our]2271-our own men]2272-our own men to board and get to [sea]246-sea again . [I]0-i had nothing nearer [my]0-i fancy than to get [home]659-home to the stockade and boast of [my]0-i achievements . Possibly [I]0-i might be blamed a bit for [my]0-i truantry , but the recapture of [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola was a clenching answer , and [I]0-i hoped that even [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett would confess [I]0-i had not lost [my]0-i time . So thinking , and in famous spirits , [I]0-i began to set [my]0-i face homeward for [the block house]1542-the block house and [[my]0-i companions]1983-my companions . [I]0-i remembered that the most easterly of the rivers which drain into [[Captain Kidd]151-captain kidd 's anchorage]3708-captain kidd 's anchorage ran from [the two - peaked hill upon [my]0-i left]2278-the two - peaked hill upon my left , and [I]0-i bent [my]0-i course in that direction that [I]0-i might pass [the stream]2279-the stream while it was small . [The wood]1374-the wood was pretty open , and keeping along the lower spurs , [I]0-i had soon turned the corner of [that hill]2281-that hill , and not long after waded to the mid - calf across [the watercourse]2282-the watercourse . This brought [me]0-i near to where [I]0-i had encountered [Ben Gunn]103-ben gunn , the maroon ; and [I]0-i walked more circumspectly , keeping an eye on every side . The dusk had come nigh hand completely , and as [I]0-i opened out the cleft between [the two peaks]1386-the two peaks , [I]0-i became aware of a wavering glow against the sky , where , as [I]0-i judged , [the man of [the island]187-the island]1390-the man of the island was cooking [his]1390-the man of the island supper before a roaring fire . And yet [I]0-i wondered , in [my]0-i heart , that [he]1390-the man of the island should show [himself]1390-the man of the island so careless . For if [I]0-i could see this radiance , might it not reach the eyes of [Silver]148-silver [himself]1390-the man of the island where [he]1390-the man of the island camped upon [the shore]858-the shore among [the marshes]2287-the marshes ? Gradually the night fell blacker ; it was all [I]0-i could do to guide [myself]0-i even roughly towards [my]0-i destination ; [the double hill behind [me]0-i]2288-the double hill behind me and the Spy - glass on [my]0-i right hand loomed faint and fainter ; the stars were few and pale ; and in the low ground where [I]0-i wandered [I]0-i kept tripping among bushes and rolling into sandy pits . Suddenly a kind of brightness fell about [me]0-i . [I]0-i looked up ; a pale glimmer of moonbeams had alighted on the summit of [the Spy - glass]3045-the spy - glass , and soon after [I]0-i saw something broad and silvery moving low down behind the trees , and knew the moon had risen . With this to help [me]0-i , [I]0-i passed rapidly over what remained to [me]0-i of [my]0-i journey , and sometimes walking , sometimes running , impatiently drew near to [the stockade]1481-the stockade . Yet , as [I]0-i began to thread [the grove that lies before it]2291-the grove that lies before it , [I]0-i was not so thoughtless but that [I]0-i slacked [my]0-i pace and went a trifle warily . It would have been a poor end of [my]0-i adventures to get shot down by [[my]0-i own party]2292-my own party in mistake . The moon was climbing higher and higher , its light began to fall here and there in masses through the more open districts of the wood , and right in front of [me]0-i a glow of a different colour appeared among the trees . It was red and hot , and now and again it was a little darkened as it were , the embers of a bonfire smouldering . For the life of [me]0-i [I]0-i could not think what it might be . At last [I]0-i came right down upon the borders of [the clearing]1840-the clearing . [The western end]2294-the western end was already steeped in moonshine ; the rest , and [the block house]1542-the block house [itself]1542-the block house , still lay in a black shadow chequered with long silvery streaks of light . On the other side of [the house]228-the house an immense fire had burned itself into clear embers and shed a steady , red reverberation , contrasted strongly with the mellow paleness of the moon . There was not a soul stirring nor a sound beside the noises of the breeze . [I]0-i stopped , with much wonder in [my]0-i heart , and perhaps a little terror also . It had not been [our]2297-our way to build great fires ; [we]2297-our were , indeed , by [the captain]234-the captain 's orders , somewhat niggardly of firewood , and [I]0-i began to fear that something had gone wrong while [I]0-i was absent . [I]0-i stole round by the eastern end , keeping close in shadow , and at a convenient place , where the darkness was thickest , crossed the palisade . To make assurance surer , [I]0-i got upon [my]0-i hands and knees and crawled , without a sound , towards the corner of [the house]228-the house . As [I]0-i drew nearer , [my]0-i heart was suddenly and greatly lightened . It is not a pleasant noise in itself , and [I]0-i have often complained of it at other times , but just then it was like music to hear [[my]0-i friends]3560-my friends snoring together so loud and peaceful in [their]3560-my friends sleep . The sea - cry of the watch , that beautiful " All 's well , "[148-silver] never fell more reassuringly on [my]0-i ear . In the meantime , there was no doubt of one thing ; [they]2301-they kept an infamous bad watch . If it had been [Silver]148-silver and [[his]148-silver lads]2302-his lads that were now creeping in on [them]2301-they , [not a soul]2303-not a soul would have seen daybreak . That was what it was , thought [I]0-i , to have [the captain]234-the captain wounded ; and again [I]0-i blamed [myself]0-i sharply for leaving [them]2301-they in that danger with so [few to mount guard]2305-few to mount guard . By this time [I]0-i had got to the door and stood up . All was dark within , so that [I]0-i could distinguish nothing by the eye . As for sounds , there was the steady drone of the snorers and a small occasional noise , a flickering or pecking that [I]0-i could in no way account for . With [my]0-i arms before [me]0-i [I]0-i walked steadily in . [I]0-i should lie down in [my]0-i own place [I]0-i thought with a silent chuckle and enjoy [their]2301-they faces when [they]2301-they found [me]0-i in the morning . [My]0-i foot struck something yielding it was [a sleeper]2306-a sleeper 's leg ; and [he]2306-a sleeper turned and groaned , but without awaking . And then , all of a sudden , a shrill voice broke forth out of the darkness : " Pieces of eight ! Pieces of eight ! Pieces of eight ! Pieces of eight ! Pieces of eight ! "[2307-she] and so forth , without pause or change , like the clacking of a tiny mill . [Silver]148-silver 's green parrot , [Captain Flint]74-flint ! It was [she]2307-she whom [I]0-i had heard pecking at a piece of bark ; it was [she]2307-she , keeping better watch than [any human being]2308-any human being , who thus announced [my]0-i arrival with [her]2307-she wearisome refrain . [I]0-i had no time left [me]0-i to recover . At the sharp , clipping tone of the parrot , [the sleepers]2309-the sleepers awoke and sprang up ; and with a mighty oath , the voice of [Silver]148-silver cried , " Who goes ? "[148-silver] [I]0-i turned to run , struck violently against [one person]2310-one person , recoiled , and ran full into the arms of a second , who for [his]2306-a sleeper part closed upon and held [me]0-i tight . " Bring a torch , [Dick]121-dick , "[148-silver] said [Silver]148-silver when [my]0-i capture was thus assured . And [one of [the men]587-the men]1059-one of the men left [the log - house]1496-the log - house and presently returned with a lighted brand .

PART SIX [Captain Silver

28]148-silver

In [the Enemy 's Camp]2314-the enemy 's camp

THE red glare of the torch , lighting up the interior of [the block house]1542-the block house , showed [me]0-i the worst of [my]0-i apprehensions realized . [The pirates]3339-the pirates were in possession of [the house]228-the house and [stores]3629-stores : there was the cask of cognac , there were the pork and bread , as before , and what tenfold increased [my]0-i horror , not a sign of [any prisoner]2319-any prisoner . [I]0-i could only judge that all had perished , and [my]0-i heart smote [me]0-i sorely that [I]0-i had not been there to perish with [them]3339-the pirates . There were [six of [the buccaneers]595-the buccaneers]2320-six of the buccaneers , all told ; [not another man]2322-not another man was left alive . [Five of [them]2320-six of the buccaneers]2323-five of them were on [their]2323-five of them feet , flushed and swollen , suddenly called out of the first sleep of drunkenness . [The sixth]2324-the sixth had only risen upon [his]2324-the sixth elbow ; [he]2324-the sixth was deadly pale , and the blood - stained bandage round [his]2324-the sixth head told that [he]2324-the sixth had recently been wounded , and still more recently dressed . [I]0-i remembered [the man who had been shot and had run back among [the woods]1241-the woods in the great attack]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack , and doubted not that this was [he]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack . [The parrot]2327-the parrot sat , preening [her]2327-the parrot plumage , on [Long John]95-silver 's shoulder . [He]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack [himself]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack , [I]0-i thought , looked somewhat paler and more stern than [I]0-i was used to . [He]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack still wore the fine broadcloth suit in which [he]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack had fulfilled [his]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack mission , but it was bitterly the worse for wear , daubed with clay and torn with the sharp briers of the wood . " So , "[2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack] said [he]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack , " here 's [Jim Hawkins]70-jim , shiver [my]2325-the man who had been shot and had run back among the woods in the great attack timbers ! " To all this , as may be well supposed , [I]2328-you made no answer . [They]3787-they had set [me]2328-you with [my]2328-you back against the wall , and [I]2328-you stood there , looking [Silver]95-silver in the face , pluckily enough , [I]2328-you hope , to all outward appearance , but with black despair in [my]2328-you heart . [Silver]95-silver took a whiff or two of [his]95-silver pipe with great composure and then ran on again . " So far so good . [[My]0-i friends]3560-my friends , then , were still alive , and though [I]0-i partly believed the truth of [Silver]141-silver 's statement , that [the cabin party]1301-the cabin party were incensed at [me]0-i for [my]0-i desertion , [I]0-i was more relieved than distressed by what [I]0-i heard . " "[2341-mortal seaman] Am [I]0-i to answer , then ? " [I]154-lad asked with a very tremulous voice . Through all this sneering talk , [I]154-lad was made to feel the threat of death that overhung [me]154-lad , and [my]154-lad cheeks burned and [my]154-lad heart beat painfully in [my]154-lad breast . "[0-i] [I]0-i stopped , for , [I]0-i tell [you]2360-you , [I]0-i was out of breath , and to [my]0-i wonder , not [a man of [them]2362-them]2361-a man of them moved , but all sat staring at [me]0-i like as many sheep . " Avast , there ! "[95-silver] cried [Silver]95-silver . " Who are [you]104-morgan , [Tom Morgan]104-morgan ? Maybe [you]104-morgan thought [you]104-morgan was cap'n here , perhaps . " [I]602-another stood hazing long enough from one , "[602-another] added [another]602-another . " [I]602-another 'll be hanged if [I]602-another 'll be hazed by [you]104-morgan , [John Silver]95-silver . "[602-another] " Did [any of [you]104-morgan gentlemen]3811-any of you gentlemen want to have it out with [ME]95-silver ? 29

[The Black Spot Again

THE council of buccaneers]2388-the black spot again the council of buccaneers had lasted some time , when [one of [them]2388-the black spot again the council of buccaneers]3082-one of them re - entered [the house]228-the house , and with a repetition of the same salute , which had in [my]0-i eyes an ironical air , begged for a moment 's loan of the torch . [Silver]95-silver briefly agreed , and [this emissary]2391-this emissary retired again , leaving [us]2392-us together in the dark . " There 's a breeze coming , [Jim]70-jim , "[95-silver] said [Silver]95-silver , who had by this time adopted quite a friendly and familiar tone . [I]0-i turned to the loophole nearest [me]0-i and looked out . The embers of the great fire had so far burned themselves out and now glowed so low and duskily that [I]0-i understood why [these conspirators]2393-these conspirators desired a torch . About half - way down the slope to [the stockade]1481-the stockade , [they]2393-these conspirators were collected in [a group]2395-a group ; [one]596-one held the light , another was on [his]2397-his knees in [their]2393-these conspirators midst , and [I]0-i saw the blade of an open knife shine in [his]2397-his hand with varying colours in the moon and torchlight . [The rest]599-the rest were all somewhat stooping , as though watching the manoeuvres of this last . [I]0-i could just make out that [he]2397-his had a book as well as a knife in [his]2397-his hand , and was still wondering how anything so incongruous had come in [their]2393-these conspirators possession when [the kneeling figure]2399-the kneeling figure rose once more to [his]2397-his feet and [the whole party]2400-the whole party began to move together towards [the house]228-the house . "[2413-i] And [he]2413-i cast down upon the floor a paper that [I]0-i instantly recognized none other than the chart on yellow paper , with the three red crosses , that [I]0-i had found in the oilcloth at the bottom of [the captain]234-the captain 's chest . "[596-one] " Mighty pretty , "[156-merry] said [George]156-merry . " But how are [we]3893-we to get away with it , and [us]3893-we [no ship]3894-no ship . "[156-merry] [Silver]95-silver suddenly sprang up , and supporting [himself]95-silver with a hand against the wall : " Now [I]95-silver give [you]156-merry warning , [George]156-merry , "[95-silver] [he]95-silver cried . " One more word of [your]156-merry sauce , and [I]95-silver 'll call [you]156-merry down and fight [you]156-merry . How ? Why , how do [I]95-silver know ? [You]156-merry had ought to tell [me]95-silver that [you]156-merry and [the rest]599-the rest , that lost [me]95-silver [[my]95-silver schooner]3896-my schooner , with [your]156-merry interference , burn [you]156-merry ! But not [you]156-merry , [you]156-merry ca n't ; [you]156-merry hain't got the invention of a cockroach . But civil [you]156-merry can speak , and shall , [George Merry]156-merry , [you]156-merry may lay to that . "[95-silver] " That 's fair enow , "[2420-the old man] said [the old man]2420-the old man [Morgan]104-morgan . " Fair ! [I]732-the sea - cook reckon so , "[732-the sea - cook] said [the sea - cook]732-the sea - cook . " [You]156-merry lost [the ship]755-the ship ; [I]732-the sea - cook found the treasure . Who 's [the better man]3898-the better man at that ? And now [I]732-the sea - cook resign , by thunder ! Elect whom [you]156-merry please to be [your]156-merry cap'n now ; [I]732-the sea - cook 'm done with it . "[732-the sea - cook] " [Silver]95-silver ! "[2422-they] [they]2422-they cried . " Barbecue forever ! Barbecue for [cap'n]3202-cap'n ! "[2422-they] " So that 's [the toon]3900-the toon , is it ? "[916-the cook] cried [the cook]916-the cook . " [George]156-merry , [I]916-the cook reckon [you]156-merry 'll have to wait another turn , [friend]3901-friend ; and lucky for [you]156-merry as [I]916-the cook 'm not [a revengeful man]3902-a revengeful man . But that was never [my]916-the cook way . And now , [shipmates]3903-shipmates , [this black spot]3904-this black spot ? ' Tain't much good now , is it ? [Dick]121-dick 's crossed [his]121-dick luck and spoiled [his]121-dick Bible , and that 's about all . "[916-the cook] " It 'll do to kiss the book on still , wo n't it ? "[121-dick] growled [Dick]121-dick , who was evidently uneasy at the curse [he]121-dick had brought upon [himself]121-dick . " A Bible with a bit cut out ! "[121-dick] returned [Silver]95-silver derisively . " Not it . It do n't bind no more'n a ballad - book . "[121-dick] " Do n't it , though ? "[121-dick] cried [Dick]121-dick with a sort of joy . " Well , [I]121-dick reckon that 's worth having too . "[121-dick] " Here , [Jim]70-jim here 's a cur'osity for [you]0-i , "[95-silver] said [Silver]95-silver , and [he]95-silver tossed [me]0-i the paper . It was around about the size of a crown piece . One side was blank , for it had been the last leaf ; the other contained a verse or two of Revelation these words among the rest , which struck sharply home upon [my]0-i mind : " Without are [dogs]3905-dogs and [murderers]3906-murderers . "[0-i] The printed side had been blackened with wood ash , which already began to come off and soil [my]0-i fingers ; on the blank side had been written with the same material the one word " Depposed . "[0-i] [I]0-i have that curiosity beside [me]0-i at this moment , but not a trace of writing now remains beyond a single scratch , such as [a man]318-a man might make with [his]318-a man thumb - nail . That was the end of the night 's business . Soon after , with a drink all round , [we]2425-we lay down to sleep , and the outside of [Silver]95-silver 's vengeance was to put [George Merry]156-merry up for [sentinel]2426-sentinel and threaten [him]2426-sentinel with death if [he]2426-sentinel should prove unfaithful . It was long ere [I]0-i could close an eye , and heaven knows [I]0-i had matter enough for thought in the man whom [I]0-i had slain that afternoon , in [my]0-i own most perilous position , and above all , in the remarkable game that [I]0-i saw [Silver]95-silver now engaged upon keeping [the mutineers]1384-the mutineers together with one hand and grasping with the other after every means , possible and impossible , to make [his]95-silver peace and save [his]95-silver miserable life . [He]95-silver [himself]95-silver slept peacefully and snored aloud , yet [my]0-i heart was sore for [him]95-silver , wicked as [he]95-silver was , to think on the dark perils that environed and the shameful gibbet that awaited [him]95-silver .

30

On Parole

[I]0-i WAS wakened indeed , [we]2428-we were all wakened , for [I]0-i could see even [the sentinel]2429-the sentinel shake [himself]2429-the sentinel together from where [he]2429-the sentinel had fallen against the door - post by a clear , hearty voice hailing [us]2428-we from the margin of the wood : " [Block house]2357-block house , ahoy ! "[2429-the sentinel] it cried . " Here 's [the doctor]289-the doctor . "[289-the doctor] And [the doctor]289-the doctor it was . Although [I]0-i was glad to hear the sound , yet [my]0-i gladness was not without admixture . [I]0-i remembered with confusion [my]0-i insubordinate and stealthy conduct , and when [I]0-i saw where it had brought [me]0-i among what companions and surrounded by what dangers [I]0-i felt ashamed to look [him]95-silver in the face . [He]95-silver must have risen in the dark , for the day had hardly come ; and when [I]0-i ran to a loophole and looked out , [I]0-i saw [him]95-silver standing , like [Silver]95-silver once before , up to the mid - leg in creeping vapour . " [You]0-i , [doctor]2886-doctor ! Top o ' the morning to [you]0-i , [sir]2853-sir ! "[95-silver] cried [Silver]95-silver , broad awake and beaming with good nature in a moment . " Bright and early , to be sure ; and it 's the early bird , as the saying goes , that gets the rations . [George]156-merry , shake up [your]156-merry timbers , [son]3911-son , and help [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey over [the ship]755-the ship 's side . All a - doin' well , [[your]156-merry patients]3913-your patients was all well and merry . "[95-silver] So [he]95-silver pattered on , standing on [the hilltop]2431-the hilltop with [his]95-silver crutch under [his]95-silver elbow and one hand upon the side of [the log - house]1496-the log - house quite [the old John]95-silver in voice , manner , and expression . " [We]3914-we 've quite a surprise for [you]0-i too , [sir]2853-sir , "[95-silver] [he]95-silver continued . " [We]3914-we 've [a little stranger]3916-a little stranger [here]2842-here [he]3916-a little stranger ! [he]3916-a little stranger ! [A noo boarder]3918-a noo boarder and [lodger]3919-lodger , [sir]2853-sir , and looking fit and taut as a fiddle ; slep ' like [a supercargo]3921-a supercargo , [he]3916-a little stranger did , right alongside of [John]95-silver stem to stem [we]3914-we was , all night . "[95-silver] [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey was by this time across [the stockade]1481-the stockade and pretty near [the cook]916-the cook , and [I]0-i could hear the alteration in [his]63-dr. livesey voice as [he]63-dr. livesey said , " Not [Jim]70-jim ? "[63-dr. livesey] " The very same [Jim]70-jim as ever was , "[95-silver] says [Silver]95-silver . [The doctor]289-the doctor stopped outright , although [he]289-the doctor did not speak , and it was some seconds before [he]289-the doctor seemed able to move on . " Well , well , "[289-the doctor] [he]289-the doctor said at last , " duty first and pleasure afterwards , as [you]95-silver might have said [yourself]95-silver , [Silver]95-silver . Let [us]3922-us overhaul [these patients of [yours]95-silver]3923-these patients of yours . "[289-the doctor] A moment afterwards [he]289-the doctor had entered [the block house]1542-the block house and with one grim nod to [me]0-i proceeded with [his]289-the doctor work among [the sick]2437-the sick . [He]289-the doctor seemed under no apprehension , though [he]289-the doctor must have known that [his]289-the doctor life , among [these treacherous demons]2438-these treacherous demons , depended on a hair ; and [he]289-the doctor rattled on to [[his]289-the doctor patients]2439-his patients as if [he]289-the doctor were paying an ordinary professional visit in [a quiet English family]2440-a quiet english family . [His]289-the doctor manner , [I]0-i suppose , reacted on [the men]587-the men , for [they]587-the men behaved to [him]289-the doctor as if nothing had occurred , as if [he]289-the doctor were still [ship 's doctor]3052-ship 's doctor and [they]587-the men still faithful hands before the mast . " [You]2443-the fellow with the bandaged head 're doing well , [[my]289-the doctor friend]969-my friend , "[289-the doctor] [he]289-the doctor said to [the fellow with the bandaged head]2443-the fellow with the bandaged head , " and if ever [any person]3925-any person had a close shave , it was [you]2443-the fellow with the bandaged head ; [your]2443-the fellow with the bandaged head head must be as hard as iron . " and swore . [Silver]95-silver struck the barrel with [his]95-silver open hand . "[160-si - lence] [Si - lence]160-si - lence ! " The explosion of disapproval , which nothing but [Silver]95-silver 's black looks had restrained , broke out immediately [the doctor]289-the doctor had left [the house]228-the house . [Silver]95-silver was roundly accused of playing double of trying to make a separate peace for [himself]95-silver , of sacrificing the interests of [[his]95-silver accomplices]3943-his accomplices and [victims]3944-victims , and , in one word , of the identical , exact thing that [he]95-silver was doing . [He]95-silver called [them]3945-their all [the fools]3948-the fools and dolts [you]3949-you can imagine , said it was necessary [I]108-captain smollett should talk to [the doctor]289-the doctor , fluttered the chart in [their]3945-their faces , asked [them]3945-their if [they]3945-their could afford to break the treaty the very day [they]3945-their were bound a - treasure - hunting . " And then [he]95-silver bade [them]3945-their get the fire lit , and stalked out upon [his]95-silver crutch , with [his]95-silver hand on [my]0-i shoulder , leaving them in a disarray , and silenced by [his]95-silver volubility rather than convinced . "[0-i] Slow , [lad]3213-lad , slow , " [he]95-silver said . "[3213-lad] [They]2465-they might round upon [us]2462-us in a twinkle of an eye if [we]2462-us was seen to hurry . "[3213-lad] [You]3213-lad 'll make a note of this here also , [doctor]2886-doctor , " says [he]95-silver , "[2886-doctor] and [the boy'll]2467-the boy'll tell [you]2886-doctor how [I]0-i saved [his]2467-the boy'll life , and were deposed for it too , and [you]2886-doctor may lay to that . " [Silver]95-silver was [a changed man]3954-a changed man once [he]95-silver was out there and had [his]95-silver back to [[his]95-silver friends]3955-his friends and [the block house]1542-the block house ; [his]95-silver cheeks seemed to have fallen in , [his]95-silver voice trembled ; never was [a soul more dead in earnest]3957-a soul more dead in earnest . " So saying , [he]0-i stepped back a little way , till [he]0-i was out of earshot , and there sat down upon a tree - stump and began to whistle , spinning round now and again upon [his]0-i seat so as to command a sight , sometimes of [me]95-silver and [the doctor]289-the doctor and sometimes of [[his]0-i unruly ruffians]3959-his unruly ruffians as [they]3959-his unruly ruffians went to and fro in the sand between the fire which [they]3959-his unruly ruffians were busy rekindling and [the house]228-the house , from which [they]3959-his unruly ruffians brought forth pork and bread to make the breakfast . "[95-silver] So , [Jim]70-jim , " said [the doctor]289-the doctor sadly , "[70-jim] here [you]70-jim are . As [you]70-jim have brewed , so shall [you]70-jim drink , [[my]0-i boy]2477-my boy . [Heaven]161-heaven knows , [I]0-i can not find it in [my]0-i heart to blame [you]70-jim , but this much [I]0-i will say , be it kind or unkind : when [Captain Smollett]108-captain smollett was well , [you]70-jim dared not have gone off ; and when [he]108-captain smollett was ill and could n't help it , by [George]156-merry , it was downright cowardly ! " [I]2886-doctor will own that [I]2886-doctor here began to weep . "[2886-doctor] [Doctor]2886-doctor , " [I]2886-doctor said , "[2886-doctor] [you]2886-doctor might spare [me]0-i . [I]0-i 'll give [you]95-silver a piece of advice , " [he]0-i continued as [the cook]916-the cook drew near again ; "[0-i] do n't [you]95-silver be in any great hurry after that treasure . " "[0-i] Why , [sir]2853-sir , [I]0-i do [my]0-i possible , which that ai n't , " said [Silver]95-silver . "[0-i] [I]0-i can only , asking [your]2853-sir pardon , save [my]0-i life and [the boy]2451-the boy 's by seeking for that treasure ; and [you]2853-sir may lay to that . " "[2853-sir] Well , [Silver]95-silver , " replied [the doctor]289-the doctor , "[95-silver] if that is so , [I]0-i 'll go one step further : look out for squalls when [you]95-silver find it . " "[2853-sir] [Sir]2853-sir , " said [Silver]95-silver , "[2853-sir] as between [man]2910-man and [man]2910-man , that 's too much and too little . And yet [I]0-i done [your]2853-sir bidding with [my]0-i eyes shut and never a word of hope ! But no , this here 's too much . If [you]95-silver wo n't tell [me]0-i what [you]95-silver mean plain out , just say so and [I]0-i 'll leave the helm . " "[0-i] No , " said [the doctor]289-the doctor musingly ; "[0-i] [I]0-i 've no right to say more ; it 's not [my]0-i secret , [you]95-silver see , [Silver]95-silver , or , [I]0-i give [you]95-silver [my]0-i word , [I]0-i 'd tell it [you]95-silver . But [I]0-i 'll go as far with [you]95-silver as [I]0-i dare go , and a step beyond , for [I]0-i 'll have [my]0-i wig sorted by [the captain]234-the captain or [I]0-i 'm mistaken ! And first , [I]0-i 'll give [you]95-silver a bit of hope ; [Silver]95-silver , if [we]2505-we both get alive out of this wolf - trap , [I]0-i 'll do [my]0-i best to save [you]95-silver , short of perjury . " [Silver]95-silver 's face was radiant . "[95-silver] [You]95-silver could n't say more , [I]0-i 'm sure , [sir]2853-sir , not if [you]95-silver was [[my]0-i mother]274-my mother , " [he]0-i cried . "[95-silver] Well , that 's [my]0-i first concession , " added [the doctor]289-the doctor . " [And Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey shook hands with [me]70-jim through [the stockade]1481-the stockade , nodded to [Silver]95-silver , and set off at a brisk pace into [the wood]1374-the wood .[70-jim]

The Treasure - hunt [Flint]74-flint 's Pointer

" [JIM]70-jim , "[95-silver] said [Silver]95-silver when [we]2509-we were alone , " if [I]95-silver saved [your]70-jim life , [you]70-jim saved [mine]95-silver ; and [I]95-silver 'll not forget it . [I]95-silver seen [the doctor]289-the doctor waving [you]70-jim to run for it with the tail of [my]95-silver eye , [I]95-silver did ; and [I]95-silver seen [you]70-jim say no , as plain as hearing . [Jim]70-jim , that 's one to [you]70-jim . This is the first glint of hope [I]95-silver had since the attack failed , and [I]95-silver owe it [you]70-jim . And now , [Jim]70-jim , [we]2511-we 're to go in for this here treasure - hunting , with sealed orders too , and [I]95-silver do n't like it ; and [you]70-jim and [me]95-silver must stick close , back to back like , and [we]2511-we 'll save [our]2511-we necks in spite o ' fate and fortune . "[95-silver] Just then [a man]318-a man hailed [us]2511-we from the fire that breakfast was ready , and [we]2511-we were soon seated here and there about the sand over biscuit and fried junk . [They]318-a man had lit a fire fit to roast an ox , and it was now grown so hot that [they]318-a man could only approach it from the windward , and even there not without precaution . In the same wasteful spirit , [they]318-a man had cooked , [I]0-i suppose , three times more than [we]2511-we could eat ; and one of [them]318-a man , with an empty laugh , threw what was left into the fire , which blazed and roared again over this unusual fuel . [I]0-i never in [my]0-i life saw [men]475-men so careless of the morrow ; hand to mouth is the only word that can describe [their]475-men way of doing ; and what with wasted food and sleeping sentries , though [they]318-a man were bold enough for a brush and be done with it , [I]0-i could see [their]318-a man entire unfitness for anything like a prolonged campaign . Even [Silver]95-silver , eating away , with [Captain Flint]74-flint upon [his]74-flint shoulder , had not a word of blame for [their]318-a man recklessness . And this the more surprised [me]0-i , for [I]0-i thought [he]74-flint had never shown [himself]74-flint so cunning as [he]74-flint did then . " Aye , [mates]2978-mates , "[74-flint] said [he]74-flint , " it 's lucky [you]2978-mates have Barbecue to think for [you]2978-mates with this here head . Where [they]318-a man have it , [I]74-flint do n't know yet ; but once [we]3973-we hit the treasure , [we]3973-we 'll have to jump about and find out . And then , [mates]2978-mates , [us]3973-we that has [the boats]1220-the boats , [I]74-flint reckon , has the upper hand . "[74-flint] Thus [he]74-flint kept running on , with [his]74-flint mouth full of the hot bacon ; thus [he]74-flint restored [their]2513-their hope and confidence , and , [I]0-i more than suspect , repaired [his]74-flint own at the same time . " As for hostage , "[74-flint] [he]74-flint continued , " that 's [his]74-flint last talk , [I]74-flint guess , with [them]2513-their [he]74-flint loves so dear . "[74-flint] It was no wonder [the men]587-the men were in a good humour now . For [my]0-i part , [I]0-i was horribly cast down . Should the scheme [he]2515-he had now sketched prove feasible , [Silver]95-silver , already doubly [a traitor]2516-a traitor , would not hesitate to adopt it . [He]95-silver had still a foot in [either camp]2517-either camp , and there was no doubt [he]95-silver would prefer wealth and freedom with [the pirates]3339-the pirates to a bare escape from hanging , which was the best [he]95-silver had to hope on [our]2519-our side . Nay , and even if things so fell out that [he]95-silver was forced to keep [his]95-silver faith with [Dr. Livesey]63-dr. livesey , even then what danger lay before [us]2519-our ! What a moment that would be when the suspicions of [[his]95-silver followers]2520-his followers turned to certainty and [he]95-silver and [I]0-i should have to fight for dear life [he]95-silver [a cripple]2521-a cripple and [I]0-i [a boy against [five strong and active seamen]2523-five strong and active seamen]2522-a boy against five strong and active seamen ! [We]2528-we made [a curious figure]2529-a curious figure , had [anyone]243-anyone been there to see [us]2528-we all in soiled sailor clothes and all but [me]0-i armed to the teeth . [Silver]95-silver had two guns slung about [him]95-silver one before and one behind besides the great cutlass at [his]95-silver waist and a pistol in each pocket of [his]95-silver square - tailed coat . [I]0-i had a line about [my]0-i waist and followed obediently after the sea - cook , who held the loose end of the rope , now in [his]95-silver free hand , now between [his]95-silver powerful teeth . For all [the world]2855-the world , [I]0-i was led like a dancing bear . [The other men]2532-the other men were variously burthened , some carrying picks and shovels for that had been the very first necessary [they]2532-the other men brought ashore from [the HISPANIOLA]16-the hispaniola others laden with pork , bread , and brandy for the midday meal . [All the stores]2533-all the stores , [I]0-i observed , came from [our]2528-we stock , and [I]0-i could see the truth of [Silver]95-silver 's words the night before . Water would have been little to [their]2535-his mutineers taste ; [a sailor]293-a sailor is not usually a good shot ; and besides all that , when [they]2535-his mutineers were so short of eatables , it was not likely [they]2535-his mutineers would be very flush of powder . Well , thus equipped , [we]2528-we all set out even [the fellow with the broken head , who should certainly have kept in shadow and straggled , one after another , to [the beach]313-the beach , where [the two gigs]1556-the two gigs awaited [us]2528-we]2538-the fellow with the broken head , who should certainly have kept in shadow and straggled , one after another , to the beach , where the two gigs awaited us . As [we]2528-we pulled over , there was some discussion on the chart . The red cross was , of course , far too large to be [a guide]2543-a guide ; and the terms of the note on the back , as [you]2544-you will hear , admitted of some ambiguity . They ran , [the reader]2545-the reader may remember , thus : Tall tree , [Spy - glass]51-spy - glass shoulder , bearing a point to [the N. of N.N.E. Now , right before [us]2528-we [the anchorage]3321-the anchorage was bounded by [a plateau]2548-a plateau from two to three hundred feet high , adjoining on the north the sloping southern shoulder of [the Spy - glass]3045-the spy - glass and rising again towards the south into [the rough , cliffy eminence called [the Mizzen - mast Hill]43-mizzen - mast hill]2550-the rough , cliffy eminence called the mizzen - mast hill . [The top of [the plateau]2552-the plateau]2551-the top of the plateau was dotted thickly with pine - trees of varying height . Every here and there , one of a different species rose forty or fifty feet clear above [its]2553-its neighbours , and which of these was the particular " tall tree "[74-flint] of [Captain Flint]74-flint could only be decided on the spot , and by the readings of the compass . Yet , although that was the case , [every man on board [the boats]1220-the boats]2554-every man on board the boats had picked a favourite of [his]2554-every man on board the boats own ere [we]2528-we were half - way over , [Long John]95-silver alone shrugging [his]95-silver shoulders and bidding [them]2556-them wait till [they]2556-them were there . [We]2528-we pulled easily , by [Silver]95-silver 's directions , not to weary the hands prematurely , and after quite a long passage , landed at the mouth of the second river that which runs down [a woody cleft of [the Spy - glass]3045-the spy - glass]2557-a woody cleft of the spy - glass . Thence , bending to [our]2528-we left , [we]2528-we began to ascend the slope towards [the plateau]2552-the plateau . At the first outset , heavy , miry ground and a matted , marish vegetation greatly delayed [our]2528-we progress ; but by little and little [the hill]365-the hill began to steepen and become stony under foot , and the wood to change its character and to grow in a more open order . It was , indeed , [a most pleasant portion of [the island]187-the island that [we]2528-we were now approaching]2561-a most pleasant portion of the island that we were now approaching . A heavy - scented broom and many flowering shrubs had almost taken the place of grass . Thickets of green nutmeg - trees were dotted here and there with the red columns and the broad shadow of the pines ; and the first mingled their spice with the aroma of the others . The air , besides , was fresh and stirring , and this , under the sheer sunbeams , was a wonderful refreshment to [our]2528-we senses . [The party]653-the party spread itself abroad , in a fan shape , shouting and leaping to and fro . About the centre , and a good way behind the rest , [Silver]95-silver and [I]0-i followed [I]0-i tethered by [my]0-i rope , [he]95-silver ploughing , with deep pants , among the sliding gravel . From time to time , indeed , [I]0-i had to lend [him]95-silver a hand , or [he]95-silver must have missed [his]95-silver footing and fallen backward down [the hill]365-the hill . " [He]95-silver ca n't ' a found the treasure , "[104-morgan] said [old Morgan]104-morgan , hurrying past [us]2528-we from the right , " for that 's clean a - top .
